The product I received is authentic. I've used this makeup for several years and I can't recommend it enough. You can customize the coverage you want by using more or less of it. Whether you apply 1 pass or 3-4 passes, you're skin always looks natural, flawless and glowing. Seriously, it's amazing! I alternate between the loose powder and the pressed powder, depending on the time of year. Each color comes in both options. The loose powder is supposedly better for oily skin, but my experience has been that both formulas work very fell for any skin type. The loose powder will always be slightly darker than that same color in the pressed powder. For example, my color is Radiant so in the summer when my face has more color I use the Radiant loose powder, and in the winter I use Radiant pressed powder. The Jane Iredale setting spray really is necessary to "activate" the makeup and get the flawless finish. It will also make it so that your makeup lasts practically all day. Sometimes I'll spray my face again midday to freshen it up, but I never have to reapply or touch up my makeup. So yeah, this makeup rocks, and it's healthy for your skin on top of everything else

reviewText: I am absolutely crazy about this foundation! I have dry skin and I am always looking for a foundation that doesn't make the dryness any worse (and if it improves my skin-even better!)but still offers medium -and hopefully buildable- coverage. This foundation is all that and more! First, the shade 20 Watts is PERFECT for my skin tone: I am of northern Italian descent and have fair skin with yellow undertones. I would say that this is perfect for those looking for a foundation that falls into the warm and neutral tones. Second, it makes my dry skin dewy and gorgeous-but not oily. I was a little concerned that I would look glittery or shimmery (and we have all seen people who look like they have taken a shimmer shower...and it is scary...) but the foundation gives a very subtle and natural looking glow. Third, I love the coverage. This foundation is very buildable: with half a pump of product giving very sheer coverage, and several pumps allowing for a medium to heavy coverage. I just love this stuff and hope it stays around, like, forever!

It's an okay blush. Applying it is painful whether it's done by finger, brush or sponge applicator. There's no delicate way to layer this color without rubbing my cheek raw trying to blend it in.

reviewText:
Love the smell of the cologne so I wanted to give this a try. While the smell is something approaching 'similar' to the cologne, there is something extremely off-putting about the balm. What made me truly not like this product, however, is that it felt like I was smearing a slew of synthetics all over my face and the tightness this balm left after it dried was a uniquely odd, if not uncomfortable, sensation.

After a couple of times using it and further noticing that a crust roughly the consistency of toothpaste appeared around the cap, I read the ingredients, and Lo and behold I hadn't the foggiest idea what 90% of these are:
Water, Cyclomethicone, Propylene Glycol, Fragrance, Diethylhexyl Sebacate, Hydroxyethyl Acrylate/Sodium Acryloyldimethyl Taurate Copolymer, Caprylic/Capric Triglycerides, Glycerin, Allantoin, Aluminum Starch Octenylsuccinate, Ascorbyl Palmitate, Bisabolol, Butylphenyl Methylpropional, Citronellol, Coumarin, Disodium EDTA, Galactoarabinan, Geraniol, Hexyl Cinnamal, Hydroxycitronellal, Hydroxyisohexyl 3 Cyclohexene Carboxaldehyde, Limonene, Linalool, Magnesium Aluminum Silicate, Panthenol, Phospholipids, Polysorbate 60, Retinyl Palmitate, Squalane, Tocopheryl Acetate, Triethanolamine, Xanthan Gum, Butylparaben, Ethylparaben, Isobutylparaben, Methylparaben, Phenoxyethanol, Propylparaben, Titanium Dioxide (CI 77891)

^And this list actually differs a bit from the ingredients as listed on the product I received, with the above actually reading as more benign than they read on the balm I received.

After a bit of research here's what I ultimately found regarding many of the ingredients in this product:
HIGH concerns: Neurotoxicity, Endocrine disruption, Persistence and bioaccumulation, Miscellaneous, Multiple, additive exposure sources, Irritation (skin, eyes, or lungs), Contamination concerns, Occupational hazards, Biochemical or cellular level changes
Other MODERATE concerns: Organ system toxicity (non-reproductive)
Other LOW concerns: Ecotoxicology, Data gaps, Enhanced skin absorption

Needless to say, this aftershave balm is now in the garbage.

It is at the very least disappointing to pay nearly $30 for an aftershave balm that it in all likelihood harmful to one's health with sustained use.

I mean... $30. This carcinogenic goop is the best Calvin Klein can do?

I used to buy these five plus years ago & was crazy about them. They smelled great, left no sticky residue & were perfect for quick clean ups.  I just bought these for our baby & they left a filmy residue on him, still smell great but he felt like he needed a bath after using them.

I love these wipes. I originally went looking for a face wipe to help Lincoln when he was first born because he didn't need a bath everyday. So i got these wipes for first thing the am and before bed. Now i use them to freshen him up before leaving or anytime he needs a bit of calming or just a quick clean up. I get so many complements about how good lincoln smells all the time. and I truly believe that at night when i am putting on his pj's...it calms him down and relaxes him so that his bed time ritual is smooth...I highly recommend these wipes. They are truly both my and my sons favorite part of the day......amongst others of course...
summary: Calming Favorite part of the day

Very good moisturizer.  The SPF in it seems to be pretty good.  I bought this because I read in another review that it doesn't burn your eyes.  This is true most times, if you do get some in your eyes it does burn or irritate a little but no where near the amount that regular sun screen would. 9 out of 10 I just use 3-4 squirts and mixed with a little water to spread around and it does fine.  Only when I use a lot and it really gets in my eyes does it burn a little.

My face has both very dry and very oily places.  This moisturizer works very well.  I use it right after shaving in the morning.  It keeps my skin, especially the dry areas of my cheeks from looking dessicated.  Ok, that's a bit of an overstatement, but I can tell by looking in the mirror this moisturizer does the trick.  And the fact that it protects against sun damage is an added bonus, especially on weekends when I tend to be outside more.  It takes about three pumps to get enough to massage into my skin.  The amount that comes out per pump is very small.  I've been using this for a few weeks and am guessing at this rate it will last a couple of months.  The price is reasonable compared to other products out there.  And it doesn't leave any smell on my skin.  And it doesn't hurt at all even if I put it on immediately after shaving.
Okay.  It is a men's product and I'm a woman, but I like it for under makeup.  Not greasy.  Skin responds well to it.  Has the added plus of the SPF.

He smells great and many people compliment him on his skin. We use california baby wash in the tub,  but this lotion after ...and the cold cream works wonder on wind burned cheeks and teething rash!

Arrived in a timely manner and was just as I expected. Will order this product again!

I used this product as directed for stretch marks and also used it on my face. I went though an entire 6oz tube. It was an okay moisturizer... didn't notice much of a difference in fine lines but I don't have many to begin with. As far as stretch marks go, I had some very new ones appear and started applying this product maybe one week after. Not only did it not improve any appearance of the existing stretch marks, but several more appeared in the area. I am not saying it caused them to appear, but it certainly didn't help prevent them.
One thing I did notice about the cream was that there is some sort of dye in it that stained my clothing. It did come out in the wash, but it leaves me to assume that the cream doesn't do anything chemically to the skin and just tries to mask the marks with a dye, like makeup would.
I would have given one star, but I suppose it is a decent moisturizer. Not work the money though. If I were you, I'd try something different.

Be careful if you purchase this cream to try and combat wrinkles.  I am 48 and I have sensitive skin. I used it just like the directions said and my skin swelled up so bad it looked like I was deformed! I had to stop using the cream and my skin did go back to normal after 3 days thankfully but it was horrible to go through that.  They did refund my money after I called so I had no problem with that part. Just be very careful and DO NOT BUY if you have sensitive skin.

I love this cream!  It is expensive (Costco, people...on coupon a few times a year!), but worth every penny.  I'm closing in on 30 (I know, I know), but I smoked for 16 years and with a French-Swedish gene pool, I have fair skin and have always been in the sun - so, wrinkles.  Not just any wrinkles, but full on all the way from my eyes to the bottom of my cheekbones.  I have only been using StriVectin for a few weeks, but I love it!  It really moisturizes and you only use a little tiny dab.  The first few times I used it, I couldn't break the habit of using a lot of facial moisturizer, and I ended up with enough to cover my face, neck, chest and arms with the amount that I used to use only on my face!  It smells mildy medicinal, but I find it very pleasing; it seems relaxing at bedtime but refreshing in the morning.  I feel like it's probably cheaper than what I used to get the Olay Regenerist at because I went through a bottle of Regenerist in a month and I have barely noticed a difference in how much is still in my bottle of StriVectin after a few weeks!  My mom is actually why I ended up buying this, because she used it for about 6 months and she and lots of ladies from church, as well as myself, noticed how much younger she looked. Radiant, even.  She used to break out a lot, and I did too, but I haven't seen any of the cystic acne that we both used to get so frequently (especially during our cycles).  Even though it feels slightly greasy, my skin is clear and beautiful, and now that it's allergy season and sunny and windy, my face doesn't feel tight and dry after the morning is over.  My face feels comfortable ALL DAY!  That right there will keep me coming back.  With how little you use, this stuff is actually cheap.  Please give it a try!

I recieved this product as a gift for Christmas. I have two kids and I am 25 years old. I recently lost all of my baby weight (30 lbs) and I was lamenting over my stretch marks on my stomach and sides. The worst marks are on the front of my stomach. I began using the cream this christmas eve and have used it three times daily since. I have noticed a difference in the area where the marks were the worst. The not so bad marks have not faded much but the depth and color of the deepest stretch marks have almost evened out with the the rest of them. My husband and mother also noticed the difference. I also noticed the peppermint smell but it doesn't bother me at all. I will continue to use it and see what happens.

I would never expect it to completely get rid of my stretch marks, however. That would just be ridiculous.
summary: Never thought I would see conspiracy theories over a cream but...

reviewText: THESE PADS REALLY WORK.  GOOD AND GENTLE EXFOLLIATION.

When I was reading reviews for the popular Glycolix 10% and 20% GA pads and trying to decide which concentration to buy, for some reason the 15% didn't immediately come up in the product listing and also had the fewest reviews. I ended up going with the 15%, reasoning that if this concentration was too strong I would use them less frequently or just wash my face 10 minutes after application until my skin could tolerate them. But as it happened, the 15% were just right for me and I've been using them every night for a few weeks and have started to see some improvements in my skin tone. I have dry skin and somewhat larger pores on my nose, but otherwise no acne or other real skin problems. How I use them: every night after washing my face, I pat it dry and then wipe one Glycolix pad over the skin of my face and neck and upper chest. There is enough product in each wipe to cover that much area and then some. I avoid my eyelids and the area between my nose and upper lip (the skin there is just a bit too sensitive on my face) but I do my entire neck, top to bottom and ear to ear, and my chest to the same point you might see if wearing a v-neck t-shirt. I do not wash it off afterwards. I do sometimes wait 30 minutes or so and then add some moisturizer or coconut oil over the drier parts of my face. And then I go to bed, so it stays on as well as anything can overnight. In the morning I wash my face in the shower, then moisturize and also put on a strong sunscreen (I use Neutrogena Ultra Sheer Liquid Sunblock, SPF 70, 1.4 Ounce). The short term results have been really smooth skin, and this is most noticeable on my neck and chest, where I've never exfoliated or really done any skin maintenance. It tingles and itches going on those areas (still does, even after 3 weeks) and the skin has become very, very smooth - like baby-smooth. My face also became a bit softer and smoother, but since I've exfoliated it pretty regularly over the years, the difference wasn't as pronounced. The 3 week results have been a very gradual smoothing of the freckles and other dark spots on my skin, a very slight fading. I can still see the pores on my nose, but my makeup has been going on smoother and the skin looks silkier and more glowing. It's about the same effect that having a professional facial gives me, only I have this effect every day now and not just the day or two after the facial. That's pretty cool, since I pay about $60 or more for a facial and a third that for these pads. I haven't had any irritation, though I have noticed some dry skin flaking on my cheeks and the sides of my nose - this is the "peel" part of the acid, not a true peel where large amounts of skin come off as they do when you have a sunburn or serious chemical peel at the dermatologist, but just small amounts of surface cells being shed. A good moisturizer helps. I think I'm going to use the 15% for another month, then buy the Topix Glycolix Elite Treatment Pads 20% 60 Pads for my face and continue using the 15% for my neck and chest. I highly recommend this product as something inexpensive but really effective, and the batch I got is the real deal.

It is a beautiful lipstick and I love how it glides on my lips. It is soft and long-lasting. I love how it doesn't make my lips look "old." It does hydrate my lips and the color stays on for a long time. I love lipstick and lip glosses and this is the first time I have ever tried Jouer and so far, I like this brand. I normally don't spend this much on lipstick as a mom of tweens, I just don't have the time to even swipe on lipstick before rushing out the door. The only problem I have with this is that Vine gave me this shade, which is a lot brighter and a lot pinker than what it seems on the screen of my computer. I am not a bright pink lipstick kind of lady ... I am more into the roses and mauves. So fair warning, this shade is a bit brighter than what it seems on the computer screen.

Other than that, I am pleased with this product. Who knows? Maybe the bright pink will grow on me.

I had high hopes and maybe that is where my problem started; with expectations. What in the holy heck is this stuff? Who is rating it a FIVE?
Whew, ok, I used this for the first time before going out to a social event. I tap tap tapped it on my part (where most of my gray/thinning is) "generously" as suggested. It was like I spread rapid tan on my face as the "fibers" befell up my forehead, nose, and chin. I looked like a Suburban PTA mom slash coal miner. I suddenly had hysterical black lung hacking until I realized that it wasn't black lung, but rather a near panic attack from my attempts to clean my face from the unexpected falling fibers syndrome. This act of failed facial cleansing had me in a brief perimenopausal hot flash that combined beads of sweat, panic, and whateverthehell these fibers were that were completely obedient to gravity. Ok, so, In summary.... A) No, B) I looked all dirty and stuff, C) I still had muh grays but now they were mixed with fibers (aka DIRT!) and D) I spent the rest of my evening compulsively wiping my forehead even though I was unable to see myself which turned into a secondary mild panic attack that I was somehow spreading DIRT all over my face, and E) No, again. Just no. I am sticking with my $12.95 CVS brand of root touch up that happens to give an illusionary experience of thicker hair. Now, my trust issues are all up and spiky because everyone raved over this stuff and threw all these stars at it. I'll be okay. Thanks. But I WILL be sending this back. Along with all the other crap I am "going to send back"..... another story there....

Based on the Amazon reviews, I decided to try this Paul Mitchell shampoo.  It was pretty decent shampoo and I liked the tingle.  I had used about 1/3 of the bottle when I saw the same shampoo on sale at a salon.  It was a good price so I got another bottle.  It looked like the same stuff (same bottle, same shampoo color & consistency) but what made me suspicious was the difference in smell.

The primary scent of the shampoo from Amazon is tea tree oil (sort of similar to Pine-Sol).  The primary scent of the stuff from the salon is peppermint with a background tea tree oil scent (a much nicer smell overall).  Then I used the salon stuff to wash my hair.  Wow, what a difference.  The salon stuff had a better tingle, it created a much thicker lather, rinsed cleaner, and left my hair with more body. Over the next four days, I tested my theory by washing my hair with the Amazon-bought shampoo one day and the salon-bought shampoo the next day.

RESULT: The salon shampoo was FAR superior and I am certain I have been had.  I give the counterfeit shampoo two stars because it wasn't bad, but the real Paul Mitchell shampoo is so much better and I paid for the good stuff.

I love Amazon, but they need to get to the bottom of this.  I am willing to donate some of my fake Paul Mitchell shampoo for testing.  Just send me an email.
summary: Sadly, this stuff is counterfeit.  The real Paul Mitchell shampoo is fantastic.

reviewText: I have super sensitive skin, and deal with razor burn neck constantly.  Proraso with a good razor (I like the Hydro 5), and Pinaud Clubman talc afterwards, and I've never had a closer and less painful shave.  Think I'll use this the rest of my life as long as they keep making it.

It smells lovely and it creates a very thick, creamy lather.  He says using it is like going to the spa each morning when he shaves.  He loves the hot lather and the menthol scent.  I purchased him the sensitive skin cake cream by the same company, he prefers this.
This cream produces a great thick cream. Not too wet, not too foamy. Very rich and lathery. I've had great close shaves with no irritation. I've definitely become a loyal Proraso customer.

This is your basic shaving cream. It whips up very easily in a mug or on your brush. When you rinse with cold water, you definitely feel the menthol come through, as it's very cool and refreshing.

I use a variety of shave products, and this is a great go-to daily-use cream, as it's definitely on-par with many more expensive products out there.

Lastly, if you rinse with water after shaving with this, you can feel free to put on any scent aftershave you want, as the menthol doesn't linger, which is nice, IMO.

reviewText: I have very sensitive skin and was recommended this brand by a friend. Bought this cream and the eucalyptus and menthol are very soothing in between passes. This product has really helped turning an unpleasant experience in shaving into an enjoyable one.

Been shaving for decades, but I never knew that a brand of shaving cream could make such a difference!

Great stuff. Shaving feels wonderful.

Smells a little unusual but not unpleasant to me. Comes out of tube easily, perhaps a tiny bit too easily.  Big tube, should last a long time.

This stuff is awesome!  Is it the ONLY cream I use? No. But I keep it steady in rotation.

I used to break out horribly after shaving using the mass marketed stuff with rash and irritation. I then discovered wet shaving with a dual edge safety blade and WOW what a difference. If you are able to use the Mach-50 or whatever they call them these days more power to you.

Back when I first started shaving I could've shaved with the same Mach-3 cartdridge for an entire school year...rust deposits and all. Sadly those days are gone and my beard would now give a cheese grater a run for its money.  With that said . . . canned shaving cream also seemed to make the whole shaving thing a royal pain in the patella as it was drying and irritating to my skin. Again . . . if you can get away with the canned stuff count yourself very fortunate. In my teens a can of shaving cream would last me 2 years. Go figure.

To each his own as far as his methods are concerned. Lets talk about this cream now.  It comes in a huge tube and does look like it's something out of my grandfather's era.  I consider the tube to be a generous supply for the price. It smells slightly medicinal but in a good clean way. I especially enjoy using this stuff during the hot summer months or while on vacation. The tingle and smell is therapeutic and not overwhelming. It does not smell like you slopped a jar of Vicks vaporub on your face. It's more pleasant, yet some people just aren't fans of Eucalyptus.

The cream provides a great lather when paired with a decent shave bowl and brush. A little goes a long way. Squeeze a bead the size of nickel or dime in the bowl depending on how much lather you like. Wet your brush with warm water. Mix the cream in the bowl. You may add a few more drops of water to get the consistency you desire. Remember that the lather is on your brush and not in your bowl. Apply lather, shave, and rinse.

I usually apply the lather for a minimum of 2 passes. More often 3. When I have a date with the little lady I go the extra mile with a 4th pass. Back to front. Front to back. Top to bottom. Bottom to top. If you enjoy the smell of your cream apply a little behind your ears and rub it in.

Follow up with a toner based bump preventer if you're prone to razor bumps and then after shave. Lastly apply a shaving lotion.

If you stick with a routine your skin will be clear, your face soft, and the woman happy. Using products like this make shaving a little more enjoyable. I think I'll go shave right now!
summary: Great product! Not to be used as toothpaste in a drunken stupor.

reviewText: Prorason shaving cream is great.  It lathers up fully.  I don't even use soap anymore.  Instead, I use pre-shave oil and then lather up with my brush and proraso shaving cream. Everyone I've told about this stuff has been immediately hooked! Buy it, you will not regret it!

I was looking for a hair dryer made in USA.  Or, at least, NOT made in China.  I searched google and found some USA-made possibilities.  One had too many bad reviews, such as melting and ceased to function after a year or so.  If it's that bad, it might as well be made in China.  Another hair dryer was claimed to be made in USA, but a reviewer revealed that it was not.  This was the best alternative for "NOT made in China".  Sure, it costs about twice as much as Chinese-made hair dryers (and significantly less than the USA-made one), but I suspect it will last at least twice as long, saving me money in the log run.

It looks good.  It's got a nice long cord.  It dries my hair well.  It works as I expect.  And it says on the box "Made in Italy".

My previous dryer was a Revlon RV544 Tourmaline 1875 dryer.  I was looking for a faster hair dryer and so I settled on this Elchim.  Some notes:
- While the Elchim pushes air faster, it's nozzle is somewhat smaller than that of the Revlon, so the overall rate of volume or airflow could very well be the same. For me this was disappointing-- I wanted something with significantly higher airflow.
- The "warm" setting is truly warm, and not too hot.  I did like this.
- So far, both high and low settings have sufficiently dried my hair without ever burning it. I like this feature, too.
- I do wish it had a "cold shot" button, a button I could press to temporarily interrupt the heat settings.
Overall it's better than what I had, so I'm fairly satisfied with this dryer.

Update- someone asked where it's made. The box says it's made in Italy.

I was hesitant to purchase these because they are more expensive.  These gloves are better than the others on the market in my opinion.  The gel lining means that I can use cuticle oil or my own moisturizer and it isn't absorbed by the glove and won't seep through to my sheets.  There is still excess lotion left on my hands the next morning, so my hands have had a full nights treatment.  The gloves still seem to be breathable, so my hands (and I use their socks too) don't get sweaty and the skin doesn't have that "soaked in water too long" look.  The outside of the gloves are fabric and are not slick, so I can pick things up.  The thin "gel" layer gives a little thickness to the glove so don't expect to do fine detail work, but they are comfortable enough that I don't think about them during the night.  I put some lotion on my hands and slip these on right before bedtime and when I wake up my skin is soft and smooth. No more rough cuticles either.  If you are going to go to the trouble of wearing these, I recommend spending a little more and going with these.
summary: These gloves are better than the others on the market in my opinion

reviewText:
Obviously the packaging is not the seller's fault, but Babyliss'! I scratched my flat iron trying to cut off the vice grips holding the flat iron to the plastic/cardboard packaging.
The flat iron is great! Hardly ever snags my hair like my previous conair, very smooth passes. Straightens and curls nicely. Takes a while to heat up but once it does, works perfectly, otherwise you will be making several passes for pin-straight hair. I have lots of medium naturally straight hair. Would re-purchase if I had to.

I have lots and lots of medium texture, wavy hair. I use a straightening iron after I blow dry to get the frizzies out. This iron works very well for me. It has a detachable comb on it that works well as a straightening aid but created a little gap where your hair can get caught. Once caught, you pretty much have to break your hair to get it free. I usually manage to avoid this trap by working with smaller sections of hair so I can keep my hair away from the insertion point where the comb slides into the base of the iron. If I try to straighten my hair without the comb, it gets caught big-time so I must ALWAYS use the comb.

Pros:
- even temperature, so it does not singe the hair or have "hot spots" (ceramic surface is key for even heat distribution)
- generous width and length so it doesn't take forever to do my hair

Cons:
- hair gets caught in the insertion point for the detachable comb.
- does not have a tangle proof cord
summary: Great iron but beware of the teeth

I liked the power, heat, and weight of this hairdryer. Unfortunately, it suddenly stopped working after 11 months. I don't expect an appliance like a hairdryer to have a long lifespan, but less than one year is unacceptable. It seems the company honors its warranty, and the dryer is very nice for the price, but I've decided to move on to a different brand.

My daughter and I have been sharing this hair dryer for 2 years now. Here is what we have found are the pros and cons.

Pros:
Fast drying. To me that is the most important consideration.
Hair is noticeably smooth and shiny.

Cons:
Heavy compared to other dryers. This does not bother me, and I am mid-50s.
Quite loud; but then hair dryers are all pretty loud.
The controls are on the handle so your hand puts pressure on them when you hold the dryer. I have not had a problem with accidentally changing the control. However, after only a few months of use, the switch started to not have good contact in the High position. We have to turn it on to Low, and then try switching to High multiple times to get it to turn on to High. This is frustrating when you are in a hurry to get ready for work. Maybe I just happened to get a defective one, but I think it may be inherent in the design with the switch getting constant pressure from your hand.

Overall, I like this dryer; but I will have to replace it if the switch problem gets any worse.
summary: Great power, but has switch problem

I used it every night with moisturizer directly afterwards and it made the skin around my nose and upper lip get extremely dry, cracked, and painful to the point where only neosporin all over it for two days helped. I waited until my skin was healed and tried again, rubbing it in very gently every other night. I never got the horror I did the first try, but it just made my skin even more dry than it was before, even when I put moisturizer on immediately after using it. Now, to be completely fair, the product does its job - it did get the dry skin flakes off of my face. However, because my skin is a bit more sensitive than they probably intended this product for, it just made things worse for me. I ended up switching over to using  the St. Ives pads with an AHA and it works great. I would not recommend this face scrub for sensitive skinned people, especially not without a very good moisturizer!

reviewText: good

This stuff is amazing. Smells heavenly.
After reading through more reviews, someone suggested stirring it to improve consistency. I did that. Seems to have helped.
Update: after using this product twice I had a severe allergic reaction. I broke out in an itchy rash overall the areas I applied it to. After much research I found out that it was caused by one of the ingredients called methylisothiazolinone (MCI or MI). It's a somewhat common ingredient used in many hair products , house cleaners , and some body care products. It really is a shame because I loved this product. The smell was great and lasted forever. I am returning it for that reason alone. I suggest applying it to a small test area first to see if you will have a reaction before continuing to use it. Don't let this deter you from purchasing it. From what I've read these reactions are rare (lucky me). I just felt the need to caution people to what might happen if you are allergic to that ingredient. I've set up a refund with no issue from seller.

I've loved Joy since my teens (I'm in my mid 40s now). At that time, my mother was an employee of Higbees department store. She had an employee discount card for 25% off, and on one day a year employees could combine it with an additional 25% off. And that's when I discovered Joy. One day a year Mom would buy me a new bottle. Sadly, even the upscale department stores in town no longer carry Joy.

Its key scents are rose and jasmine - classic and never out of style. This scent is fresh, attractive, and not overpowering like my mother's signature scent, Youth Dew.  I love Youth Dew, but cannot wear it in warm weather or spray it liberally. Joy, on the other hand, is never clingy or overpowering on me. I love it so much that I purchased a Joy smell-alike massage oil from a business I see at a yearly festival I attend.

A word of warning about the purchase of expensive perfumes from online, though. I see Amazon is both the seller and shipper here. That's good news. Amazon is not going to sell counterfeits. They're a powerhouse seller with a reputation to uphold. Beware purchases on eBay or no name sites or companies. Scammers go to a great deal of trouble to create look alike packaging for their fake scents. I also assumed that buying used older bottles would be a way to save money, but it turns out they'll even partially fill real, used bottles with the fake stuff. I got burned on the second bottle of Joy I bought at one of those sites, but next bottle I buy will be from Amazon! Look it up online, and you'll be shocked at the sites showing the minute differences between a real bottle and a fake one.

I just received my Joy in the mail today.  Packaging was excellent - the fragrance however is not quit what I remember it to be 40 years ago.  I won't return it... maybe it's my bodies Pheromones today... Perhaps another application after a hot show at home tonight will make me re-think this fragrance.  THIS JOY reminds me of a Drugstore Classic:  **CHARLIE**  I know that sounds ridiculous but it does.  I am not fully convinced that this is the Real Thing.  Just might be a Real Joy Bottle that was rejected off of the assembly line in the Quality Control Phase and obviously this would not be thrown out.  Maybe that is why the price for 2.5 ounces is so low.  I might give Macy's Department store a call and see if their bottle's label is the same as mine.. You'd think that a Perfume as high caliber as JOY would have some detectible labeling on the bottle.
 JUST SAYIN'
summary: Not what I remember it to be...

I used this after having a hair transplant hoping to "keep my new hairs/keep what I have" and only after 3 years, a significant portion of my transplanted hairs fell out plus my original hair.  Why?  What the transplant surgeon didn't tell me and none of the reviews of LaserComb mention are the nutritional needs your body requires to maintain and grow hair.  Are you low in iron?  Hair won't re-grow if you are.  My one meal-a-day plus snacks wasn't meeting my body's dietary needs.  I have to take a liquid iron supplement and eat iron fortified cereal everyday to rebuild my reserves.  I take Super Saw Palmetto vitamin to block DHT from making my hair fall out (by the way, the hairs that were transplanted from the back of my head to the front were supposed to be "immune" from the effects of DHT but still fell out).  I take a vitamin daily of each of the following: Mega Green Tea Extract, Grapeseed Extract, and Taurine to nourish/effect the follicles on the cellular level.  From the vitamin supplements alone, I've noticed a decrease in hair loss and hairs are thicker.

My regimen is to take the vitamins, use the laser 3 times a week and *very important*: rest, exercise, and drinking plenty of water.  I'm just beginning to follow this "healthy lifestyle" and have noticed a few new hairs popping up in the bare sections of my head (the jury is still out whether the laser comb will grow dense hair - consider the 4 stars as preliminary).  I'll update my post over the next few months.  Good luck to everyone!

reviewText:

Love that it makes the big wavy curls in my hair, but the curls don't last all day. I have normal thick and naturally straight hair. Using this curling iron gives it the perfect big waves for the first couple hours (I don't use any product like hairspray). As the evening goes on, not even close to humid conditions (SoCal), the curls start to fall flat. My hair doesn't go quite to its usual straight, but it's nowhere near the original bouncy curls & waves I left the house with. Have also tried to increase the heat temperature but that didn't make a difference. The Marcel handle took some getting used to, but with practice without it plugged in, got the hang of it (checked out a couple YouTube tutorials for assistance).

In comparison, when I use my HerStyler flat iron (purchased from one of the kiosks at the mall) to curl my hair, the curls last until I wash them out (even a couple days after) and without any hairspray product. Could be a difference in the metals used in both tools?

As an experiment I did every few strands on my head with this Marcel Curling Iron, and alternated with curling a few strands with my HerStyler flat iron (in the morning before work). By early evening (without any wild head movement, as I work in an office), I was able to distinguish which strands were curled with which tool.

I'll keep this Marcel Curling Iron, stick to using it for nights out (since the curls seem to have a deadline on how long they'll last), but I definitely won't be getting rid of my HerStyler flat iron. Would probably recommend it to friends with thinner or shorter hair.

I just finished using this and was happy to see the final results.  I started with hair that is naturally curly and took a lot of sectioned blowdrying and sectioned straightening just to get it looking decent.  After using this product I was able to let it mostly air dry (which in the past I could not do if I wanted to wear it straight) then blowdry and straighten in 10 minutes without having to section and yank my hair straight with a paddle brush the whole time.

I did use this product on my own to save myself hundreds of dollars.  I did a test run the night before with a single strand to make sure that my hair wouldn't have a bad reaction. I did the best I could with following the directions that come with this product.  It does require you to do the application of the products quickly!  This is where an experienced stylist would come in handy - the process of sectioning your hair and applying the products is tough, but do-able.  You're supposed to take 10 minutes to apply the first product and I took closer to 15, but took that into account while I waited for it to process.

After rinsing and blowdrying for the first time I was discouraged.  I have blonde highlights and they looked fried... like someone who's bleached their hair too many times.  I kept going with the process, hoping that by the end my hair would not look so unhealthy.  Thankfully, that ended up being the case.  My hair feels soft and although I can tell that my ends and highlights are a bit dryer than usual, it's minimal and not something anyone else would notice - a bit of shine serum helps.  I'm sure too that a salon would have gotten the hair near my hairline around my face straighter... I have small little curls around my face and some of them are still there. Since the directions say to apply 1/4 inch from the scalp, I didn't want to get too close to my hairline.

The end result is worth the 3 hours this took me.  It takes me a quarter of the time to style my hair, and looks ten times better than it used to.  FYI, you need additional tools to apply this product properly that aren't included.  I ended up purchasing and using: an application brush/gloves/cape (got all 3 from Sallys Beauty for less than $5), fine tooth comb and wide tooth comb, Ion Protector (you apply this to your hair before processing to protect it), Bio Ionic hydrating conditioner and hydrating shampoo, flat iron, blowdryer, paddle brush or round brush, hand held mirror (if applying yourself, to see the back of your head).

I received this in a subscription box where I pay a bimonthly fee and the curator chooses products for me based on a quiz I fill out about my hair (called SHtrands if you are interested).  This brand is new to me.  I have the "ProQuinoa complex" shampoo with sage since it appears that multiple items have been listed on this page in the past.

My particular hair concerns were frizz and color protection.  I have naturally light colored hair that I dye black, and it can get kind of brassy looking in the summer.  And I exercise a lot, so I have to shampoo every day.  My hair tends to dry out because of this, which leads to frizz, since I live in Georgia and it is summertime.

This is a sulfate-free shampoo and I do find myself using a lot of it, which is the reason I have taken off one star.  I am going to run out of my bottle in a few weeks.  When I use a lot, I can actually get something that approaches a pretty good lather.  This has a somewhat coconutty scent (I really can't smell the sage at all) and no artificial dyes.  It rinses out of my hair without leaving residue (doesn't make the shower slippery, either, which some sulfate free shampoos can do) and I do feel that my hair is clean afterwards.

With regards to color protection, my hairdresser did a semi-permanent color rinse a few weeks back to try to get rid of some of the brassiness (in her professional opinion this would look best and I trust her judgment).  And, that is still working, despite washing my hair every day in between.  My roots (with permanent dye) are also looking good.  So I am happy with the color protection aspect of this product.

With respect to frizz, this isn't doing much.  It doesn't promise to, so I am not going to lower my rating because of that.  But if you are looking for a multifunctional hair product, this might not be it.  (I use detanglers and oils afterwards to control frizz and if you do that, this could still work for you.)  It may be just too difficult to overcome the Georgia summer humidity.  But I still have to use all my anti-frizz products after I wash my hair.

You can see the full ingredients list on the product page if you zoom in on the images.  It isn't 100% natural or anything like that, but it does have a somewhat less "chemical" list of ingredients than a lot of shampoos I've tried.  (For me, that's neither here nor there.  I am primarily concerned that it works and doesn't irritate my scalp or make my hair fall out, and this passes all three of those tests.)

Overall, I like this, but I don't think it is going to end up being THE shampoo for me.
summary: good for color protection but I find I have to use quite a lot

UPDATE: My original review is below, and it's true - these drops do work. However, after a while of playing around with Drip Dry versus a Quick Dry Topcoat (I use Sally Hanson), I haven't found a situation where it was beneficial to use the drops instead of the topcoat.  A quick dry topcoat also provides "ding proofing" fairly quickly, but additionally, later dries to a hard topcoat.  With the drops, I often found myself painting, use Drip Dry, then maybe the next day applying top coat and applying Drip Dry to that... I still wanted my color to be protected. Perhaps if you were using a matte finish polish, or had multi-step nail art that you didn't want to seal in yet then Drip Dry would be the way to go, but otherwise, I'd say go with a rapid dry top coat for sure.

-----------
Original Review:
I really don't understand the reviews saying this doesn't work, because I find the drops function exactly as the package says - mostly dry after a few minutes, and completely dry after 30 minutes.  My routine the past few weeks has been a base coat, 2 coats of color, Drip Dry drops, and wait 30 minutes (it's completely dry).  Then I apply clear top coat, Drip Dry drops again, and wait 20-ish minutes until I feel like I can go to bed without imprinting them.  When I wake up, my nails are perfect, and drying both the color and top coat with the drops works perfectly. This is a great product, and I will probably keep using it as long as I'm painting my nails.
summary: EDIT: Works but Why Not Use Fast Dry Topcoat?

reviewText: Good quality. Great shave!

It was my very first Safety Razor, so at first I would cut myself quite often on it.

Now that I have gotten the hang of the technique of using it, I can't go back to those lame disposable razors.

The only con is the way you go about loosening it up and changing the razors. There is a lot of room for error and you can easily cut yourself if you are not careful.

I highly recommend this to anyone who wants a cleaner shave.

Also, I travel a lot and use this case:
https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B001O8NCI4/ref=oh_aui_search_detailpage?ie=UTF8&psc=1

As recommended by several Shaving websites, this is a good razor for someone diving into the Safety Razor field like I was.  I keep a very neat beard so my shave has to be pretty accurate and controlled - as opposed to swiping the full naked face.  It's light, even though it has a nice long handle.  It's also a very mildly aggressive razor (read online to learn differences on razor aggressiveness). I quickly learned that it wasn't as aggressive as I'd have liked and the Merker blade wasn't the highest quality.  Overall I'm happy with it and will keep to touch up around my nose and lip areas. It's also good for quick touch up cleaning that I seem to be always doing (too particular, I know), which I tend to do with only a quick splash of water.  I'd suggest anyone getting into the Safety Razor gig to purchase the sample blades that you can get on Amazon.  30 blades (2 per brand) will help you decide what blade is best for you.  I will say that the Feather brand blades are wickedly sharp!  Even in this razor.  BTW - I just purchased a Parker Adjustable razor for doing the majority of my face.
summary: As recommended by several Shaving websites

I've been dealing with hormonal cystic acne for a while and this stuff clears it up so well, sometimes even overnight. After taking good care of my face for years (micellar water/toning/exfoliating/limited and special makeup, etc!) and wondering why I've still had to deal with acne like that, it's great to find something that helps!

I have suffered from cystic acne for a while. I don't tend to get pimples with clear whiteheads often but I'll get a cystic pimple every week or so and it will be huge and painful and will scar like nobody's business. I bought the Buffering Lotion because it had amazing reviews and what I have noticed is that yes, it does work for those problematic cystic pimples but only if you catch it before it turns into something noticeable. With cystic acne, you tend to feel them underneath the skin and your skin will be slightly plump and red. That's when you need to use the lotion. I basically put some on it every time I go to the bathroom, repeating the application at least 3 times in the same session until it dries and I have found that this is super useful. I do the same thing day after day until I can't see/feel it at all anymore and that's been awesome. It doesn't really work for me in regards to already existing cystic pimples. You basically have to let those subside on their own, just don't touch them.

reviewText: So far this stuff is really doing wonders for my skin!

I found Mario Bedescu products after doing some beauty regimen searches on the internet.  I've been using the Acne Facial Cleanser for almost a year & love it.  My favorite MB product though is the Buffering Lotion!  I suffer from adult onset cystic acne & the only time my chin was ever clear was when I was on birth control.  If you are a cystic acne sufferer, you know how painful they can be...I would often have to go get cortisone shots just to help reduce them.  When I started using MB products, I thought I would give this a try....it helps like nothing I've ever tried before....even prescription products.  When I start to feel that I'm getting one, I almost immediately rub this stuff on it in the morning & at night.  The cystic acne that used to take WEEKS to clear up now clears up in less than a week...& for me, that is a huge plus.  I'm always sure to really rub it into the skin & even apply a thicker amount at night & let it sit. For cystic acne sufferers, this is a must have!

I'm lucky to have good skin - great skin, even.  (Can't take any credit for it, can only thank genetics).  However, when I do break out once in a blue moon, what emerges in the single, large, frightening, DEEP blemish (blemish is far too pretty a word for it) - the kind of thing that I stare fearfully at in the mirror and think that it's just a matter of time before it develops features, opens its eyes and starts talking to me.

I developed one of those beauties recently and it was stubbornly resistant to everything I threw at it.  I stumbled upon the buffering lotion and what the hell, I gave it a try.  It's been two days so far.  The blemish has not yet completely vanished, but overnight, the redness disappeared and it turned into a barely noticeable bump.

I've only used this for a couple days, so this is far from a thorough review based on extensive testing.  But no matter, the early results are more than enough for me to make permanent room for it in my medicine cabinet.
Unlike most Acne cleaners, this is very gentle and doesnt smell like medication!  Only takes a small amount and surprisingly, does wonders for taking off makeup!

This is the best curl product I have ever used!! My hair is type 3A and extremely prone to frizz, dryness and irregular curl patterns (that's probably from years of flat ironing though). Every other gel or mousse I've used has expanded my hair too much and gave me poofy frizzy curls, which I don't like. I've been a victim of flat ironing and blow drying because I just could not manage my natural hair type without me looking like Helena Bonham Carter on a bad hair day. I just pat my hair dry with a knit cotton shirt, brush it out (I know brushing curls is ill-advised but it helps to relax mine as well as evenly distribute product), and apply about a nickel sized amount throughout my hair. Brush it again, make about 7-9 sections by twisting the hair together, and let it air dry. Not a frizzy hair in sight! I get some serious bedhead in the mornings, but I've found that I can revive my hair simply by wetting it a little and twisting my hair into sections again. The product does not come out completely until you wash it. It is truly an amazing product for me. Will definitely be ordering this again.

reviewText:
My nails are naturally very thin and flexible. I was able to grow them fairly long only because they didn't break because they were so bendy.  But along with that, they peeled, split, and snagged constantly. I had tried Nailtiques (burned when I put it on, so I thought it was doing something... but ultimately no results). I tried Pink Armor, and initially I liked it, but the polish itself would wear off and chip off, so it wound up not doing much good.

I got this in mid-July, and I've worn it constantly since then. My nails are finally thick and DON'T BEND. I feel like I'm wearing acrylics, they are that much thicker.  The peeling and splitting  are completely gone (did take about a month for that to sort out, but the new growth has none). I'm actually having to file my nails down a bit because they are getting too long.

The other thing about this is that it is a FANTASTIC base coat. It dries almost instantly (making it easier to keep them consistently painted), and once it's on, it doesn't budge. If I wear it alone, it stays. If I wear it with polish  (plus Out the Door top coat), it ALL stays. For the first time in my 38 year old life, my polish is lasting long enough that I get bored with it before it chips off. Honestly, I don't know *how* long it will hold up for, but I know it gets to Day Five with no problem. Also, it's a great buffer between your nails and your color (i.e. your nails won't be stained after taking off dark polishes).

AI am a cheapskate. And this is pricey for polish, but 100% worth it.
summary: This is it. I'll never need anything else.

reviewText: Did not work

MAKE SURE TO READ THE INSTRUCTIONS.

I'm very lazy. I'm not a fan of doing things over and over, like reapplying every other day, removing once a week, and so on. I wanted longer nails, though, so I purchased this and followed the instructions for several weeks. It worked! My nails were definitely stronger and longer.

However, I got lazy and stopped following up, and didn't bother to take the stuff off. After about two weeks, there was a noticeable difference in the parts of my nails that had Nail Envy, and the parts that didn't - the areas that did were really dirty, and eventually started to get sticky when I had them in water (doing dishes, etc.). I wiped them with a towel and got lint all over my nails, and gross sticky stuff on the towel.

Lesson learned - Follow the instructions, and this stuff will do wonders. Don't follow the instructions and be mildly inconvenienced by sticky nails.
summary: AMAZING - As long as you follow the instructions

reviewText: I love Nail Envy, it has worked so well on my post-acrylic tips weakened nails. I usually get splits on the sides of my thumb nails because I bit my nails as a kid and my nail beds were damaged from that. I haven't had any splits while use this product and am especially impressed because I had just taken off my acrylic tips when I started using Nail Envy. My nails were weak, thin, and breaking from having the tips on. In all honesty, my nails looked better and were stronger within days of using Nail Envy as directed!  Now, after about a month of use, my natural nails look better than ever. Thanks OPI!
This is my go-to for my nails, and something I recommend to everyone!
I have been using this product for 6 months and my nails are much longer and seem healthier.

I've been using OPI Nail Envy consistently for probably two years now. I suffer from extremely thin nails that I can't grow out without the possibility of causing harm to my hands, (I'm saying I literally have to tend to my nails daily when they aren't coated in polish) I've always been on the lookout for something to help me along and give me some peace of mind. To be honest, Nail Envy doesn't do anything for my nails to strengthen them at all, nor does it keep my nail polish on for an extended period of time (I'm talking maybe a day or two if I'm lucky). Before anyone accuses me of "not doing my nails correctly", etc. I've always been VERY meticulous about application and procedure. With this base coat, entire sheets of paint pop off through the day and then I'm left with ten little sheets of what look like paper thin press on nails. So as I said, the base coat is nothing to rave about at all. The only reason I'm rating this at three stars is simply for the fact that I still choose this base coat over everything else I own. Why? Because it works better than the other brands I've tried. China glaze, Orly, Essie, Zoya, Deborah Lippmann, Butter London- NONE of them last more than 12 hours on my nails before they either chip beyond repair or fall off entirely.

Maybe this base coat has been beneficial to others who don't suffer from a condition similar to mine, if so then that's awesome! I've finally come to the conclusion that I need to finally break down and try a more expensive alternative and hope for the best. But I'll probably always keep Nail Envy around in my nail polish case. If anything I can still use it for pedicures.

Obsessed with this product already and it's only been two weeks! I had acrylic nails on before and i didn't want my natural nails to break after taking off the fake ones and i could not be more happy. My nails haven't broken and they are growing strong and healthy! I hope to keep seeing results!
It works great

summary: This is seriously the best stuff for your nails

reviewText: Exactly what I needed, at a price I could afford. This product is something I've recommended to all my friends and family.
Used this years ago with great results. Tried it again, great results. The BEST nail product out there. I have nails again.

This product did make my nails stronger and less prone to breaking, peeling, and splitting.

However, I had the side-effect of a couple of nails separating from the nail bed after about a week (5-9 days) of use.

I was not certain that the Nail Envy was causing it, but after researching a bit on the matter it made sense - the time course fit (started about 5 days after I started using the polish, got worse after that until removal), nothing else in my life had changed, and I had never had this before. That, combined with others' accounts of nail-vs-nailbed separation after use of strengtheners containing formaldehyde, convinced me.

This is probably a rare side-effect, but I figured it's worth getting out there!

If anyone has reason to believe it's NOT Nail Envy that caused my issue, please let me know because I loved how much stronger my nails were after only a week, and I would love to use it again!

Nail Envy is the only thing that works for my nails.  Before I started using it my nails were short and weak.  Now my nails are growing and they're very strong.  No more peeling and no more ugly nails.  You can tell the difference from the first time it's used.

summary: Only thing that works for me

reviewText: OPI Maintenance is for people who already have strong nails, and want them to stay that way.  I use OPI Maintenance Nail Envy as my base coat (two layers), followed by Sally Hansen's Hard As Wraps in Clear, and Seche Vite fast dry top coat on top.  Maintenance Nail Envy has the great Pro-Wide brush that goes on in smooth, very thin layers.  The thinner the layer of polish, the quicker it dries.  You can use Maintenance Nail Envy alone or as a base coat, whichever suits you.  Do be aware that although the contents of the bottle look light pink, and the polish goes on as light pink, it dries completely clearly.  Very highly recommended.

reviewText: Although I'm not a soap snob, this Jojoba Oil soap made me understand that there truly can be a difference in soaps. First, the smell of this soap is perfect. It's not too perfume-y and not too musky. It smells neither overtly feminine nor masculine, but rides the middle ground beautifully. It's not overpowering, but neither is it understated. It has a good, clean earthy fragrance that both my husband and I enjoy. The Jojoba Oil DOES make a difference! Harsh winter temperatures cause dry skin problems in this house, and this soap has a good moisturizing affect when used daily. It is not greasy or oily, but leaves your skin feeling clean and well moisturized. Overall, this soap may well turn me into a soap snob, because I really like it and I will definitely buy it in the future.

The finish is incredible!  And the color match is truly amazing.  The light medium is a perfect match for my fair to medium skin.  And five hours later as of now, it doesn't look oily at all.  In fact, it looks the same as when I applied it.  This is definitely my new favorite makeup product.  I can't imagine going back to regular foundation now!

I use these when I can't get a spray tan in and it looks wonderful. They fade nicely so it's not obvious that you are coming off of a fake tan. Definitely recommend the 1/2 sheets as opposed to the full ones. The 1/2 are nice because sometimes I only need a tan on my legs/upper body and it's the perfect size. Initially I bought the full sheets and ended up cutting them in half.

reviewText:
I was suspicious when this item arrived and was in different packaging (plastic tube now instead of whatever metal it was before), but the Eau Thermale website confirms that change, so I opened the product to use it for the first time. After peeling the protective foil off the opening, pure water streamed out of the tube. The product has completely and irreversibly separated, no matter how much kneading of the closed tube I tried, or shaking. You can hear the water swirling around in there.  Expiration date on the crimped edge is 2022 so that is not the issue. It must be improper storage, or else this new packaging is a fatal mistake!

 Not sure if I can exchange this, but I will try.

I actually started off with Vichy's regular 3-in-1 One Step Cleansing Micellar Water Facial Cleanser and was amazed at how well it cleaned my skin. HOWEVER I found that it was way too drying for my old mom skin. It left my face clean but irritatingly dry. Enter the same product for Sensitive Skin. I've found that it cleans just as well and it doesn't leave my skin too dry. Another thing I like is that I can use it around my eyes. There are no fumes to irritate my dry eyes and makeup comes off beautifully. IF you have dry skin like I do or if you are unsure which product to use, let me suggest this product for 'Sensitive Skin'. You may not think you have sensitive skin but if some products make your face breakout, it's because they are messing with your skin's PH. Or at least that's what my doctor tells me. This cleans beautifully and is gentle.
summary: Works Gently -- a good choice for dry skin as well as sensitive skin

reviewText:
So, until I read specifically about Baxter, I didn't realize this Clay Mask was made for men.  Apparently Baxter of California produces and sells a line of products for men.

That did not stop this woman from trying out the clay mask.  I am a big fan of clay masks, I have combination skin and I like to feel pampered with clay.

This is a white clay, and it is very light.  A little goes a long way, and I rinsed my face prior to applying the clay.  It worked great, even as light and thin as it was.  I washed it off after the suggested drying time, and my skin felt nice and clean.

I was also very impressed that my skin didn't get oily after the fact either.  I loved this mask, and may not ever let the hubby know that it was really a men's product.

While I don't pretend to know what about 1/2 the ingredients are, I am impressed with the other half - things like Aloe, Avocado Oil, Witch Hazel, Calendula Oil (those are not exactly how they are written, but I do recognize those ingredients).
summary: Nice Clay Mask - Made For Men

reviewText:
Like a lot of other reviewers here, I'm pretty new to wet shaving (DE shaving).  I wanted to try this out and if you've not done it yourself I'd certainly give this shave method a try.  It will take a bit longer and there's a small bit of learing but if I can do it anyone can.

Anyhow, onto the cream.  I tried 3 creams, this one, Taylor of Old Bond Street sandalwood, and Dreadnought shave creams.  The other two were also very good creams and make a great lather and really are luxury products.  They also cost a bit more but I don't know why.  Proraso is the cheapest of the 3 I tried and absolutely works the best.  The menthol/eucaplyptus mix will leave you with an incredibly fresh cool feeling that isn't overpowering.  The scent is mild and nice and will not linger if you want to use a fragrance or aftershave scent after.

I recently learned that you can buy this at Bath and Body works in shopping malls, only it's sold as CO Bigelow cream but its made by Proraso for that company.

I can't wait to try the other formulas of Proraso.  Get this stuff, it's great.

reviewText: Its not fun being on the search, once you find it, stick close.

I'm addicted to this dry shampoo. I have fine, straight hair that is naturally light brown but highlighted. I used to wash my hair every day but can now go every other day with this. I think it's best for blondes, as it does lighten the hair a bit, although with practice it doesn't look grey as some reviewers have noted (too much in one spot and it will). I get compliments on my unwashed hair all the time -- the powder gives it volume and makes it look thicker. Sometimes I use it on days I do wash, for the thickening effect. I also like to put some in before bed - no greasy morning hair! I've tried many other dry shampoos and this is by far the best. Spray-on formulas dry my hair out, and none of the other powders seem to work as well as this one.

I've tried almost every kind of dry shampoo, and it does work decently, but only when used the night before. It has a pleasing scent, but the thicker power is a bit noticeable if used in the morning. It absorbs oil well though, and with night use combined with a thorough brushing the next morning, it doesn't do too badly. But, I really don't think you should have to work that hard to get good results from a dry shampoo! Finer powders, like Bumble & Bumble or Alterna are much easier to use, and can work well with just morning use, which is easier. On a hot summer night though, I do tend to turn to the Oscar Blandi.
summary: Pleasant smell, but high maintenance to get the right result

reviewText:
It's hard to give an objective review when I've only been able to use this about five times before the tip wore down rendering it unusable as I need very thin, soft strokes which a stub cannot give.

There was no sharpener in the package I received. I tried using other brow pencil sharpeners but none worked (they only wore down the tip). The lack of proper sharpener may have affected application but not the other elements (texture, color, look when applied, price/value ratio) that are a part of evaluating this pencil's effectiveness.

I've used a wide variety of eyebrow pencils over the years at a variety of price points. The best are easy to apply in that they don't seem to cake or clump and go on evenly (with a well-sharpened tip) and don't smudge; you can shape the tip as needed to give thicker or thinner lines. The consistency (a bit waxy but not too much), which you can't try before you buy, is a key factor in both application and longevity, once applied.

Other than the color itself, there's nothing that I liked about this product. Which is disappointing as this is a good brand and I've used other Longo products and been satisfied with their performance. It's especially disappointing given the price point.

Application: Not as easy as other pencils, which is due, in part, I think, to the consistency (waxy, clumpy) and the size of the tip (too small and chubby and not thin enough to my liking).

Texture: Not as smooth as other pencils I've used. Took longer to apply and had to keep smudging and fiddling with Q-tips to get a neat line. Didn't go on "evenly."

Look when applied: Seemed heavier and line was not as strong and consistent. Getting a thin line was very difficult (again, an issue of consistency and size/shape of product tip)

Color: This was a really good color for me, even though I have medium brown hair. I have found that many products labeled "blonde" are the right shade either alone or when used to lighten up a darker color.

Price/Value: Simply not there for me. I've had better application, better looking brows with pencils that were cheaper. But since a person's brows (color, texture, etc.) differ greatly, this may work better for you than me. I have thin-ish brows and need thin, really feathery lines, which this could not deliver.
summary: Sharpener was MIA making it difficult to use more than a few times and to get a thin line/stroke.

I am losing my hair due to a pregnancy/anxiety and I couldn't be more self conscious!  It is literally falling out in chunks right along my part and it's so thin.  I bought this product after reading reviews and I absolutely love it.  It is not perfect, but it is so close that I don't even care.  These flakes are easy to put on (takes only a few minutes... not even), and they do a great job at covering up your thinning areas.  The fibers stick to all the little baby hairs just like it claims.  I've started using dry shampoo so I can wash my hair less often (and so don't see chunks falling into the shower) and these flakes will easily stay on over night and right into the next day.  It's so nice not to wake up to a balding head first thing in the morning.  Also - I used these for the first time going to a NYE party and my finished hair looked fantastic.  I was actually showing my relatives pictures of what my hair ACTUALLY looks like on my phone and no one could believe it!

Loved these so much I'm already buying them in all my friends colors who are also losing hair to pregnancy.  Great product!
summary: Amazing!  Finally some confidence during hair loss!

Then I sprinkled small amounts and patted, and some spots needed a bit more and I sprinkled some more.  It works!  It stays in place for 3 days that I know of.  It works so well I've started wearing makeup again!  I got medium blonde because I color my hair medium blonde and it gets lighter.  Which fits right in to always looking natural.  I will be using this stuff forever, even if I'm not going out because I won't even have to look at that wide part anymore.  It's saved me from being upset enough to buy a wig.  I can't see the fibers even right up against the mirror.  This is truly a wonderful product for most people.  I will be using this forever!

This review is for "The Old Bill."  On my nails, it's a light, shiny copper color (but muted compared to actual copper metal).  It went on smoothly although I did need to use three coats to get it to be opaque (which means you might be able to do some interesting things with layering over other colors).  I didn't use a base coat and used a Seche Vite quick dry topcoat.

I was surprised to find that this polish was 5-free.  Usually 3- or 5-free polishes shrink a lot on my nails, especially at the edges.  But this one hasn't shrunk.  And at day 2, I don't have any chips yet.  (I'm hard on my hands and most polishes have chipped at least a little by now.)

I'm definitely a fan of this polish.  The performance has been so good that I'd even consider buying more colors from the same brand -- even though this is expensive, as nail polishes go.
summary: lasted longer for me than a lot of 5-free polishes

reviewText: When I first ordered this product I was worried about spending so much money for a bottle of nail polish! It costs more than OPI nail polishes which I found shocking! However I got the nail polish yesterday and just used it for the first time today. I put it on early this morning, and it is still on chip free right now, even after doing a variety of activities that could be considered "hard" on my nails. Probably my favorite thing about the polish is how great the color is! I usually will use about 4 coats of polish to get a thick layer of color on my nails, but with this I only needed  2 coats! I was shocked! Also I love how easily the color just glided onto my nails without streaks, air bubbles, or clumps. I would definitely recommend this nail polish to any nail polish fanatic!

reviewText:
This is the curling iron that you wanted as a teenager when you bought your first one from Target and spent hours cursing it because it wouldn't hold a curl at all. This iron is the preferred iron of stylists for a reason-it is a workhorse, and it is fabulous.

I have this iron in three sizes. I have the 1", the 1.25" and the 2". This size is by far my most used size. I have mid back length hair and it's medium thickness. It is wavy by nature but I typically curl it after blow drying it straight. This iron has been my go to after years of use, and it still looks as good as the day I bought it-8 years ago. It's in pristine condition and it works like a charm, and it gets USED.

There are adjustable settings for the temperature on here-it's a dial-set it once and then leave it alone. Not like electronic ones where you have to reset it every time you use it. I do wish this had an auto off feature, that's my one thing I want that newer irons have. The barrel on here is the PERFECT size for most hair types. It gives the loose barrel curl type, the "Victoria's Secret Curl" a lot of girls are after. The longer you hold the curl, the better longevity you will get. I have experimented with this thing for years and gotten tons of variety with it.

There is a longer barrel version of this floating out there now for women with really long hair, and I feel like while that might be useful, it might be harder to manhandle as well. This works well for me even when my hair has been exceptionally long. I think that had I known to buy this on Amazon back in college, I could have saved some money. The clamp is really strong, and while the iron comes with a replacement spring, I have not needed to replace mine in almost a decade of ownership with heavy usage.

If you are looking for a quality iron that will last a LONG time and won't leave you penniless, this is worth it. Only a few bucks more than the generic cheap equivalents, and it will work like a horse and leave you looking gorgeous.
summary: The workhorse of curling irons, the GOLD standard for a reason.

Sulphur products normally work Great on acne

WHAT HAPPENED
I started using this as I was coming down from a bad breakout, I was going to a wedding in a few days which with my normal acne cycles and healing should've been gone by the wedding (with my normal sulphur drying lotion).  I ran out and saw this on sale.  It was my mistake to just assume they were essentially the same. They were except a few major ingredients! My skin kept getting more and more inflammed, deeper painful knobs were coming up.  I was wondering if I had eaten something.  It just wasn't stopping.  One night I was actually in hives down my chin to my neck!  Later I noticed that I was getting what looked to be just plain cysts..pure inflammation no whitehead or anything.  I was pulling my hair out like what is happening.  I decided to take a look at the ingredients in this imposter. Talc and titanium dioxide... Really!? Who does that? I quick washed it off and ordered Eradikate my normal drying lotion, express shipping.  I will NEVER do that again.  I haven't had breakouts this bad since I started using sulphur in my skincare routine.

  This has been the worst in YEARS.  I had so much makeup on at that wedding.  I am going to have scars too.  So mad about this
summary: Talc is bad for the skin

I am actually a genuine and well-known psychic in the Atlanta area and was asked to do a prediction on local TV that got CNN's attention and landed me on Good Morning America the same weekend. Instead of calling friends, the first call I made was to my hairdresser. Wouldn't anyone? So I went to my hairdresser who has done every rock star's hair in town, just about, and having rock star hair myself, very curly, I have used many products for curly hair, but never got THESE results that I did with the Chi Polish. My hair designer used the Chi Pliable Polish and mixed a good bit of it with a large amount of Aquage Defining Gel (which is the secret I think) and wrapped it in his hands and smothered it into my wet hair and than diffused it. I don't know if I copied my hairdresser and used a larger than normal amount myself later on and THAT is why it became such a curly masterpiece, but people were complimenting me on the set right up until the time we taped. Because I have extremely curly hair this is the only thing I will use especially if I am going out. I know using the right amount makes it rock n roll- stage ready, and my hair cooks. I am in my 40's and no longer stand with my hands around a blow dryer for an hour. I mix a good amount of the Chi Polish with the Aquage Gel, diffuse for maybe 5 min--and I am ready to go. If you do not use enough there is definitely a difference, so you need to make sure to use a sufficiant. I was afraid using the amount I did would make my hair sticky, but my hair guy DID say to use a lot and it doesn't make anything sticky. This product is incredible and if I have to do my own hair and makeup for future media events, I definitely do my hair with that combination. I won't go on camera without it. Helene@TheReadersGroup.com

reviewText: Product was advertised as containing .35 Oz.  However, the actual tube of product only contained .20oz. It had a sticker label pasted on it, marked as .35 Oz.  It's bad enough paying $12.00 for a small qty of lip balm, but to only get about 1/2 of the advertised amount is an outrage. I don't know how this is not fraud.
I have been using this for a while. Best Anti humidity!

I didn't expect to like this, thinking it was Just Another Basic Moisturizer (but with organic ingredients - yawn). But color me impressed.

Shea butter is the 2nd ingredient after the "juices".  Because of this, the texture is actually a delight -- imagine shea butter diluted down to an emulsion, creating a thin, flexible, protective film on your face that acts as a barrier/primer.  It has that matte drydown often found in shea, but is much thinner and lighter -- the slight firming sensation acts as a temporary "freeze" while filling in pores and fine lines. Amazingly, I found it effective as a wind chafing barrier, cushioning my face from the biting cold. I love that it is non-oily in texture, allowing me to layer stuff over it. No pilling at all -- compatible with your other serums/sunscreens/foundations.

Now, a moisturizer that simply hydrates is not good enough! we demand more from our products these days. To show truly efficacious results, this cream has to DO something else. That's where the AHA's come in. The fruit acids to act as low level AHA's (i'd guess it's 5% or less), so you won't see visible brightness overnight -- but over a few weeks, you'll feel your skin texture getting smoother, more refined.

The AHA's are crucial in this product because without them, your dead skin cells would just accumulate, and the lipid ingredients in this cream would simply bind those dead cells together, causing dullness and clogs. Also it is silicone-free (silicone is notorious for causing clogs), and it has other "good-for-you" nutrients like antioxidants and DMAE. But really--it's the AHA's that do the most.

In summary, this formulation is a good combo of light AHA's and hydrating ingredients while steering clear of the "no-no"s. If you are looking for an immediate refining/ brightening effect, only a professional peel or IPL/laser treatment would do that; i'd recommend this cream as a good "maintenance" cream that gradually further refines skin on a slower basis, albeit much gentler.
summary: A beauty industry insider's professional  opinion: good combo of low % AHAs with hydrating ingredients, gradual skin refining
