I really like this thickening spray.  It adds body and texture without weighing my hair down.  It also adds some heft to individual strands making them look thicker and more voluminous.  I've started layering this spray with a styling spray (Suave) because my hair is really hard to hold and I found that I needed some extra support in order for my finished style to last a couple of days.  The two products work well together and there's no stiffness or crunchiness at all. But you don't have to do this because this spray works well all by itself.  I have a layered long bob (a lob) and I wanted something that would define the layers while adding some heft to my tresses.  This spray gives me incredible body and my hair is light and bouncy and responds really well to styling.  I let my hair air dry overnight and use a curling iron in the a.m. to create beachy waves.  This spray is definitely activated by heat and the volume increases as heat is applied but if you just want texture, you don't have to use heat at all. I really like this spray and its thickening properties and its ability to give my hair loads of swingy body.  It was a good purchase for me.  Amazon has the best price on this product btw.  My local Ulta sells this spray for $16 and I think I paid $10ish on Amazon Prime.  I definitely recommend this spray, especially for fine hair.  If you want more thickness, body and texture, give this product a whirl.
summary: Definitely adds thickness, body and texture.

reviewText:
I have tried every dry shampoo i have almost black hair.
This is the best just put a little bit and comb finger through hair.
I love the smell and i love the look after 10 minutes.
At first it will look terrible but i will soak in.
I have tried to use it many days in a row and flipped my hair in a car,
was embarrassed by the puff of dander that was very visibly flying around in the car!!!
LOL
Amazon is the only place I can still find this dry shampoo, but it is the only kind I have used and liked.

If looking for a powder-based dry shampoo, this is a great product.  It blends well and absorbs oil effectively.  Since purchasing this product, I have also tried "spray" dry shampoo, which I like better for my hair.  That's the only reason it gets 4 starts out of 5.  Had I not tried the "spray" dry shampoo, I would have given it 5 stars.
summary: Powder-Based Dry Shampoo Blends Very Well

reviewText: This dry shampoo is amazing!  Not like any live ever used before. A powder that is very fine and silky that you put in your hands and then work into your hair. Good to freshen when you can't wash. Has lemony scent. Love it!!!

This product is very pricey for being unscented powder in it's package.  Highly recommend Suave Dry Shampoo.  It's under $3 a can, its sprays, and the smell is not bad.  On the upside for this product (Oscar Blandi Pronto), since it is in the most basic formula of powder there is less of a chance for mal-function that can occur as I understand (never happened to me) with the Suave aerosol product.  Hay, I'm willing to gamble a little more with a purchase under $3.
summary: Like a spray a little better but the product does what it's suppose to.

reviewText: I have been using this product for over a year, and i very much like it.  This product  works very well. I will continue to buy this product. The seller was very fast at shipping, and i will buy from them again.

I use dry shampoo on the third day after a blow out. This product worked as it should, but I found it messy and smelly. Unfortunately I used it the morning of an all day meeting with clients and whenever I touched my scalp I could feel the powder. Maybe I used too much. But either way, it smells like chemicals and I could smell it throughout the day.

I have relatively greasy hair. I shower in the mornings, and by mid-afternoon, the oil is obvious. With this dry shampoo, my hair lasts much, much longer. I apply it about 8 hours into the day, and it's enough to keep my hair looking and feeling good until bedtime (I go to school/work 14 hours a day).

I originally bought this for Coachella. I have OCD, and if I don't shower everyday, I can't stand it. This is especially true on hot days. At Coachella, there are limited showers and extremely hot days. I used this product the first day with some no-rinse body wash. It was okay. I had to put my hair up, but it was definitely better than not using anything at all.

This product works a LOT better than Batiste and Algermarin. It's a tiny bottle, but you don't have to use very much, whereas most other dry shampoos are sprays, and you have to use a lot. I've had this little bottle since April 2011, and there's still half in it. I don't use it everyday, of course...only for emergencies.

The application is sort of awkward, but, like I said, it's better than sprays. My boyfriend says that he can sometimes see when I use it, because of residue. It's not as bad as the other dry shampoos that I've tried, though. And the smell is MUCH less intrusive.
summary: The only dry shampoo that works

reviewText:
I have super greasy hair.  Super greasy.  Like greasy in 12 hours - when I was younger, I'd often wash my hair twice per day.  As I got older, I learned that frequent washings create more oil so I tried wearing a hat every other day while I tried to trick my body into producing less oil.  Um, it didn't work.

I also have DARK black hair - if there's such a thing - and I don't have an issue with powder residue.  I think they key is to apply the powder directly onto your scalp and then rub.

This product has been pretty miraculous for me.  It seriously absorbs all the oil and makes my hair look like it's just been washed.  It's expensive, for sure, but worth it.  I don't apply too much, I rub it in with my fingertips and then I brush with a boar bristle brush.

Other reviewers complained about the smell - it IS indeed strong but not at all unpleasant.  I kind of liked it!

I think I'm going to order another bottle right now!!
I love the powder - but will order it from another company. This was the worst customer service I have ever encountered.

In my opinion, it's worth the price ... but then again, I have a drawer of failed makeup powders and products, and would rather spend more money on something I know I like.

I am one of those people who suffer from dandruff (the shame!!!!).

I had tried all of the usual and even some unusual products on the market, all the way from the mass market shampoos to the boutique shampoos to the fragrant tar based shampoos (ah, the essence of La Brea right on your scalp).  Nothing was really effective (not just dandruff effective, but also cost effective).

Then my wife spotted this product at her hair salon, and I bought a smallish bottle - that was 2003.  Haven't had a dandruff problem since!

The shampoo is amazing - a small drop will provide luxurious lather - I always wet, lather, rinse, re-lather, let it sit while I shower, and then thoroughly rinse. So, about once a year I buy my litre of Rusk Purify and live is good. (PS, it is so concentrated it makes a great travel shampoo since the allowed 3.3 ounces, 100 ml will last one about 2 weeks!)

A fresh, clean light herbal scent remains with the exfoliated scalp flakes all gone.

Do yourself and your head a favor - get Rusk Purify and lose your dandruff.

reviewText:
I used to think buying a wig was my only alternative as a female with alopecia. I started with one little thin spot 20 years ago. Now the entire top of my head is extremely sparse or bald. Nothing worked for me before this. My only problem was that the dark brown was too dark, and the med brown too light. I found out you could pry/twist off the top of the regular size container or larger, and then you could mix colors to get the exact right match.
I attach the sprayer, cover my head in a fine mist, pat, comb. I continue to apply where needed and then spray with the fiber fix (or hairspray, if in a pinch, works fine). My hair is shiny and I am ready to face the world without being embarrassed about my mostly bald head. I now look like I have hair where there is none, or very little.
This really made a difference in how I feel about myself. I no longer have to be embarrassed or cry about how little hair I have.

reviewText: I've tried to curl my hair a handful of times over the years with my Conair curling iron but I always ended up looking funny. My hair either wouldn't curl or it would straightened out really quickly and I always thought it was due to my poor curling skills. Recently I decided to give it another go and I watched some YouTube videos on how to curl your hair and it suddenly dawned on me that it might be the curling iron that I was using. After doing some research, I decided to try this one and OMG I LOVE IT! It heats up really quickly and it curled my hair in half the time. Not only do the curls look really nice, they hold up really well. I curled my hair more than 24 hours ago and it's still nice and curly! I especially love that the plug connector on the wand swivels, thereby making it so much more convenient to turn the wand when curling. I absolutely love it! I can't believe I've gone so long before finding this. All these years I could've been curling my hair!

I'm not sure if this is a counterfeit.  There are a few little things that are off with it - the barrel does not clamp all the way together which leaves marks.  I have not had those issues with any other sizes of Hot Tools that are legit.  It was a good price and it gets the job done - but I might search elsewhere if I knew better.

My husband developed an extremely bad case of scalp folliculitis. His scalp was an angry red color and he had tons of white filled pustules. He couldn't even sleep because he said it was liking laying on nails it hurt so bad. I did hours of research only to find that it is a very difficult condition to manage. Some people stated they were on antibiotics for years and years. His hair was falling out with the inflammation and he was so afraid that he would lose all his hair and be left with a awful appearing scalp. We both hesitated going to a dermatologist because we didn't want him to start on courses of antibiotics with no end in sight.
He started using Therapro Mediceuticals Thera Rx Anti Bacterial Scalp and Skin Wash, also purchased on Amazon, as a pre shower treatment. Then he would shower using Paul Mitchell as a shampoo. These were used simultaneously from day 1 so we are not sure if one product is superior to the other.
The results are nothing short of miraculous. Within the first fee days he had a ton of drying and flaking. The pus filled bumps were drying up and literally falling off his head. He continued to use both treatments for about 2 weeks. He has also been taking orally a probiotic, curcumin and oil of oregano capsules to work this from the inside as well.
Merely 2 weeks later his scalp is over 90% healed and he has no pain or itchiness. He will maintain this daily regimen at least one more week.
The beauty of these products is they will fight both bacterial and fungal infections.
If you are suffering please give this a try. I never take the time to write reviews but feel so strongly about his success that I want to help anyone who might be suffering. Good luck.

Update - a few week after initial post and absolutely zero folliculitis remaining. Totally clear scalp!!
summary: So grateful to have found this product-scalp folliculitis

If you are an African American woman (or any ethnic woman) who has had RELAXERS and are going through the RELAXED to NATURAL transition? Do NOT waste your time buying this product unless you have the time, money, and patience to deal with your hair.  This is NOT the product to use just a "dime sized amount" with when transitioning from relaxed to natural.  I personally have thick hair to begin but when I did get relaxers, moisturizing was nothing and my hair held moisture just fine.  In my current attempt to go "NATURAL", my hair is a giant sponge and this product does not and WILL not do anything luxurious for the new growth that is coming in like wild fire.  The moisturizing has gotten worse and I find myself needing to moisturize TWICE a day and use more product than I have ever used :( My hair looks nothing like the sleek, shiny, and healthy hair that I have when I walk out of the salon after using this product.  I'm not speaking for ALL women but mostly for those w/ thick, coarse hair AND for those who are in the relaxed to natural transitioning phase.  I also have the moisturizing shampoo and conditioner and even those don't add the moisture that it claims to give. (At least not going through the transitioning phase).  Now do NOT get me wrong, these products work WONDERFUL when your hairstylist is putting her hands to your hair and has all of the proper tools to get your hair bone straight and ultra glossy but, if you're attempting this at home?  You may wanna find a better oil moisturizer that is truly going to help you through the transition :)
summary: Not for relaxed to natural transition...

reviewText:
I love this product, well shoot, I love almost all the M.O. products!! But this one is the one I use the most. I NEVER get my hair wet without putting this in my hair, either before or after. If I go swimming, Ill put this in my hair and it protects it from the chlorine. If I get out of the shower, this is the first thing that goes in my hair. Ive tried everything from biosilk to that knock off argan oil junk, even CHI. This is THE BEST product as far as oils go. A small dime size lasts even all of my hair, just past my lower back and very thick wavy hair. You just put some in the palm of your hand, rub your hands together like you have lotion and then put it in your hair starting at the tips and working your way up (not on the scalp-unless you want the greasy look! lol). Its not even that expensive if you consider how long it lasts, I bought a 3.4 oz bottle and its been 10 months and I still have some left.

___________
Also, just a side note, I donated my hair about 2 years ago and have been growing it out ever since and it seems to have grown like a weed by using M.O. products. We use the hydrading mask, intense curl cream, shine spray, and of course the actual moroccan oil. I have super sensitive skin and I notice that I don't break out from using these products, but the mask can be heavy, so I wear my hair up at night and wash my hair at least 2x/wk. Since the 2 years, my hair has grown at least 2 feet, I get it cut frequently and loose about 4 inches every quarter, so...yeah, use this product if you're trying to grow your hair out ladies!! Cheers to sexy beautiful hair!!

I've been using Moroccanoil for about a month now and I am in love with it! I have fine blonde hair and I was concerned that it would weigh my hair down or make it greasy but I decided to give it a try. I'm so glad I did! I recently moved to DC from California and my hair is not equipped to deal with humidity at all. Mair hair is usually so ruined after being outdoors for 5 minutes it looks like I didn't even shower and I have to pull it up immediately. Since I've been using Moroccanoil my hair looks fantastic - no frizz or flyaways. It makes your hair really shiny and smooth. The best part is that it lasts forever because I only use one small dab on wet hair. It doesn't do anything for volume but I'm sure you can use with a volumizing product and it wouldn't make your hair yucky. This is a great buy!
I have very curly hair and I have used this product for months and love it.  It helps stop the split ends and protects my hair from product use.

I've had my eye on this product for a while now but I was trying to finish up some of my other hair products before getting yet another thing that would add to my large collection of cosmetics and potions. My mom was sweet enough to give this to me as a gift so of course I had to use is asap, there was no way I was going to wait while it sat on my shelf! This turned out to be such a great surprise, this really works wonders. Let me say right away that men and women can both use it, its not something that only half of us can enjoy, I think my friend Danny who's also a hair product fanatic will really like this!

Rich in vitamin E, carotene, phenolic acid and essential fatty acids, argan oil is one of the rarest but most valuable cosmetic ingredients. This turns hair into silk, few small drops is all I need in the morning on freshly washed hair that's still wet or damp, and it vanished instantly, never making my hair greasy or heavy. When I wash it the next day I can still feel the extra softness but it's so marvelous that I tend to use it every day. So far in my life I haven't used an oil based product that vanishes so well, this really leaves no greasy residue whatsoever and the hair feels like spun silk, even my damaged ends feel more light and wispy, sometimes I feel like I cant stop touching my hair, to someone who doesn't know how well this works I might appear to have a disorder where my arm flies up to my hair all the time....

- Kasia S.
summary: For hair as soft as a bunny's tail

reviewText: I love this dispenser and the remover worked great without smelling terrible
Best product on the market

The WEN Fig cleansing conditioner is my favorite of all the WEN cleansers. One reviewer noted that she did not like the smell, but I actually received several compliments from my husband when I first started using it, so it is truly a matter of preference. I would describe the smell as a light musky/sweet scent. I tried the WEN cleansers because in the last few years my scalp has become very sensitive and I was shedding more daily. My dermatologist recommended alternating dandruff shampoos, and when that didn't work (and actually irritated my scalp a lot more) she recommended trying shampoos & conditioners with no added fragrance/color etc... None of this worked and costed a small fortune. Then I came across a review from a lady complaining about similar ailments and no luck with the same above routine. She was eventually diagnosed with an allergy to laurel/lauryl sulfates - common shampoo ingredients and which many people are sensitive to. After using the WEN cleansers she noticed a positive difference in her scalp health and daily shedding returned to a normal amount. I have to say that I have had the same positive experience! (Although, for me the Lavender WEN cleanser caused my scalp to feel a little itchy. So I recommend trying the travel sized sets to find the best one for you). One final note is that the WEN cleansing conditioners really do clean your hair and scalp (something I was skeptical about when I first discovered this product due to it lacking detergents). However, I have to pretty much use it daily because it is a light cleanser. I hope this helps :)
summary: Great cleanser for those with lauryl/laurel sulfate sensitivity

reviewText: Works good. Great price.

I added this product to the trial package (no subscription) I ordered here on Amazon. I wanted to use the same hair care routine I normally use when I experimented to see if WEN was a good product for me.  I normally use a volumizer on my roots and bangs as well as a leave-in product. This styling creme is very similar to the WEN cleansing conditioner, but not as heavy or thick. And you don't use as much. It smells great. And doesn't leave a "sticky" feel to my hands after using like the volumizer does. My hair doesn't feel weighed down or get extra dirty between washings. I french braid all or part of my hair a couple of times a week. So I was surprised to see that when I undo the braids, the styling creme has helped to "set" that wavy look hair gets after hours of being braided. I put my hair in a bun when I sleep and the next day, the waves are still strong enough to wear with my hair either down or in a double ponytail. After several uses, I'm pleased with the WEN styling creme and how it performs on my hair. I'm trying all the products I ordered for three months. I'll update my review shortly after that and let you know if I'm still wildly impressed and a true believer convert!

Love the conditioner but next time I might buy the smaller bottle even though it's less of a value- I would rather be able to easily use the bottle!
This is the best under eye cream I have ever used.  My doctor recommended it and I could not be happier.
I find myself using this mist frequently during these dry, winter days! The smell is pleasant and I like the way it feels and looks on my skin.

I expected a much lighter sunscreen since this product is advertised as a moisturizer. It feels way too thick when you put it on your face to qualify as a moisturizer. It has the white thickness of a water resistant sunscreen- the kind that takes a while to blend into your skin. When I used it, it left a white cast on my skin that I had to rub in for 5 minutes before it looked acceptable, and then it still gave me the oily sunscreen look.
Another negative aspect is the intense smell of this product. It smells like citronella mosquito candles. Even my husband noticed and disliked it. They really should have just made this product fragrance free.

But there is good news: First of all, the scent evaporates after a little while.

 Secondly, my face didn't feel dried out after wearing this product all day (unlike other sunscreen products that left my face feeling parched).

Thirdly, Juice Beauty uses high quality natural ingredients that won't overload your body with toxins like so many other mainstream sunscreens. I was also really impressed with the high zinc oxide content (this is the ingredient that provides the actual physical sunblock). 20% zinc oxide is much higher than I have seen in any other sunscreen. Zinc is very powerful when it comes to skin healing and is often used for speeding up skin repair and healing sores etc. So I would assume (I haven't used it long enough to see evidence) if you use this product regularly that it could improve your overall skin condition. Also, the high zinc content ensures that this moisturizer serves its stated purpose and actually shields your face from the harmful rays of the sun.

So, if you are mainly looking for a high quality sunscreen (which I was) then this is a good choice, but don't buy this if you are mostly looking for a moisturizer or you'll be disappointed.

reviewText:
Fairly new to DE shaving...I've been using a 34C for about six weeks and decided to try something a little more aggressive as the 34 didn't get everything as smooth as I'd like.  Used the 37C for the first time tonight with about 2 days growth and am very pleased with the results.  I followed the advice of other reviewers and used zero pressure and this thing just performed perfectly.  Three passes (WTG, XTG, and ATG) and there was no irritation whatsoever, no cuts, nicks, or weepers.  The slant really seems to make a difference and allows the blade to just cut the hair without bothering the skin.

It's definitely a different feel than the 34C and it seems like lack of attention to angle and pressure would be more likely to cause injury, but with care and attention it's nothing to fear.

Overall, I'd recommend this razor to anyone willing to pay attention to what they're doing.
summary: Extremely pleased with the results from this razor.

reviewText: Absolutely the best safety razor I own. Brilliant design and engineering. I can get a ridiculously smooth shave with two passes and the irritation is very minimal for such a close shaver. I wouldn't call this aggressive, just extremely efficient at what it is designed to do: slice whiskers instead of chop them. I know some people think the slant design is just hype.  I honestly can't see their point if view. The physics just make sense and I can feel and see the difference. It's going to be hard to put this razor down and use my other open comb razor and gillette tech again.

Was reluctant to try a slant this early in my wet shaving experience (2 months and change).  This razor gives the closest shaves I've experienced so far.  I've only nicked myself slightly (no more than usual).  If you are on the fence about getting a slant, I highly recommend this razor.
summary: Gives a great, very close shave

reviewText:
I chose to switch to a safety razor for three reasons: (a) environmental - I really hated all the plastic associated with the big names razor manufacturers, not only from the razor but the packaging; I also hated all the toxic/complicated formulas of the shaving creams (switched to soap, but that's another review); (2) costs - I've spent at least close to a grand on buying disposables (if note disposable razors, then the blades); and (3) aesthetics - all this plastic, weird foams and costs had just turned shaving into this into an ugly chore.

I decided to buy the Merkur Classic after reading reviews here and on the web. I was a bit overwhelmed by the opposing views/advice to newbies, and ultimately bought this one because I figured it was German, so at least well made (...and I hate stereotypes too). I was hesitant in general to switch because I still have images of my dad leaving the bathroom after shaving looking as if he'd been in a knife fight and just accepted that I'd nick myself a lot as the beginning. Man, I was wrong...

The first shave was so incredibly easy. I went slowly and had watched videos on line (thanks Manticore59 and Thomas of Denmark on YouTube). Although I didn't get a very close shave on my first try (only did one pass), it was adequate and with a single nick. I have thick growth and coarse hair, and shave my head as well. Initially thought I'd master shaving my face before moving on to my head. But shaving my face was pleasing that I took the plunge and did the dome--no nicks there also.

I've gotten better in the week since and now get an incredibly close shave that surpasses anything I've gotten using Gillette or Schick's high-end razors. As to whether this is better than other brands/models, I'm in no position to say. I just know that it has been a satisfying switch, and I look forward to all the money I'll save in the years to come.

This is the first time i have used a safety razor.  I will have to say I am very impressed with the way it shaves.  It does take a little bit to get use to, but after the first few times I got the hang of it.  It does weight a little more than disposable ones, but I have got use to it in a short period of time.  After 3 weeks I am still using the blade that came with it, it still shaving like new.  I have coarse thick facial hair and would end up clogging up the disposable blades to the point that they would not cut cleanly any more.  I would have to change them about once a week if not more to get a smooth shave. With this razor I do not have that problem, it cleans out all the cut whiskers each time I rinse it off.  I have to do about three passes to get to a very clean shave, but I do not mind the little extra time needed.

The only con for this razor, is the handle is a little shorter than I am use to with the disposable razors.  After a few weeks I got use to it and its not a big deal to me.

This is the best benzoyl peroxide cleanser I've used. My skin is *extremely* sensitive to benzoyl peroxide, to the extent that if I use a 2.5% topical just as a spot treatment on a few places, my entire face will get red and irritated. But I've only experienced minor irritation and drying with this, which, for my very sensitive skin, is great.

The ingredients are wonderful, as well. PanOxyl, a major brand that makes a well-known benzoyl peroxide cleanser, actually includes acne-inducing ingredients in their anti-acne (benzoyl peroxide) cleanserwhich makes absolutely no sense. These are cetearyl alcohol and sodium lauryl sulfate. (I have to be careful about this, since cetearyl alcohol breaks me out every time I use a product with it.) This cleanser, however, contains *no* acne-inducing ingredients.

Topix Benzoyl Peroxide Wash: [...] (I use the 5%, but the ingredients are the same.)
PanOxyl: [...]

I live in Florida and it has been brutally hot this year.  I think possibly the problem is exacerbated by heat and perspiration.  I have tried many different things including a prescription from my dermatologist for extra strength cortisone.  Aloe cort cream is the only product that has worked.  After just one application I see a marked difference and after a couple of days it is gone.  It is a recurring problem so I have to continue treating it off and on during the hot weather but at least I am now able to get relief with aloe cort cream.

reviewText: Excellentp
Great product. Excellent coverage that looks natural.

I don't have sensitive skin, but opted for this over the green or red thinking that a sensitive skin product would feel all the better. I just completed my first shave and came away loving it. The thick/stiff cream in the container loaded up very easily into my brush after squeezing out excess water. A little goes a long way, I loaded the tip and was able to get coverage 3 times over my face and neck with a single load. A nice slick lather was produced - I have never felt a razor glide so effortlessly over my skin. After shaving i noticed that my skin started to tingle. It felt like menthol. This might bother some but I loved it.

Over all, 5 stars for value, ease of use, and quality of shave.
summary: but opted for this over the green or red thinking that a sensitive skin product would feel all the better. I just completed my f

reviewText:
OK IF YOU HATE SHAVING?!?! Get this , then go to YouTube look up how to use shaving soap. Watch several videos. Then break out your soap/cream and play around with it practice and then give it a try! If you do not find this to be thee best shave ever keep practicing cause your missing a step or have not gotten it down yet.

I hated shaving! My skin always got irritated and burned after! Then I tried this stuff after watching hours of videos, I broke down and gave it a whack. Now mind you I'm in a wheel chair so it is harder for me to shave and I get worn out in my chair quickly!!!! After using this I look forward to shaving I can't wait for the stubble at 5pm or 5am to show up cause I'm going to shave... I will spend the extra 10 min to get outta  bed to go through the procedure to shave ! My skin comes out so smooth and irritation free!!!!!! And the girlfriend really noticed a difference! Spend the money, spend the time to learn , spend the time to treat your self to something fun and comforting !!!

reviewText: First of all, let me say that Proraso is good quality stuff.  I gave this 3 stars because IMHO, it doesn't work as well as the shave creams that come in the tubes.  I have a tube of Proraso, but wanted to try this, and the razor glides much better with the cream and I get a much better shave.  Also, from reading all the reviews and tips on how to use this soap, a lot of users are saying to swirl the brush directly in the container to start a lather, and then transfer to another bowl to complete the lather.  I did this and it does work well, but that makes it a 2-step process which I don't want to do.  I'd rather squeeze cream out of a tube directly on the brush, then do the lather in a shaving bowl.  And for those asking if this is a hard puck or a cream, it's kind of in-between.  It's not as hard as a traditional bar of soap, but it's definitely not a cream.  It's definitely solid enough that you can take the product out of the bowl and hold it in your hand, put it back in the bowl, and you wouldn't need to wipe any residue off your hand.
summary: The cream in the tubes has done much better for me.

reviewText:
I've tried everything from premium designer stuff to the value stuff.  When it comes down to it, it's really just shaving soap.  This stuff is no different.  Proraso is a very good shaving product.  It doesn't have the variety of scents that other soaps/creams have, but for the price, it's a good low-frills product.  The soap is just hard enough to load my brush on it, but soft enough to get a really good load without too much effort.  It really whips up a great rich lather that is very slick.  It leaves my skin feeling hydrated and it works great with the Nivea aftershave balm.  The only gripe I have is the scent.  I don't particularly care for the soapy scent.  It's not bad, I just wouldn't wear it as a cologne.  Of course, smell is completely subjective.  Like most all soaps, the scent doesn't linger for more than a few minutes anyway.

Overall, the soap performs great.  There's plenty of product in there to last more than a couple of months.  It performs as well as TOBS, but 25% less expensive.

reviewText: Like the smell and like most soaps it does not stick around. Its a larger amount than I expected. Ive been wet shaving for about two years and still find myself experimenting with different soaps. They last a long time so its not like you have a lot of them. This one is very pleasant, very nice shave, lathers easily (I have heard water but on a hardness scale of 1-5 its a 2-1/2) and Im looking forward to keeping it in my rotation. I have a tough beard that grows in many directions and I would definitely recommend this soap.
summary: more product than expected very nice soap

reviewText: I have been using the Proraso shave cream with great success.  I purchased this "Soap in the Bowl" to support a recent vacation as I did not want to travel with my ceramic bowl.  This product provided a very comparable lather and since it was the same ingredients as the cream in the tube, I did not experience any break-outs as a result.  This is a must have for travel or for anyone not wanting to mess with the separates.

My mom's side of the family has been using Mason Pearson brushes for years, but I'd never looked into their combs until my grandmother mentioned the other day that "there just wasn't anything like it." I was hesitant to buy, since I wasn't sure I could justify spending this much money on a comb when I could find something similar at CVS for under $5. I still probably can't justify it on my budget, but I love it too much to return it. There really is a difference. I have long, often pretty tangled hair, and whereas my old combs would always tug at and pull out more than a few hairs, this one just glides through it. I primarily use it when my hair is wet (and therefore at its most fragile), so I really appreciate how gentle this comb is.
summary: Mason Pearson has never let me down before, and it hasn't this time either

reviewText: This is beautifully made and leaves my hair feeling like silk.  It is so smooth that it just glides thru my hair.  I could have never imagined the difference this hand made comb is from all the other combs that I own.  I am buying 2 more of these for now. I doubt I will ever be using anything else on my hair.
summary: A comb is not just a comb!

reviewText: What a great comb.  Good for your hair.  It does make a difference

reviewText: I've bought Mason Pearson for the past 30 years and this was my first mini brush. I would pay the extra $'s for the large one.
summary: I've bought Mason Pearson for the past 30 years and ...

reviewText: Well, I was very excited to get a Mason Pearson brush...soooo fancy. Only after using it on dry hair on and off for three years, it is missing a quarter of the bristles. So for the price, I am pretty disappointed in this brush. I have long, medium thick hair, so you wouldn't think that my brush should look like it came out of a war zone, but it does. My cheaper boar bristle brushes are still intact, so I don't think I will buy another MP brush, it's just not worth it.

I've been using this brush for 20 years and it still functions as good as new.  It's important to wash your hairbrush frequently, especially if you use any styling products.  I comb out any hair, wet the hairbrush, put shampoo on it, and scrub with the cleaning brush that it comes with, rinse well, and squeeze/shake out the water.  The instructions say not to get the inside wet, but I get it wet every time I clean the brush and have never had a problem.

My niece has had the same brush for a few years and hers is almost ruined because she uses it with a hot blow dryer and she never washes it.  When she saw how nice my old brush looks, she decided to start cleaning hers, but the nylon bristles are still ruined because of the high heat.  I recommend only using the brush on dry hair.
summary: Will last forever if you take care of it

reviewText: Bought as a gift for my husband after he completely ran out of all cologne ( even the Old Spice standby!). Delivery was speedy and the package arrived well packed with the contents protected. He (and I) love the scent...and who doesn't feel better when you know you smell gooood !

really helps with static electricity.  I have very fine hair and have tried everything.  So far, this is it.  Thank you!

I bought my bottle from QVC and gagged because of FOUL scent the first time I used it.  I still struggle.  I'm not sure what it is (or isn't) that makes it so raunchy.  I thought it might be the retinol, and convinced my self to keep on thru the bottle.  As far as effectiveness goes - I have no dryness and it's maintaining my recent treatment with Retinosyn beautifully.  It's a thick cream going on and works well around the eyes, too!  If you have super sensitive skin, you probably want to start with something that is less than one percent, and then work your way up.  But ladies .... THE SMELL.  I don't want to think I got a bad batch, but I also don't want to to think that it's supposed to be this smelly.  Holy cow.  Just be warned that you may get a stinky product. Ha!

What a disappointment! I have been a fan of La Roche-Posay products for many years and was very much looking forward to trying out this new cleanser. But here is what I found: - Cleansing power is average, not good, not bad, and so is the slightly dry feeling after product usage. - The company says that it has a "unique cooling effect for a refreshing, pure feel". While I did notice a slight cooling effect, I don't think that it amounted to much at all. I definitely expected something stronger than just a very mild and very fleeting cool feeling. - But what really, really made me dislike this product is that it is heavily fragranced (at least to my nose). I wouldn't say anything if this were Lancome or Estee Lauder - both companies that seem to use a lot of fragrance in their products. But this is La Roche-Posay - a company that advertises products for sensitive skin and calls itself the dermatologists' brand! In the product description on their website they describe it as being "Soap-free, Alcohol-free, Paraben-free, Safe for sensitive skin". What they forgot to mention is that they added tons of fragrance to this. While the product rinses off ok, the fragrance does not and I could not wait to use some toner to wipe off every trace of this smell that was way too intense for me and that I plain hated. While I will continue to love La Roche-Posay Toleriane Fluid 1.35-Ounces precisely because it is fragrance-free and just all-around great for sensitive skin, I am still wondering what La Roche-Posay was thinking when they came up with this Cleansing Gel. It simply does not fit their brand philosophy nor does it smell good at all.

The best thing about this eye-liner for me is that it lasts.  My other eye-liner goes on more easily, thicker and more smoothly, but it doesn't last as long.  I think it's oilier or waxier which makes it go on very easily, but then come off easily.

This has a thinner line, but you can go over it again to make it appear thicker and darker.

It didn't irritate my eyes as some eyeliners do.  And it doesn't collect in the corner of my eyes as other eyeliners do.

My only wish is that it sent on more smoothly, but then it might come off more easily.  So, that's a trade-off.  I haven't found an eyeliner which lasts as long as this one does, so if that's what you're looking for, this may be a 5-star product.

I really like this eye liner pencil.  I wear eye liner every single time I wear makeup, and I have used a LOT of eye liner pencils.  This one was easy to apply, it glided on without pulling and it left a great dark line.  It stayed on all day, but I am not a person to rub my eyes, because I wear glasses.  It was easy to remove with my regular makeup wipes, and all came off cleanly.  I like the size because it makes it easy to hold to apply.  The width of the pencil is standard and it fit easily into my eye pencil sharpener.  I really like it and think it is a great product!
summary: Easy to use, stayed on all day

I'm fine with the non-aerosol delivery, and maybe that's why is lasts so much longer. You squeeze the bottle and it puffs out the dispenser hole similar to an aerosol.

reviewText: I have always had dry brittle nails that flake and don't grow since I was very young. I have tried every nail hardener, strengthener on the market and this is the only one that has worked for me. I use this product along with taking 5,000 mg of biotin daily (I have taken biotin daily for years and not had a great result until combined with this top coat) and my nails are strong, no flakes, no peeling and the ridges are starting to smooth out. I have found this product to be more beneficial if applied daily to unpolished nails vs. over a polish. the price does seem a bit pricey but it is worth every penny and then some. I don't remove the coating already on my nails I just add a new coat every day...the instructions tell you to use the polish for 7 days, remove then and apply polish again for another 7 days for a whole month then to give your nails a break for a month before using this polish again. The one bottle of polish should last about 6-8 months depending on how often you will apply. Throw all those others bottles of wanna be hardeners, strengthens out...this is the only one you need!
Amazing product! I saw results within 2 weeks- worth every penny.

I love this blow dryer. I will start off by describing the texture of my hair. I am of African descent and my hair is coarse/curly. I have shoulder length hair. I do not relax my hair but I do prefer to wear it straight. This blow dryer is amazing!!! I give myself weekly blow outs with this tool. I bought this to replace my wife's hair dryer for Christmas. I understand the description says NANO, but I was not prepared when I opened the box. This blow dryer is TINY! It fits in my hand, folded. And I'm an average sized guy with an average sized hand.

I stayed optimistic based on all the reviews, and when my wife opened this present, I had to work hard at selling it to her. She was optimistic, and tried it, but I could tell she wasn't that happy with it. It won't be her everyday hair dryer, and due to its size, will be a travel hair dryer. I don't know much about no frizz this or that, but it didn't seem to matter much to her.

Pros:
Long cord. Heats up fast. Not that noisy. Easy to access buttons. You can take the back screen off to clean it.

Cons:
Due to it's size, it puts out a Nano shot of hot air, which actually takes longer to dry hair than full or regular sized dryers. Her current conair which was about $30 at Costco will dry her hair in about 5-10 minutes, and at that time on this dryer, her hair was still pretty wet!
summary: Nano is smaller than you might think

reviewText: Overall, I really like how the blowdryer works. I have fine hair and it dries quickly and fairly frizz free. My only complaint is the placement of the on/off and temp buttons. They are placed right where my finger tips hold on and I often either accidentally turn off the blow dryer or change the temp simply because of the switch placements. First, don't pay a dime for these starter kits.  The Art of Shaving b&m stores give these kits away around black Friday.  At least they did in 2011 and 2012 when I got mine (unscented)..

The products themselves are decent and this kit is a good way to get an idea of old-fashinioned pre-shave and lathering techniques which can help achieve a better shave, whether using a cartridge razor or using the ever more popular and superior double edge safety razor.  However, The Art of Shaving products (full size versions) are very overpriced for what they are.  There are many other companies offering high quality shaving creams, soaps, after-shave balms, brushes, etc. for much more reasonable prices.  Look here on Amazon or on the many shaving forums online for quality products and vendors.

Get these kits for free around Thanksgiving.  If you like the ritual of using them, then look at other manufacturers for similar products at better prices.

Enjoy your shave.
summary: Art of Shaving gives these kits away around Black Friday

reviewText:
I have colored processed hair (from black to
blonde highlights) and it became very damaged because of that. I've used the Volumizing (pink) and the Hydrate (purple) in the past but I like the clean smell (Hydrate was a bit perfume-y) of this better.

I found that this conditioner worked significantly better (30%-40% better IMO) if you used a wide tooth comb to spread it out evenly after it's applied, then I clip it up for a while and do other things and then wash it out with slightly cooler water (if you can tolerate it). It seemed to absorb into the cuticle better as opposed to the glob-and-spread-with-hands method.

It a pricey conditioner at around $20 or so, but my hairdresser sold it to me at $27 so on Amazon it's a deal.
summary: Clean and fresh but works better if combed out!

reviewText: I have been anxiously waiting for this mascara to arrive in the mail,  I try mascara's all the time.  Since I've gotten older my eyelashes are not as thick as these to be. And when I was younger there are very thick and long and so I try mascara's all the time to get a little bit of that look back.  I  Didn't like it at all.  My eyelashes just clumped  together,  they didn't look thick at all and also my top and bottom eyelashes keep sticking together when I blink,  sometimes.  They also feel kind of stiff when I blink,  so I have a feeling,  taking it off,  is not going to be good.  I had high hopes,  but was very very disappointed.

This gets harder and harder to find in brown. With very light skin and light brown hair, black just doesn't work for me. Finding brown mascara at all is a challenge. Finding that is once-and-go that doesn't smudge by the end of the day is even harder. This is my favourite.
I love that it's dark brown and I don't mind the tubes that come off when I wash my face.  This stuff stays on when it counts and I love this product.
Great product!

I love blinc Mascara.  I use it over my regular mascara to protect it from smudges and to make it waterproof without the hassle of having to use makeup remover to take it off.  In order to save time in the morning, I put my mascara on the night before with blinc as the last step.  I always wake up with my lashes looking as fresh as when I put it on.  I can also leave it on for two or three days with little loss of coverage.  I will always have blinc Mascara in my makeup bag!

I got this for my husband because he likes to keep his facial hair well groomed...maybe I influence that a bit. He much prefers electric (read: faster) trimmers than these manual kinds. This set comes nicely packaged and seems to be well made. The included tool brush and storage boxes are nice touches. If you prefer manual ones, I'm sure this will suit your needs. But it's not a good method, in our honest opinion.
summary: Electric is best, for obvious reasons

reviewText: This product is amazing and I'll never use another mascara again. One thing to keep in mind, though. Because of the way Blinc covers your lashes it will do you not much good to curl your eyelashes before applying. Instead, put on the mascara, wait until it dries, then curl your eyelashes. It works perfectly! Since the mascara is different than any other, this won't hurt your eyelashes. And, I have to say I LOVE not having to use makeup remover and no, Blinc does NOT pull out your eyelashes. The best part of it for me is that the days of raccoon eyes are gone - it does not flake or come off at all, even after a workout. This mascara is the best - you must get some!
summary: This product is amazing and I'll never use another mascara again

reviewText: I was excited to try this since it is smudge & waterproof.  It is smudge proof provided it doesn't get wet.  Since it washes off with water if you sweat & rub your eyes off it comes. I use it with the lash primer and get just the length and volume that I want for everyday wear.  When I want more volume or length for evening or performance, I use the primer, another lengthening/volumizing mascara and then put Blinc over it and I can get the same quality of waterproof/sweatproofness.  Removing it is easy using plenty of water and gently rubbing.  It looks like your lashes are coming off, but it is only the mascara "tubes".
Even my hairdresser said so!  I didn't have trouble with the applicator, as others have mentioned.  This is a quick way to save a little money at the salon.

reviewText: Ok, let's face it, unless you are very lucky, most of us over 60, have dry, chemically damaged hair. A couple weeks ago, though, I smelled it, was enraptured by the scent (think of a seductive harem or sacred anointing oil, cause it has that frankincensey-myrrhy sort of smell that reminds me of both, funnily enough). Good stuff, and this seller has a good price. Less than the 50 bucks at my local area beauty stores for this very large jar (2 cups + worth of mask creme.)

reviewText:
I recently purchased this product through my husbands prime account. I got it because ever since I was a kid I had keratosis pilaris on my upper arms, and after I started my career it spread to the backs of my thighs. It's embarrassing. I've used it for a total of 4 days, twice daily on my arms and legs, and once daily on my face. I don't have acne but I do have larger pores than I would like. My skin feels amazingly soft and smooth and there are no more bumps. The red dots from the skin condition are about 50% improved after using it less than a week. I could not be more pleased. After suffering a lifetime from this embarrassing condition I've finally found something that seems to work well.

I will say that the lotion is pretty uncomfortable when it is first applied. It feels like a million ant bites for about 5-10 minutes. But it's totally worth it for the soft skin, and improvement in the appearance. I also find it's pretty greasy. Again, totally worth it for a product that is doing a job exactly what I bought it for.
summary: I don't have acne but I do have larger pores than I would like. My skin feels amazingly soft and smooth and ...

No way I could use it on my entire body. But I kept it thinking I will use it on legs ,..... But guys please, I have tried so many times to somehow use it ... But it's just not possible. I often put it and after few minutes take a shower agin to wash it off. It is just disgustingly sticky. Very bad product. I wish I can find another 17% glycolic product in a thinner lotion.

reviewText: Got this product years ago from my dermatologist. Absolutely the best for bumpy red skin on the backs of arms, legs, wherever. This was also the best price and the package deal with the lotion made it a bargain.

Like a lot of other users of this lotion, I have KP and have been using Amlactin for years to help with KP. It worked for a while, but I was starting to notice that my KP was a bit "resistant" and would come back anyway. A friend gave me this for my birthday and I must say that it works! My KP is pretty much gone, and my skin is unbelievably soft. If you have any broken skin, it does burn, so be a bit careful if you're having any issues with broken skin. I will definitely keep using this product. Not to mention, it doesn't smell anywhere near as bad as Amlactin.
summary: This stuff really works if you have KP!

I've had really bad back acne/scars for years and nothing was getting rid of it (I was using more OTC products).  For me this product worked in conjunction with all the other things I was doing for my acne and it was helping to reduce the hormonal breakouts as well.
To reduce the scars and breakouts, I also received monthly back peels (PCA acid peels) and I would scrub/exfoliate my back at least a few times a week.  I was very diligent about caring for my back and it did take a long time for it to get under control.  So don't be discouraged if you don't see results right away.  For me, keeping my back as dry as possible did the trick.  My regimen every day was scrub my entire back in the shower (soap/water) & rinse with hot water, towel dry, then spray my back with the Glytone back spray and let it air dry.
Be warned, this spray does make you cough if you accidentially inhale it.  I honestly hold my breath when I spray this stuff on my back.  I would suggest for you to spray it in a well-ventilated area and not around children or adults with respiratory problems.

reviewText: great for your hair . love this product

This spray is fair.  It does have some hold, which is good because my hair is resistant to holding products.  It also does a decent job of protecting my hair from heated styling tools.  However, Redken Iron Shape 11 or Hot Sets 22 works better than this product.  Iron Shape allows natural movement and has great hold all while providing thermal protection and adding shine.  My hair never gets stiff, sticky or crunchy and it looks like hair, not like pageant hair or helmet head.  Hot Off The Press tends to flake and will definitely get stiff if you over spray it.  Iron Shape never does that and my waves last several days.  Hot Sets 22 has twice the hold of Iron Shape and is great if you use hot rollers and want your curls to last for a couple of days at least.  For someone with hard to hold hair like mine, these two Redken products are a godsend.  I don't know why I decided I needed to try Hot Off The Press, I guess I was curious and was encouraged by all the positive reviews.  Don't get me wrong it's a decent product but these two Redken products are much better.  I apply Iron Shape liberally to clean damp hair and then let it air dry overnight.  In the morning, it's not stiff or sticky and I can easily get a brush through it.  I then use a curling iron to create loose waves.  I run a brush through the curls just once and they spring back into shape immediately and last several days.  If I need to recurl, I simply spray some additional Iron Shape, which doesn't build up or have any residue. I can't do that with Hot Off The Press.  I am returning HOTP to Ulta and exchanging it for more Iron Shape.  I was using Living Proof No Frizz Weightless Styling Spray but discovered Iron Shape during my search for a less expensive dupe.  Iron Shape is half the price of LP and provides thermal protection whereas LP does not.  Iron Shape also adds a nice sheen that doesn't look at all greasy or oily.  As far as I'm concerned Iron Shape is a perfect product.  If you want thermal protection with hold, then Iron Shape is the product for you.  There were too many things about HOTP that I didn't like and nothing not to like with Iron Shape, it even smells amazing.  I don't recommend Hot Off The Press at all.  But Iron Shape is the bomb!

reviewText: Smells a bit weird but overall good product.

The La Roche-Posay Effaclar face soap is actually rather effective. Much like any other over the counter soap, it will help eliminate skin oil for a period of time. However, I have extremely oily skin, and this, like others, only lasts until about 2pm each day. The gel comes in a relatively large bottle, and should last a while. It may seem expensive at first, but I think it is cheaper than most you will find in the drug store in the long run.
The soap foams really well and has a very pleasant mild scent. The name may be a little bit misleafing since it it doesn't have a foam dispenser. Overall, it cleans really well and is very affordable for such an excellent quality product.

***
A quick update after a week of use: if you use it consistently, such as every day, it will gradually and gently make your skin dryer/less oily. Apparently, the results improve over time.

My skin is still soft after cleansing and best of all, not itchy and I haven't had a single rash or breakout. It has a light fruity scent (watermelon?), fluffy lather and rinses quickly. reviewText: I have very straight, fine hair, and this product works great!  I keep my hair short and messy, but HATE gels/pastes that leave my hair feeling 'crispy' and looking 'shiny'.  I used to use a wax stick, but it took two shampoos to get it out my hair, and they can be expensive!  I have yet to find anything that compares to Re-Works (believe me...I've tried quite a bit).  Gives a good hold, but can be re-styled if desired (won't harden up).  Its a bit goopy when you apply it, but it doesn't feel as gross in my hair as a wax stick would.  And, it washes out easily.  The one pitfall is that it's hard to find.  Even salons that carry PM products will rarely have re-works in-stock (some even say their distributor doesn't carry it).  It is a bit expensive, but the one bottle lasts a while (I average a bottle every 4 months, using some 4 times per week on average).

In theory, this glove is great. It worked well the 1st time, and after that, it ripped at the seams. It was a huge waste of money and I am so mad because it was not cheap.  I'd recommend investing in a different glove.

The worst eye lash curler ever. It pinches your eyelashes instead of curling them no matter how little or much pressure you use. The Japonesque traditional curler is the best one I have ever used and will continue to use. Please do not purchase this the design looks like it will get all your lashes but it doesn't because the curler is plastic and thick it is nearly impossible to see your eyelashes in order to curl them it is just too bulky to use on lashes.
love love love.  I have been using the old fashion metal ones for years and decided to try these!!
Lots of pockets. Lots of room yet not too big. Perfect size.
I still want to see how the Urban Decay curler of the same sort measures up. This one felt like it was doing nothing.
Love this brand, this is my second one in 10 years. Fits my eye very well where other brands pinch. Love the FREE refills for life. It just works.
Cool product, but doesn't curl my lashes very well

Didn't work well at all and snapped in half after very little use.

This is the unsung hero of eyelash curlers.  I've had all kinds of curlers, from higher-end Shu Umera, Shiseido and Tweezerman... to even chinsy Revlon and Covergirl ones (bleh).  The Japonesque curler has a nice, wide cage that's curved (but NOTso curved that it'll give you that awful 'crimp' effect) -- it really curls at the root.  If you have unruly lashes and/ or narrow or almond-shaped eyes, this thing will curl the heck out of your lashes, and that curl will last (use an oil-based or waterproof mascara to hold that curl even longer, fyi).  It works just as well as a Shiseido or Shu, and on Amazon (at least when I bought it) costs a little less than at Ulta.  Genuine, well-built, great results.  If you need a good curler, get this one!

I love this eyelash curler.  I bought one then misplaced it (I will probably find it under the seats in my car someday--I take it everywhere.) I tried fake eyelashes for a few months before replacing this, thinking fakes might be easier/faster.  I lost patience with fakes and went back to a drugstore curler just because it was convenient but finally took a few extra minutes to order this curler online.  It really is the best I've used--the design is strong but gentle, and the curl comes from close to the eyelash base so it really maximizes the appearance of the lashes you have.  Other curlers just crimp your lashes in the middle and bend them in half, but this curler's design gives a great, from-the-eyelid lift to your whole natural lash.  I really love it--not worth the months I wasted experimenting on fakes and cheaper curlers.  Save yourself time and fuss--buy this one, although maybe buy two, just in case you get addicted and misplace one...

Love this curler. It gets those pesky lashes that don't seem to make it into the regular lash curler. A must-have for those with long lash lines (like me), or to help give an extra oomph to curl resistant lashes after you've used a regular lash curler.

I can store all of my brushes in this thoughtfully designed brush case. I like how the top flaps over to protect the brush bristles.  The case conveniently folds into thirds. Black shiny finish, secures snugly with velcro. Silver Japonesque logo on front. Zippered pouch good for extra sponge tip applicators or perhaps, blotting tissues. Unlike some reviewers, I do not think this case is too long.  9.5"long x 5"wide when folded, this case will fit easily into my travel carry-on. I am happy with my purchase. Didn't have to spend tons $ on a brush case. It can be difficult to find  a decent one without having to buy the brushes too.

This eyelash curler is awesome. It does a great job curling the lashes and making them look naturally curled. Unfortunately, it gets broken easily. I have bought about six or eight of them. Regardless of that, I will continue buying it. It would be great if they could come up with a stronger one :)

It is bulky, not comfortable to hold, and unless you have small eyes, I'm not sure how it can possibly grab all of your top lashes and curl them at once.  I had a very hard time getting all of my lashes in there (and my lashes are long, so it should be easy)...it crimped the outer edges of my lashes so they looked bent, and really didn't work very well for the center lashes either.  Total waste of money--go with the Shu Uemura curler--much better curler that actually WORKS! This is a piece of plastic junk.

reviewText: I'v had different brands of flat irons but I always go back to chi. It has a sleek look and I really like the temp control! Favorite flat iron!

I suffer from migraines so I have been looking for a noise-tolerable hair dryer.  I purchased the new Dyson hair dryer (already own other Dyson products and love the brand) and this one.  Ended up returning the Dyson and keeping this guy.  When used it on low, which is pretty potent already, this hair dryer doesn't have the annoying high-pitched noise the Dyson has (that can trigger my migraines).  The noise levels coming from this unit in my bedroom measured 73 dB when used on low, and 77 dB when used on high. For reference, I have tile flooring and just a small area rug so not a whole lot around to dampen noise.  If a quieter hair dryer is important to you, you might want to give this a try.  When used on high, it has a bit of a high pitched noise (as you would with any small fan, hence my issue with the Dyson hair dryer) but still not as bad as the Dyson.  The Dyson measured 77 db on the lowest setting in my bedroom, and it had the high-pitched noise that is extremely annoying to me.
It heats up really fast and it can get really hot so I typically use it on low heat/low fan, and it takes about 10 minutes to dry my hair (which is fairly long, almost to the middle of my back).
I am very pleased with this product.  My only complaints are its weight, and that it is not dual voltage so I can't take it with me when I travel abroad as most other countries don't use 110V.  Not deal breakers for me, though, because I'm more concerned about noise levels :)
summary: If a quieter hair dryer is important to you, you might want to give this a try.

reviewText: Glad I can use this product at home and not have to spend time at the salon.  It is more affordable that way.  This is a very transparent pink.  I was looking for just a clear polish and this was as close to that as I could find.
1ST IT WAS WAY TOO LIGHT & 2ND IT DIDN'T STAY ON PASSED 3 DAYS. I AM A LICENSED NAIL TECH SO I KNOW HOW TO APPLY THE PRODUCT SO THAT WASN'T THE PROBLEM.

Beautiful inky dark chocolate brown color. One thin coat and then a second thicker coat - leaves a super glossy finish.

This is a soft baby pink - almost like cotton candy.  It is a cream polish, not frosted.  For those looking for a really nice pink, it's one of my favorites.  If you want your polish to POP, look for another shade.  Sometimes the color of the polish through the bottle is a little deceiving; you really have to put it on your nail to see the true color.

As I have stated with another review for Shellac I think this is worth pointing out to potential buyers that this is a UV polish - it requires curing via a UV light and is used with Shellac UV base and top coats!

Having purchased a bunch of pinks and reds, I decided on something a bit different and this certainly fit the bill! Its a beautiful color, really unique and perfect as we go into Fall!

The color may best be described as a deep purple! It is a deep inky color. I cured the base coat for about 2 minutes, as I find this works better than the time suggested on the bottle which is in seconds, then applied 2 coats curing each for 2 minutes! It needs the 2 coats as the color is a little faint and washed out with just one application! Then followed with a generous coat of the Shellac top coat!

The result: pretty and shiny nails, I have been wearing this color for 10 days and still no peeling or chipping! It looks as shiny as the first day I applied it and the color is still vibrant!  It is really a cool modern color and will look great for Fall  / Winter and a great party idea for Halloween! It is pretty dark so worth noting!

To remove I find the easiest thing is to get a small bowl, fill with some acetone and soak for about 6-10 minutes, it simply melts off with no problem!
summary: Amazing color with great staying power!

reviewText: In the winter, my skin can be outrageously dry. If I'm outside a lot, the skin on the back of my hands will actually crack and bleed. This product is an excellent solution. I've had to rush to the sink and wash a strongly perfumed cream off my hands that felt like it was burning. On the contrary, it is rather soothing, and after several minutes seemed to completely be absorbed by my skin, leaving it feeling smooth and hydrated. If you suffer from extremely dry skin, this could be the product for you.
summary: Sincerely recommended if your skin gets really dry and cracked.

For a number of years I have used prescription medication to manage adult acne.  Most of the medications are not covered by insurance and can be very costly at anywhere from $50 - $200. CND is one of the best brand of gel shellac that I have used. It will cure using an LED light or a UV light. I have used both.  I have tried some of the less expensive brands, but they have caused nail damage, especially the ones that claim not to need a base coat. As long as I soak off the CND gel thoroughly with pure acetone, there have been no issues. Do not scrape residuals off. Let the acetone do the work. Make sure all layers are removed. If your nail looks shiny, the base coat has not been completely removed. Then soak longer. When applying the gel, be sure to apply one coat of the base, 2 coats of shellac, one top coat, and cure according to the directions between each coat. Be sure to seal the edges of each coat or you may get water between the coats and your nail, which may result in a nail fungus. If applied properly, it will last 2 weeks. I would not advise keeping it on longer than this due to the breakdown of the shellac, and nail exposure to water infiltration. Love this brand. Well worth the money.

reviewText: Great product, thanks !!!

I cannot believe how people are crucifying this product. This lasercomb can be promising to many if you take the time and have the knowledge to use it correctly. Its not a miracle cure. This device works when used with a combination of shampoo and supplements. Do your research. The laser comb needs help to be effective. Its a 3 step process. First you want to get a specialized  shampoo and this one came highly recommended by a doctor friend of mine...  Pura d or. Kind of a tricky name but I did spell it correctly. Get the hair loss formula as it comes in different formulas. Its an organic shampoo with no harsh chemicals and only the best ingredients, some of which are responsible for stopping/slowing hair loss. It can be found on Amazon. This shampoo by itself(WHEN USED PROPERLY) will stop(not regrow) hair loss in most people. Its not a 2 week fix. It takes months to see results. Patience is a virtue. There is also a product called HLCC Scripts Complete. Its a 30 or 90 day supply of supplements that inhibits the DHT in your scalp. DHT is an enzyme in your scalp that causes the hair follicles to shrink and eventually fall out. Eliminate the DHT and your hair will fight back. This supplement is not cheap, but it is the best and it WORKS. Myskincenter dot com is where I get mine. Now you have a 3 fold plan and you are attacking your hair loss both internally and externally.

Now for the laser comb. Neat little device that provides a soft non irritating laser bath to the scalp.  When used in conjunction with the above you should see positive regrowth in 4 to 6 months. Is it gonna work for everyone? No, some people are just not going to get results. But I consider it a chance worth taking for me and the odds are on your side that you will see positive results over time.  I bought the most powerful laser comb because you have to use it less(8 minutes as appose to 12 or 15 with the other models) because of the more powerful laser. I have been using it 4 times a week and my hair loss has stopped. I have type 1 male pattern baldness for which I am lucky. I am looking forward to future regrowth. Its only been about 60 days. I am seeing results though as far as no more hair loss. This is very cool. I will update in the upcoming months. Also if you choose to buy a laser comb watch the price as it fluctuates by as much as a hundred dollars. I got lucky and paid 370 dollars. The next day it was 440 dollars.

Finally, I am in no way associated with any of these products, I fly jets for a living, its just that I have confidence in my research and the hair regrowth issue is such a touchy,misunderstood topic. If you are gonna blast the product because you think it is gonna be some miracle cure for hair thinning, educate yourself first and give the lasercomb a fighting chance.
summary: Works if you have a plan

It is tricky to get hair to behave and still be soft, but this pomade pulls it off well.  It goes on like a thick gel, and is shiny or matte if you apply it when your hair is wet or dry, respectively. My only critique is that as the magic wears off over the day and the hair is tussled out of place, it leaves the texture looking on the greasy and clumpy side. reviewText: Such a good price. Can't go wrong.

Overall I find this body wash to be about what I expected. It's a satisfying treat but nothing to make it a new absolute favorite. The wash itself is fine; it lathers and cleans like any wash I'm used to. The scent (grapefruit variety) is nice: gender-neutral, not too fruity or sweet, and more complex than what you'd usually pick up at the drugstore. It's not a particular favorite, but should have broad appeal. I really don't notice it once I'm out of the shower, though.

The bottle is attractive, and gives the impression of something you'd find in a nice hotel. The pump isn't especially convenient, though. I need about five pumps to produce enough lather for a whole wash; each pump is small so I don't feel it's a large amount, just an inconvenient process. You'll also be bent over if you don't have a shower ledge at a comfortable height. It needs to be resting on something since you'll need one hand to hold a sponge and another to work the pump top. All that to say, the packaging seems luxe, but I don't actually like it better than an average squeeze bottle.

This might be a good choice if you want something that looks extra fancy, or happen to know you LOVE one of the scents. Otherwise, it's nice but not remarkable.

reviewText: I was skeptical but hopeful that I'd notice a difference in 6 weeks or so. I actually saw a nice result in only a couple weeks. I use twice a day - morning & evening after I've removed my makeup. Those soft, vertical wrinkles right at the center of my neck are becoming less noticeable. Must be something in the product that tightens immediately and then with longer results, because I see a huge difference in wrinkly, turkey neck as soon as I've applied - with upward and outward strokes. Jawline noticeably tighter as well. I plan to continue to use the product and am considering perhaps trying their other products. Very happy with my purchase. I have tried a LOT of OTC and also use Retin-A for many years. This is the only OTC I have tried that works as well as my Rx product does.

After satisfactorily purchasing through Amazon for many years, this is my first complaint review. I'm currently in the "hindsight is 20/20" mode. After spending $90 of my hard-earned money on this product, it arrived with a narrow puncture hole in the product box and no seal on the box lids nor on the dispenser, but I still had confidence in Amazon's overall quality assurance process, even though I thought this inappropriate. Now after using the product as directed for the past several weeks, and NOT experiencing ANY of the written claims ("feel the instant toning effect ... your face looks firmer..."), I believe I received a bogus/adulterated/altered or expired product, and it has eroded my trust in Amazon. I love vanilla scents, and this Comptoir Sud Pacifique had great reviews so I decided to give it a try. I'll admit, at first I was not sure about this one. It goes on strong, and when I first spritzed it I got the dreaded "Play Doh" notes that other reviewers have mentioned. However, after a few subsequent uses, the smell seemed to shift for me and has since settled into smelling sweet and sugary, like fresh vanilla frosting or toasted marshmallows -- in fact, on separate occasions, I have had coworkers say I smelled like both of these. It's delicious! I now look forward to putting it on every day. The scent also has pretty decent lasting power (I still get whiffs by the end of the day) and mixes well with other sweet smells -- it has layered well when I tried it with vanilla and coconut lotions.

I think the sweetness of the fragrance might be a little too cloying for warmer months, but it's really nice for fall and winter. I'm glad I gave it a try!
summary: Nice fragrance once it settles in

No directions, no warnings...a little note about how many twists are needed and to slow down once getting close to that number would be helpful.

Next, the product itself and color for my light skin is perfect. It covers the spots on my cheekbones next to my eyes just perfectly, however, I applied some product under my eyes and was horrified at how it accentuated my wrinkles! Didn't think it was possible for a concealer to make me look worse, but it did. I wouldn't recommend this to be used on any type of wrinkly skin (I'm late 40s, so they're not massive wrinkles, either) but it is great for younger women and those wanting to cover blotches, marks or age spots on smooth areas of skin.

I ran across this line of SPF after looking for a new face moisturizer with SPF and initially I thought $26 for sunscreen seemed crazy. But after reading about the differences of the normal sunscreen and mineral, the fact that it instantly provides SPF coverage rather than waiting the normal 20-30 minutes, I thought would be helpful since I'm not great about applying before heading out to the pool. In addition, all the other aerosol brands leave a film on my skin that is terrible to wash off so I stopped using them several years ago. I had switched to Kiss My Face Brand and while it works really well, I did miss a nice summer smell and the fact that I love Pina Colada's, I thought I would give it a shot. When a staycation last weekend at a resort pool gave me a reason to splurge I bought the bottle.

The stuff is great! It does smell like pina colada and while it does still have the alcohol smell when spraying, it smells good and I found myself reapplying! Something that I'm not great about either! If this is what it takes for me to reapply sunscreen so I can enjoy summertime a bit more safer and still smell good, the price tag is worth it!

We have used both the pina colada and citrus mimosa for two summers. I had two motivations for finding and using it. One; it conformed to my daughter's diet of gluten and dairy free and Two; it's all organic with none of those dodgy carcinogens in it.

It smells fantastic, sprays on like a mist and being British (basically fair skinned and never in the sun) and living in SC I have never burned. Neither has my daughter who immediately jumps in the pool once applied.

Totally recommend! All of their sunscreens (which is all we have used) are fabulous.

reviewText:
Borghese Gel Delicato Makeup remover is the Best period!  I've used it for years, and I hope this product will be around for years to come.
Yes ~ it is pricey, however excellent quality, refreshing to the skin, and worth Every Penny!

I got sample this with my Ipsy glam bag and it has since them become a part of my daily routine. I put it on before bed every night and it leaves my lips super soft in the morning. I'm buying another tube to replace the old one. By far the best lip balm I've ever used...comperable to a expensive lip mask or a hefty amount of more popular brand. I'd never recommend anything else.

I got this lip balm as part of a set, and it may be one of the worst lip balms I've ever used. I love Bliss products, so I tried really hard to use and love it, but in the end I've had to throw it away. First, the consistency is really thin - it's not a balm so much as a clear gloss. It's kind of sticky in a really unpleasant way. It also wears off really quickly, so even if it had some wonderful softening ingredients that were wonderful for your lips, they wouldn't be spending a lot of time there to work their mojo! Because it wears off so quickly, you have to keep reapplying and reapplying. After a few weeks of use, I found that my lips were significantly drier and more chapped when I was using this balm than they had been before. I wouldn't pay $1.99 for this lip balm, let alone $13.95. Better spend less money for lip balm from Alba Organica or Badger or Burt's Bees or any number of other brands.
I am thrilled to find a product to keep my hair from going limp when I sweat!  I am also happy to retain my style when the wind hits my hair.
