reviewText:
Love La Roche Posay, and love this serum.  Going on my second bottle.  I use it every night after cleansing with a Clarisonic, then follow with the Toleriane moisturizer.
It burns a little in the beginning, but after two or three days it stops.  It feels like a very light oil, and I can feel it washing off with water in the morning. I don't use it during the day - it doesn't feel like it would work under makeup.  It makes the skin shiny when it's on.
Like the other reviewer, I apply pretty close to my eyes, and it doesn't bother me.
My skin looks better the next morning, and if I stick to it, a week later it's just glowing, even-toned, and supple.  I am a 40yo with combination skin and a few wrinkles here and there, and occasional acne.
The bottle was lasting well when I was using it just on the face, but I got so excited with the results that I started spreading it down to the neck and cleavage and the back of my hands as well, so now it's going a lot faster.

Nice product brightness noticed in a day or so. would recommend.  Good value from Amazon. Product was not old and packaging was well and in tact.  One often worries about purchasing beauty products from Amazon as to their shelf life. This was recieved and performed.  Please note this is not for sensitive skin.
summary: Nice product brightness noticed in a day or so

reviewText:
This conditioner is AMAZING!!

I had just bleached and dyed my hair for the first time ever, so my hair was a little dry after. Also, I never really had "proper" hair-care until my hair-dresser told me all the products I should use. She recommended this one as a "really good every day conditioner," and this has worked SO GOOD for the past month. My hair looks super healthy with a natural shine, makes my color look even better, and doesn't wash it out either! Also, after a whole month, there's still 3/4 of product left in the bottle, so I'm sure this can last anyone 3-4 months -- maybe even longer if you're more frugal about it.

Also, it's really easy to use too! Just wet your hair, put a nickel sized amount on your palm (depending on how much hair you have this may require more or less), rub it into your hands, and then apply it to the mid-section and ends of your hair. Leave it in for two minutes, rinse it out, and then in seconds you'll have healthier looking hair! It may take a few washes before you start seeing results, depending on how damaged your hair is, but for me it worked instantly! Could not recommend this enough!
Love this product I purchase it on a regular basis.  Great for my color treated hair
I read the reviews and decided to try this.  My hair is naturally blond, wavy and thick.  It makes my hari calm down with out the grease look.  I really like it and makes my hair so soft.
While staying at the Double Tree hotel. We enjoyed the scented lotion and shampoos they provided. So I had to look you up and ordered. My husband and I really love the smell. Thank you.
LOVE IT!

Have used this for the last 9 months and it is wonderful.
Due to hormones over the last ten years I have had on and off horrible acne flair ups....not since using this product and the Acne face cleanser!

I ordered this product which was sold by Simply 4 Less and fulfilled by Amazon, I used it twice and after the first night I noticed some itching with little red bumps..then after the second night I got up with big red welts that were hot and itchy! The product smelled a bit different, more acidic than normal (I've been using this product for 2 years but getting it from an aesthetician) I'm not sure if I got a bad bottle from a bad batch but it really tore up my face! It's still that way on the third day. I wanted to return it because of my reaction but wasn't allowed to do so online because it said "this item is not eligible for returns" - I contacted Amazon and received a refund (Thank You Amazon! :) I also returned the Cyto-Luxe serum I had not opened yet because it also came from this seller and oddly enough was eligible for returns. This being said, be careful if you order this product and discontinue at FIRST SIGNS there is a problem instead of using it again like I did!
summary: Not like what I've been using

I generally like Art of Shaving products, especially their pre-shave products.  However, I have been thoroughly disappointed with this product.  While the scent is very pleasant (a surprise for Kelp!) the gel does not provide me with the lubrication I need under the shave cream.  It comes out of the pump feeling like a gel, but when spread on the skin, it more or less just disappears.  And to top it off, the pump stopped functioning when the bottle was about 2/3 empty.  The top does not come off and I had to break the pump off the glass in order to get at the remaining product (at this price, I was not about to waste it!!!).  This is not worth the price and is not up to Art of Shaving standards.

I happened across an Art of Shaving store in a nearby mall, and picked up the Pre-Shave Gel because they promised it would help with electric razors. I (somewhat) alternate between not shaving, electric razor and mach-3 blade, depending on the occasion. I like using the electric because it's quick and less messy. But the effectiveness of the electric varies depending on the humidity. This gel helps the electric provide a consistent and even shave, without any burn. I am VERY pleased with the results from two electric shaves so far. Whether I'll use the gel in addition to the cream with a blade shave I haven't decided. I will have to try it a few more times to see if it adds value for me. I will also check the Amazon price for the next bottle because right now it's $3 cheaper than the mall store or online.

Note that this is NOT an oil. I do NOT recommend using the oil with an electric razor. This gel washes out of the electric head easily. The oil does NOT (emphasis intentional). I had a small bottle of the oil in the Starter Kit I got at the mall store. Tried it once and threw it away. It might be useful in dryer climates, but here in Texas that isn't the issue.
ive been spiking my hair for the paat 18 years and i love this stuff it has to be the best by far. gives a nice clean look that dose not feel weighed down.

I've never had face powder dusting my vanity top after applying it to my face, but with this purchase, if I am not very careful with my brush, powder goes everywhere. It creates a mess I have to clean up every morning.  It's still great face powder, but I'm afraid that with this loose style, the compact might not last as long as my others. We'll see.

reviewText: I have been searching high and low for a good eye cream. I am 30 years old with fine lines around my eyes due to constant irritation from blepharitis. I have used many drugstore and high end products, but I always end up throwing them out mid way because they don't seem to help. I bought this eye cream since I am a huge fan of the rest of the Loccitane products. Suffice to say I have found my perfect match..I have been using this for a month now and the fine lines have definitely started disappearing. It makes my under eye area silky smooth to touch. Hasn't done much for my dark circles yet, but it may be too soon to tell. Makeup goes on very smoothly with this. I will definitely be sticking to this cream for a long time!

I won't even recommend the product, I would go for an off brand because here we're just paying for the Jack Black label.

I have hair that just doesn't take to curl well. With these, some time, and a good bit of hairspray, I can achieve a decent curl. It is very much a voluminous curl, though - not a curly curl. I've got fairly long hair and the eight rollers are adequate for me, although there is an option to buy additional rollers if needed. They heat in a reasonable amount of time - about 3-5 minutes - and they don't burn your fingers when you put them in (I can't be the only one who used to burn themselves on those old plastic Conair ones in the '90s). The fact that they come with a storage pack is helpful to me - I'm actually able to keep up with everything because it all goes straight back into the little square bag that it belongs in. I'm pleased with them, and glad to find them for a better price than I was seeing elsewhere.

These are the most wonderful hot rollers I've ever used! They give long hair volume and soft waves without creasing from the clips. There's a red dot that turns white when they're heated and it turns red again when they've cooled and are ready to take out of your hair.
I was a little hesitant to buy these because they are so expensive, but they're worth every penny. Ignore the negative reviews - these are great!

Pros:

Color: it's a rosy pink, I have pale skin and I think a rosy pink looks perfect with that
packaging: may I say adorable??? Like seriously, get it together America, where's my cute packaging?
Application: It stays where I want it to. For example, if I want to do gradiant lips, it doesn't spread all over my lip. If I want a fuller application it doesn't smudge off the lip.
Brightness: for a LIP GLOSS not a lipstick, the brightness is pretty good. It's not overly sticky.
Delivery time: came 2 weeks early!!! yay me :)
Cons:
Brightness: lol on both. Anyway, the brightness wears off pretty much immediately. But the initial color stays

Overall, pretty good.

Wow, I really like this product.  I like getting facials, but they are few and far between, usually when I'm looking at some special event. It leaves your skin very smooth ... and you don't have to leave home for your facial!  I plan on giving this as a gift to my daughters.

This tiny Clarisonic cleans my skin beautifully. It does not take up much space on the bathroom counter, it can be used in the shower, and it is easy to travel with.  I love that It holds a powerful charge for weeks! When a recharge is needed, plugging it in overnight does the trick!  Easy to keep clean as well!

I have a Clarisonic Plus which has been replaced twice.  They last approximately 24 months before they stop spinning and all you get is a device that hums.  Clarisonic offers a discount to repurchase a new one but the fact that they don't stand behind the product should tell you to not purchase one at all.  It's OK for skincare but not the be all end all for great skin.  I will not purchase another one.

I can appreciate what this devise offers.

However I cant believe I sprung for the mia 2.  $150.00 is a lot of money to drop on something,  especially when the mia 1 would have suited my needs just fine.

reviewText: Pleasantly surprised with the scent of this BOUCHERON Jaipur Homme Eau de Parfum, Spicy Oriental. I have a sensitive nose and find this very nice. It has a sandlewood cinnamon spice odor without perfume overtone. The alcohol base burns off quickly leaving a mild warm masculine scent, the warmer the skin the deeper the scent. Doesn't overpower the room and makes you want to get closer to the person wearing it. Each person's own body chemistry can alter final smell, I suggest trying in store sample to see if it will work for yours.

reviewText: amazing

I had high hopes this would be very similar to The Balm lipsticks of the past, the  discontinued ones with the vintage newspaper lettering package, but nope.
This is a thick and creamy lipstick like so many others out there with no "balm" sheerness at all. The color, Mia Moore,  runs slightly neutral, not blue and not orange.

Love the provenance this shave soap has, feels like I'm lathering up in an old italian barber shop when I shave with my Proraso. Love the Eucalyptus and Menthol, gives a nice tingle on multiple lathers, although the scent isn't as strong as I imagined it would be; its more dull on the nose than I prefer... That aside, it has been a good occasional soap for me... my go to is Art of Shaving Lavender however...

The new formula makes for a decent shaving cream.  But for the price asked, I have to say the value drops off.  In my opinion, this product performs nearly identically to Kiss My Face Moisture Shave.  I can't tell any difference between the two lathers other than scent.  However KMF gives you a lot more product for a lot less money.

It's easy to use, just shake out a wet brush and start swirling on the soap.  You can't really overload the brush, but you can under-load it, so be aware of that.  I usually load for 30-60 seconds on a damp brush.  If you're creating excessive foam while loading, the brush is too wet.  Take that to your bowl, hand or face to whip up an easy shave ready lather.  This stuff does lather very easily, and it's very easy to find its sweet spot without overshooting it.

It provides a reasonably protective lather.  It whips up thick and feels very creamy, substantial, and provides good glide and cushion when properly hydrated.  I don't typically have any irritation issues with this product, but do occasionally open up a weeper on my neck where I have difficult spots to shave.  The lather rinses easily and doesn't clog the razor.  I typically shave a whole cheek or one side of my neck between rinses and don't have issues with clogging at all.

The scent is minimal, hardly noticable in my opinion, but it has a good clean soapy/antiseptic smell.  The eucalyptus oil is the prevalent scent, so if you've smelled that before, you'll have a pretty good idea.  The menthol is minimal as well.  I don't personally notice any cooling effect whatsoever.  I could name a product or two with really excellent menthol presence.  I wouldn't put this one on the list.

Moisturizing? It doesn't dry me out, but at the same time I don't feel hydrated after a shave.  I would rate this as neutral.  Not bad, not great either.  It just gets the job done.  I follow this with an aftershave balm to lock down any dry skin issues.

All in all, I can see why so many people appreciate the product.  It's easy to use, and does a pretty good job.  And it's not terribly expensive.  But for the money, there's better value to be had.  I strongly suggest you try out Kiss My Face products.  The pump bottles look like hand soap dispensers, but the product inside performs almost identically to this one, perhaps a bit more moisturizing, and with all natural ingredients, not to mention at a much better price per ounce.

Creates an excellent lather, use a wet brush and spin it into the Proraso for about 30 seconds, then transfer to your bowl and spin it again for 30 seconds.  Great smelling too, skin feels very fresh with it.

I was using the puck style shaving soaps for years with a good Merkur razor and enjoyed it well enough. I decided to give this a try after seeing all the awesome reviews. I am so happy I switched. It smells great, leaves my skin feeling good and lasts forever. It lathers very well and shaves nice and smooth. It arrived quickly and was well packaged. I'm going to try the Sandalwood next as I love that scent. These have a nice smell but not powerful or overbearing. It lingers for just a bit then fades which is kinda nice. I don't enjoy walking around smelling like a teenager on his first date like some products do. This is a mans method of shaving and should be taught to anyone ready to learn. Proraso has been doing this right for a long time it seems and I don't suspect that's about to change. I'm a lifer now.

UPDATE: I have used this product 3 times a week for nearly 4 months and I'm just now having to buy new. The cost savings of this plus the quality of the shave makes me absolutely recommend this.
summary: Glad I switched to this, you will be too.

A lot of beauty products designed to cover facial redness have a green tint, but I read that while green neutralizes red in paints it doesn't work the same way on the skin, and that yellow is a better choice. That has been my experience (I threw out my first green concealer), and this product has been good for covering the red more naturally, although I find I cannot wear it alone. It also does not go well with the lighter of my two shades of mineral foundation. But it is excellent with the darker foundation and looks more natural than any liquid concealer. Now that I have rosacea I only buy high quality mineral make up and I will buy this product again.

I bought this product because I was searching for pure, organic and non-toxic lipsticks. This product contains titanium dioxide (among other ingredients) and although it looks good, it is potentially neurotoxic. Just wanted to let anyone else know who was on the search for non-toxic makeup to look elsewhere.

Good product

I am in love with this new curling iron! I have been using the John Frieda 1.5 inch hot air brush for a few years now. It has held up really well but my hair is finally starting to get longer and I felt like I just needed something a little bigger to add some more volume. I just got this today and I am so amazed! I was debating between this one and the Infiniti Pro 2-inch, but decided on this one because of the metal barrel. Based on past experiences with hair brushes and hot air brushes (and I have been using them since high school - I'm now 34), metal barrels ALWAYS work better and hold up a lot better. So today I showered, applied my styling product and threw my hair up before since I didn't have time to dry it before getting my kids from school. Normally I have to blow dry and use a hot air brush to get my desired look, but this did it all. I was expecting much by the time I used it since I didn't get to blow dry my hair. It was only about 75% dried and I have a lot of natural wave/curl. However in about 15 minutes I had the look I usually get after 30 minutes of blow drying and using a curling iron. Not to mention it straightened the little annoying waves around my face that usually take me forever to straighten out, and there almost no frizz. And I love that there is a plastic cover for the barrel so it doesn't get damaged. I am wondering why I haven't discovered this sooner!!

reviewText:
I have been using curling wands successfully for almost 10 years now, but wanted to give a regular curling iron a chance to create some different type of hair curls I haven't really rocked in a decade.
This thing SUCKED!
I have pretty healthy, thick, long, sort of wavy, virgin hair. Use heat/styling tools, maybe 1-3 times a month for special occasions.
This, even at the highest setting, with hairspray, was losing curls and becoming stick straight within minutes of releasing the curl from the iron.
The first time I tried doing my whole head with it, I just ended up with piecey straight hair.

This is 1 of 2 styling tools I've purchased from amazon (got the remmington wand, which was also a huge fail) so I'm not sure if both, highly rated items just didn't work for me, or because both were purchased from AMAZON, and maybe were from bad batches.

summary: Gets very hot and, worked well,

reviewText: The description says 'extra long barrel' but it is rather short. Everything else is great. Came with extra springs for the clamp.
This iron gets very hot and has temp control settings on the side. The cord is super long which is nice so you don't have to sit close to the outlook.

I don't understand the good reviews here. I owned a Hot Tools titanium curling iron that just went bust on me and thought what can go wrong with getting the same brand. Well...there is a big difference in how this handles compared to the previous one. The clamp handle is high and difficult to push down with one finger as the spring is tough, which leads to jerky hand movements when trying to run this through strands to create a curl. In spite of the strong spring, when you reach the end of your strand one of two things happen: the hair just slides out of clamp and you have to start the curl all over again; or, the hair just snags at the base of the clamp in the spring and you just have to tug and unravel the curl to set it loose and start again.
I got extremely frustrated trying to curl my hair several times and just did not get a good smooth experience. It is heavier than my previous curling iron and more cumbersome to operate. If you are looking for a basic curling iron and don't mind getting clamp creases and having hand cramps from trying to open and close that clamp, only to have your strands sliding out as your trying to get the curl set....then get this one. I will return it and look for another one.
summary: Not professional quality - just a basic curling iron

reviewText:
I prefer lightweight foundations on the sheer side, and this fits this bill really nicely.

This has wonderful coverage - it looks as though you've used a primer underneath.

It also goes on easily, blends in without creating lines, and stays on. (I use a foundation brush, which I believe works better than anything else).

My only complaint is that it is hard to tell which color to get by just looking at the photos. My skin color is fair and cool, but I usually go slightly darker to avoid looking like a ghost. I got the Sand color which is unfortunately a bit too dark and warm-toned for my just-emerging-from-winter skin color. I am pretty sure the color will work in the summertime when my skin gets darker anyway, but for now I feel I erred with the color. I wish there was a better description of the colors or underlying tones.

Two others that I like quite a lot and can compare this to are Clinique's Even Better Glow and Lumene's Instant Glow Beauty Serum.
Lumene's is thinner consistency and sheerer than this, which is more like the Clinique product. The Sand color is similar to Clinique's" Honey", if that helps anyone.
summary: Love this, but it's really hard to tell which color is the right one to get.

reviewText:
This foundation has a different feel to it- creamy, yet dry- but it goes on easily leaving a smooth foundation that looks great. Rubbed between your fingers, it has the feel of a good quality primer- slightly dry. I used a brush and fingertips to apply, and both worked well. You can easily get by with a small drop of product. Having no choice of color for this review, I received the darkest tint, Honey Beige. It is several shades darker than what I would use, Light Beige, but I was able to use just a small amount, the size of a pea, which provided a nice, matte coverage that did not look too dark.

At $30, it is not cheap, but a small amount goes a long way and the product is VERY comfortable to wear and gives nice coverage. When my current foundation runs out, I will be tempted to try this again, in a lighter shade.
summary: Very comfortable and easy to apply.

I bought this pressed powder refill thinking it would be an awesome addition to my Jane Iredale make-up regime. Who doesn't need a translucent powder for a mid day oil blot? I only have one refillable compact so I took my foundation powder out of that compact, since I only apply that at home in the morning, and immediately put in the translucent powder in it to carry with me and all seemed fine and dandy. The product itself was a bit dissapointing in that the application with a powder brush applied WAY too much product and the translucent color was very pasty and dull. But all Jane products do really have a bit of a learning curve when you are first using them. So I decided instead to try the sponge that came with it to touch up my face throughout the day. This worked better and the oil from the day was in fact blotted away, though too much product was still used! I actually kept the plactic cover on the powder and exposed only about an 8th of the product before dabbing th sponge on the product and then blotting my face. Now on to the problems that prompt the "What the HECK?!"

I am very protective of my products, especially considering how expensive they are, and have taken very good care of this compact. But about a month after having the powder (and using it a total of 6 or 7 times and having it protected in the METAL compact!!) the powder began to separate and pieces began to flake off. Thinking it was not a big deal, I continued on in my normal fashion of carying the compact with me. Day by day, the small flakes began to turn into larger pieces that were essetnially becoming un-pressed. At one point, I attempted to repress some of the larger pieces back together and this worked for a few days. Now the entire disc of powder looks like a piece of earth in the driest of dry deserts - full of cracks and dust and completely ruined. I cannot carry the compact anymore. This cream is a GD miracle. My toddler had persistent eczema spots on her elbows, collarbone, wrists, ankles, and patches on her legs and arms. They would wax and wane in severity, though the eczema consistently flared up in the cold winter months. We bathed her as infrequently as possible, utilized various creams and gave her oatmeal baths periodically - these efforts helped to a small degree. The only true "cure" was topical steroids, which can cause skin discoloration over time and shouldn't be used routinely. We were in a bind. Then we found this product and I am not exaggerating when I say it has cured my daughter's eczema! Her skin looks perfect. She was 2 when we began using this (only after baths and we began bathing her with the Medela Stelatopia soap at the same time as well) and her eczema cleared up after one or two uses. Our daughter is now a few months shy of her 3rd birthday and her skin still looks amazing. We also have always used this product on our now 11 month-old and our baby never developed eczema like her older sister did.

TL/DR: cured my child's eczema. If you've done tried everything for eczema and nothing has worked, buy this now!

reviewText: Love it!

I am rather new to diffusing.  I have long, very thick curly hair, that I tended to blow straight a lot, or wore in a bun that never fully dried (because my hair is that thick).  In the interest of spicing things up (and looking more professional at work),  I invested in an Elchim and the Cocooon Diffuser.  I am so elated with my purchase.

In the distant past I used the standard long-tooth diffuser.  Though I used as instructed, my hair at the roots dried in a frizzy mess or poofed out too much.  The Elchim diffuser makes my curls stay in tact.  I must add that while I have thick hair, my individual strands are semi-coarse and tend to be thin.  Thought you might like this information for added perspective).

It took some time understanding how to use the cocoon part.  I learned hat this works wonderfully when pressed against the scalp  at at 90 degree angle (low setting, cold to medium heat -- depending on how dry my hair is).  For those who have a lot of natural volume and don't want that 80's look, this product is a must have!  It keeps hair near the scalp wavy or spiraled.  The curl at the ends stays healthy too.

I can now sport my curls with glee.  Thank goodness for the Elchim diffuser.  (note: I use this on their legacy blow dryner, Elchim 2001 HP -- I also highly recommend this dryer for curly hair.  It's ionic and the cool setting is an actually setting, and not a cold shot, so you can relax your thumb as you cool set).  Nice!

Update:  The instructions are weak on how to remove the top part.  It took me an exchange, several lost nails, and bruised knuckles to figure out that to remove the cocoon top you need to put the whole apparatus on its (on your lap, preferably).  Push down on one of the perforated sides and then gently pull off.  The instructions claim that you can push the sides in simultaneously -- that's nearly humanly impossible unless you are in competition for the world's longest fingers.

reviewText: love all CND products!!!!! The top coat is easy to apply and stay on forever.

I'm the type of person where my manicure chips in less than 24 hours. I'm going on 4 days and they still look great. I was very careful not to get any on my skin when polishing, and I think this may help. I love this color...it's a great staple color for winter.

I do my own nails, I have for years, so naturally I could open a mini salon in my house with the amount of nail polish I own. I wanted to do a gel for vacation but couldn't bring myself to spend all that money at a salon (especially since I never think they do a better job than me and I have hundreds of colors here.) After 2 days of researching, I settled on this topcoat. My two requirements were it had to last and it had to work with regular polish. I'm putting it to the test. It's been one day, I will update in a week with new results

Base coat: Nailtiques (formula 2)
Polish: Essie pret-a-surfer
Topcoat: Vinylux

The Essie applies beautifully with one coat however while applying the topcoat, the polish became streaky so a second coat was added and the topcoat went on without a hitch thereafter. It took a while to dry completely (over an hour) and even then I didn't know if it would last through the night because it still felt a little off. My first time using this product so I didn't know if that was normal or not, but I woke up without any blanket creases and it feels like a regular polish now. My nails overall feel very strong as if I had wraps on. I have high hopes right now, but lets see if it can withstand the mom of two preschoolers life I live.

*****Update: it's been 48 hours; a trip to the mall, a trip to the grocery store, 8 loads of laundry, 3 sinks full of dishes, broke down about about a dozen boxes for the recycling, half a dozen showers (twins included) and general household cleaning/cooking and at the end of the weekend 1 nail chipped within 24 hours and 2 after 48....the rest are dulled with scratches. I'll still use it only because it's here. Maybe I'll pair it with the vinylux color polish and see how that goes in the future, but all hope is gone. My regular mani's have lasted longer.
ok
great product will continue to purchase
Great polish

I was rather hesitant to try the CND Vinylux system as I had noticed mixed reviews, but I needed an alternative to gel polish as it was very drying and damaging to my nails. It took a few tries to make it work, but I have grown to love Vinylux.

I have tried various ways of applying this, but thin coats of color (2-3) with 2 coats of this product, the Vinylux topcoat, seems to work best for me. In my experience, base coats cause this to chip prematurely so I would advise against using them, as this must bond directly to the nail for it to be effective.

This can be removed with regular acetone/polish remover, which is another big advantage over gel. I would advise this to anyone looking for a longer lasting polish without the damaging effects of gel polish, and no UV light required!

If I haven't raved about it enough, probably the greatest thing about this system is how quickly it dries compared to regular nail polish. Gone are the days of sitting in front of a fan for 30 minutes only to still smudge my polish. By the time I am ready to apply the second coat, the first is completely dry. After applying the final top coat, it will be dry and smudge free in under 10 minutes, just as CND claims.

To summarize, I truly believe in the Vinylux system and would recommend it to anyone. This polish costs the same as most regular polishes but has many added benefits. Definitely worth the try.

Vinylux nail polish has changed my life!  It is nothing less than magical how the polish/top set without any light or special salon machines.  I got hooked on Vinylux after getting a salon mani/pedi and learning about this amazing product.  I called around locally but it is impossible to purchase anywhere other than on Amazon.  Though it killed me to wait what seemed like an eternity for the polishes to arrive, it was so worth it!
I have a two and half year old son (read: bathing him, cleaning up, and wear and tear on my nails), as well as packing my house up to move (read: boxes packing tape getting stuck on nails and pulled off and really, really tough wear on my nails).  My manicure that I gave myself with Vinylux polish and top coat has lasted a full week!!!  There are a few small pieces of polish chipped at the end, but it really is nothing to notice and that is with Rubble (a dark grey) which would be very obvious.  I probably could leave this polish on for another few days if it was necessary.  The thing that makes me want to repaint is the growth from my cuticles!!!
Be sure to have some sort of cuticle gel/moisturizer as that is a frustrating difference of a salon mani vs. doing your nails yourself.  Also, be sure to wait the recommended time between the polish coats and top coat.  It really does make a difference at setting the polish and ultimately making the mani last as long as possible!!!
If you are considering getting this polish: DO IT!
summary: New favorite Nail Polish Brand!  A must have!

reviewText: Mustela is the best baby brand ever!

This is the best stuff for helping dry scalp and cradle cap on toddlers.  I used this exact product when I had my newborn to help with cradle cap and because a little goes a long way (especially on my fairly bald baby), I ended up giving it to a friend when she had her baby and I thought I was done with it.

Unfortunately as my daughter was out in the sun more, her scalp apparently dried out more and she started having pretty good sized flakes again.  My pediatrician said it was cradle cap but that I could use Head n' Shoulders.  I did and it didn't help.  I used Coconut oil and that didn't help.  I used this product and it seemed to get better but wasn't gone completely.  Then I put some hair oil on her scalp for about 30 minutes and washed it out with this foaming shampoo and voila!  Great scalp again!

I still use this formula every night and have yet to have a flare up again.  And the bottle seems to last forever.  I know it's on the pricey side but we've been using this every other night for months and I think I still have half the bottle left.

Oh, I also recommend their bath oil.  While my daughter didn't have diagnosed eczema, she does have dry and sensitive skin.  The bath oil makes her skin baby soft again!
Worked great! Very gentle and worked quickly to get rid of my son's cradle cap.

reviewText: I bought tria after reading lots of reviews about Laser Hair removal at home. It is expensive but nothing compared to have the laser done in a clinic. Tria has a small head, so takes so many shots to finish the bikini line and underarm. After my painful experience I decided to return Tria. I did this on the day after. I waited a few days to see if it works before write any review. Conclusion: If you are good handling the pain,go for it. Tria works amazingly, I used once and after 2 weeks I can see the results on my bikini line, some parts with very thick hair are now with no hair. Tria rocks, yess! Was painful for me yes, but for me (my opinion). So go ahead and try it. Take your own conclusions and enjoy the results.

I have been using the Tria laser for 9 months and am very pleased with the results. Before purchasing this product I researched it extensively and was concerned with some of the negative reviews but decided to try it. I have a fair complexion and dark brown hair. I've used it mainly in my bikini and underarm area. Before using the Tria laser I needed to shave on an almost daily basis. I tried wax, hair removal creams, and I think just about every razor made with frustrating results. I dealt with red bumps, ingrown hairs, and residual wax in painful places better left unsaid. Because of my research I did not expect instant results so was not disappointed when I didn't get them. It took about 3 cycles before I noticed serious results butam pleased beyond measure now. I still need to shave about once a week but the hair is much finer than before. My bikini area is smooth and got better results than my underarm area but there is a vast improvement in both. I do agree with the reviewers who say it hurts and I hated the gel. I have had no problems at all with battery life. I can finally wear a bathing suit without a skirt. It was definitely worth the investment.
summary: ... the Tria laser for 9 months and am very pleased with the results

reviewText: I cannot count the number of mascaras I have tried over the years. And without a doubt, Eyeko is the BEST.  It goes on and stays on perfectly.  It doesn't leave black smudges under your eyes. It truly is a FIVE STAR product.
My favorite eye shadow

After 15+ years of cosmetic trial and error (dating back to freshman year/high school), I've finally come across the best eyebrow makeup ever. Calling this little tube of perfection 'make-up', is an understatement- it's also a treatment. Eyeko eyebrow gel helps prevent the premature fallout of eyebrow hairs and keeps them nourished and maintained with good-for-you, quality ingredients:). So far, this eyebrow gel has given me the most natural eyebrow look , I've ever achieved. Besides the before-mentioned reason, as to why this product rocks, it makes the eyes pop. It's a slightly darker shade than I'm used to, despite it being a universal tint. I'd always hated deep pigmented eyebrow make-up, due to the harsh looking effect. This product is an exception. The results are so natural and keeps my eyebrows in place all day, so basically it works out beautifully in the end. To say that I'm blown away by Eyeko, is an understatement. Here is the only itty-bitty thing that I find slightly taxing....I feel that in order to gain a more perfected & complete brow look, I must use the tip of an eyebrow brush to stroke the brows w/ light feathery moves in the same direction (this coats all hairs). Then, I need to proceed with a pointed tip cosmetic q-tip to blend in the gel and reduce excess of product build-up. After, I make sure to use the q-tip to swipe any slight mess, edge and/or unevenness. I'd say the last steps are a wee bit taxing....but totally and absolutely worth it!! Overall, I think I've fallen in love with Eyeko. It may sound quite bizarre, but I actually look forward towards the mornings so that I can use my eye gel. I cannot recommend this product enough to someone looking to achieve the most perfect and natural brow look! :) Btw, I don't recommend this for non-brunettes!:)
summary: I've finally come across the best eyebrow makeup ever

Fragrances are something you really have to try out in person. You can read all you want about top notes, middle notes, and bottom, but I never found text descriptions to be useful, and even if they were, fragrances react uniquely with your personal skin chemistry. The way it smells on you is different than the way it smells on someone else. And you can't just spray the fragrance on a tester strip. You have to apply it your skin. With that having been said, let's get down to talking about this MONTBLANC EDT. Both the bottle design and scent are very similar to Guilty By Gucci EDT spray for Men, 3 Ounce. If you like Guilty, you may find this comparable. The spiciness is a bit like Lancome La Vie Est Belle L'Eau de Parfum Spray, 3.4 Ounce (a woman's fragrance). With a name like Intense, you'd expect this to be, well, intense. It's not. The scent is very milquetoast. It's pleasant, but very subtle and short-lived. I applied a "stream" of it my forearm about 15 minutes ago and cannot smell it anymore. My arm is about 2 ft from my nose as I sit typing. I said "stream" because the nozzle design is terrible. It does not spray out as a mist. It comes out as a stream of liquid. This is probably an intentional decision -- it makes you use more of the product, and therefore, you will deplete the bottle quicker. You'll also need to use a lot more of it to get the same coverage effect compared to other EDTs with a higher concentration of essential oils. I work in the beauty industry and I'm around fragrances all day (but on the web technology side), for what that's worth. Higher quality fragrances have a higher concentration of "essential oils". I suspect that percentage is very low here, given the very short scent lifetime. Contrast this with Issey Miyake L'eau D'issey 4.2 Ounce Edt Spray, which I think is a much better buy and performance ratio, ounce for ounce. One spritz and I smell nice ALL DAY. It's understated, but long lasting. My wife loves it and every time I come home from work, she remarks on how much she loves that scent. Lastly, I love the bottle design, but don't like how short the cap is. If you put this in a gym bag or luggage, it'll easy come uncapped. Overall, it's a good, clean, if short-lived, scent. If you're thinking about buying it, I highly recommend you go to someplace like Sephora to try it out in person first. And while you're there, try out the other 2 men's fragrances I mentioned. Buy it online at another store though. You can find this fragrance for almost 1/3 the price on a popular site.

reviewText: Always loved the diamond lustre, so I was excited to try these, and I was not disappointed. These elevate any eye look to amazing, and I get compliments every time I wear them, either alone or layered over shadow. GET IT BEFORE IT'S GONE.

I owned a gold LORAC liquid lustre prior to purchasing this set and was pleasantly surprised that these were as impressive as the gold version. The only reason I've given this four stars instead of five is because I don't feel the applicator makes a lot of sense for ease of use; however, I think the eyedropper design does help prevent contaminating the product with germs or bacteria, which is always a concern with eye makeup. (Nothing says "un-sexy" and "stay away" than an infected eyeball, no matter how much you dress up it's curtains!) I usually put a drop onto a q-tip or brush, and then apply it over eye shadow to "finish" up the look since it makes it look metallic and catches the light in a way no other products do. These liquid eye finishes make eyes pop and stand out from the ordinary, but are more for special occasions unless you are using the tiniest bit as an inner eye corner highlight. You can also use these over mascara for a striking effect, and I've added it to hair oils or lotions to give them a glittery sheen. While I've tried to see if it can be used as a lip additive, (not an intended use as far as I know, so add it to things or use it "off label" at your own risk) but the consistency doesn't work for this well and it tastes bad. A little goes a long way!

The good news is, it works, and I can always bump the heat on to high, but its annoying to me that I have to keep doing that every few minutes. The trade off is that you'll need to use more.  But hey, it's a luxury item fellas so don't be cheap now - just enjoy it if you like the smell.  The scent stays close, but lasts 4-5 hours for me.

$100 for 1.7 oz is so overpriced.

L'OCCITANE IMMORTELLE DIVINE FACE CREAM

L'Occitane has a well deserved reputation for wonderful skin care products-and this is a superior face lotion.

Visually, the presentation and packaging are esthetically very pleasing to the eye. This would make a really nice present!

This face cream has a very rich, creamy texture and a fresh light scent. The scent is neither cloying nor overpowering and does not interfere with your cologne or perfume. Its price point may be a little higher than many usual face creams, but I find I use a lot less, adhering to those 5 small point application techniques:  One dot respectively on the forehead, nose, right and left cheeks, and chin. I have used a light dot around the sensitive eye area with no adverse consequences.

Using it this way, one jar lasts about 3.5 months.

L'OCCITANE IMMORTELLE DIVINE FACE CREAM goes on easily and  spreads well.  The scent is reminiscent of a light floral/citrus/pear combination. The texture of the cream is rich and nourishing and is readily absorbed, without any excessive greasiness. The pillowcase never has any greasy residue on it as can happen with other night creams. I find that this face cream is well tolerated as no redness, blotchiness, nor rashes have ever developed after months of use.  Additionally, this face cream does not appear to be comedogenic (pimple causing) at all. That often happens when a face cream is too greasy, not well absorbed and just 'sits' on top of your skin, trapping in the bacteria (Propionibacterium acnes)  that can cause pimple development.

Trap in moisture in your skin by lightly cleansing the face with clear water prior to application of the cream. This habit can be especially helpful after a shower.

L'Occitane Immortelle Divine Face Cream can be used well with most skin care regimens.

With all new skin care products, Patch Testing is usually recommended: before zealous application, apply a small amount to an area you can monitor (such as the under belly of the forearm).  If no itching or redness develops, it is not likely that an allergy has occurred. you might then want to try more liberal use and greater distribution. But, when in doubt, always stop use and consult a physician.

This super face cream works very nicely as a night cream.

It's just a really fine face cream. Highly recommended!

UPDATE:

After many weeks of use, the face seems brighter and more alert. Any dark circles under the eyes have visibly diminished and there is no puffiness around the eyes. Others have favorably commented (are you doing something different? getting more sleep or exercise?) -so it's not just my impression.

The facial skin appears visibly improved with regular use of this face cream. No discoloration or other blemish have ever occurred while using this cream.

L'Occitane Immortelle Divine Face Cream has been used nightly for a few months and it is well tolerated.  Its best use seems to be as an all-around moisturizing night cream (no sun block) that helps to even your tone and coloration. There has been no diminution of age-related skin 'dark spots'

No change in my original opinion after months of use. I still like it a lot.
summary: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!  GENTLE, RICH SUPER FACE CREAM. A LITTLE GOES A LONG WAY!

reviewText:
This expensive little glass bottle with glass dropper is targeted towards 'mature skin'.  I have been feeling older lately but in all honestly I am 36 years old.  I do not know if I am the target and if I will see any difference.

I use the oil every night right before bed and love how it smells.  It is a light fragrance and feels so smooth.  The directions do not actually state if this should be used in the morning, evening, under make-up etc.  This leave me baffled but I still use it at night because it does leave a sheen and bit of oiliness.  The three recommended drops for the face and neck seems to be just too little to accurately massage as it directs.  I end up using about 5 drops for my whole face and neck.  My skin does feel smooth but I do not know if I see any discernable difference in my nasolabial folds.  This is the area that has begun to bother me as of late.  My skin does feel oilier so I do not see myself using the pro-definition oil and applying moisturizer.  I would apply it by itself.

The product is expensive at 79 dollars for the little bottle but if it proves to work then I wouldn't see any reason not to continue the regimen.  So this is my conondrum... does it really work for me at this age?  Do I have mature skin?  I have been getting more and more brown patches but then again I freckle and am very fair skinned.  Only time will tell if it has helped the my non-existent wrinkles;  I am more concerned with my frown lines, folds and loosening jowels.  I would like to mention that I have not had any break-outs but my pores do get clogged as they normally do.
summary: Smells divine, feels silky but expensive.

I love this product!

The product quality itself is quite good - the eyeshadow crayon (more of a cream stick though) is smooth, stays on nicely, and lasts a long time. This particular color is nice as well, softens the eye a bit without overwhelming. And since I'm one of those people always rubbing my eyes, I appreciate the fact that it doesn't smudge all over the place.

I also like the casing which is like a fancy lipstick. It's easy to hold while applying the product and stays closed in my bag (I hate when cosmetics have flimsy caps - this one is very good).

The main issue I had with this product is the "girth" of the crayon portion, which is just slightly too wide and rounded. I think it needs to be tapered a bit more, not pointy like a pencil but more like actual crayon size. It would be easier to apply it in a thinner line in certain places on the eye. Finally, the staying power of this eyeshadow is so good, I've had a few moments of difficulty when removing it, so now I just apply a bit less product and it's generally okay on clean-up.

Overall, a good, quality product at a decent price point (as cosmetics go).

reviewText: I was introduced to the Obagi skin care line for the first time at the medical office.  I immediately liked it and I used it any time I can find the product at the affordable price.  I like ot buy product online because often times prices are better than buying the product at the medical spas at the retail price.  I particularly like vitamin C serum.  Vitamin C is a great antioxidant and this particualr king of L-ascorbic acid comes in a 15% strength.  IT is important to mention that Obagi offer 4 different types of this serum.  They come in professional RX strength, 10%, 15% and 20% strength.  Packaging for the 15% strength is very specific in stating not to mix Professional Rx strength with 15% strength.  I use this serum in the morning and at night.  In the evening, when I have more time, I like to mix this serum with pure hyaluronic acid for additional moisture for the skin.  The other convenience of this product is that it comes with the enclosed pipette.  It helps control of how much product can be used on the skin.  I apply it on both face and neck and then I follow up with the moisturizer from the same line.  During daytime I also apply SPF to protect skin from damaging UV rays.  Great product.  My skin loves it.  The other advantage is that this product is compatible with any skin type.

reviewText: I've been using it for a few months now and it's super easy to use and doesn't hurt.  I even use it on my legs, just takes a while since the lazer is small.  I have noticed lightened hair, but not a substantial difference just yet.  I'm giving it a few more months!

I use C-Quench serum every morning.  It goes on smoothly, has a pleasant aroma, and dries quickly enough for me to apply my foundation.  On the rare occasion that I forget to use the serum, my face feels dry, so I am quite faithful about using C-Quench daily.

Love this stuff but I found out that the itchy bumps on either side of the top of the bridge of my nose (under the eyes) were due to this. I now put it everywhere but there and I am happy and itch free!

great product!

Well, I wrote a really long review and lost it when I went back to see how much this item costs.  I'll remember as much as I can.

I don't have dark circles under my eyes.  I do bruise easily.  I am fortunate enough to have a Maine Coon cat that thinks nipping me lightly with a small amount of skin between his teeth is thanking me for treats and ice in his water disk.  Not true in my brain.  So, when I don't catch him beforehand he barely holds my skin and for that, I get a bruise.  I wanted to see if this would cover that.  It does not completely but certainly hides it a good bit.

I've also used this to contour and I like it for that a lot.  It goes on smoothly; blends well with other products.  I use a makeup brush or a sponge for this and find that I like it better in thin layers.  If a product works well and does what it says it will, I guess I won't worry about the cost....I'm certainly not going to go back and check the cost and lose this one, too.
summary: To me, this was a good product and I shall buy it again.  I hope you enjoy it, also.

reviewText: I really like this concealer. I've used it consistently under my eyes and on a few dark spots. It works great to make my dark circles less visible. And it takes a layer of darkness out of the dark spots. It works very well on acne as well. I've found that if I use it in the morning when putting on my makeup, it lasts well throughout the day. Note: I use light foundation/makeup. If you have a lot to cover up, I'm not sure how it will work.
This product does seem to improve my overall skin appearance. I will continue using especially because I previously didn't have a good skin care regimen.

It matches perfectly, and even my hair stylist commented on how well it incorporated into my own color. It literally takes seconds to apply.  Check out the videos online for the proper technique--there is a way to apply it that will provide best results.

I wasn't sure about buying this, but am very happy I did.  It's blends in the gray in my part so I don't have to do root touch-ups nearly as often.  I wonder if brown eyebrow powder would do as well, although this has a richer tone.  I've been using it regularly and can't really tell that I've used much, so I would guess that a once-a-year purchase will be sufficient for me.

reviewText: I don't like this tube form of Epicuren nearly as much as the lipstick form of this product.  I wish they would reinstate the stick form, but cannot find it anywhere.  From the information I have found, the stick form has been discontinued.  Can't imaging why, as it is an excellent product.  The stick form is great for dry lips, very soothing and moist, and easy to carry in a purse.  I find the tube to be less handy, does not work as well as a moisturizer, and the one that I've opened that I ordered recently has a funny taste to it.  Very disappointed that I cannot find it in the original form that I bought in the past.  Also it is expensive, and although weighs very little, I think the shipping charge excessive.

I am a low maintenance person and am not interested in multiple step or over the top skin regimes but have to endorse this cleanser 100%. It has made a distinct difference in my 50+ fair/average skin. I used to have problems with clogged and enlarged pores. They are almost non-existent after 6 weeks of use 4X/week. My skin is also much more smooth and consistent in tone.
I alternate between this cleanser, with and without a Clarsonic, and just using Kirkland makeup towelettes at night. I use Lumyxil Brightening Pads in the morning but I think this cleanser is what has made the most difference.

summary: First product to make a difference!

reviewText: Don't see that it helps that much.
not what I was hoping for,very little body and not much neutralizing effect.

I like how thick this shampoo is. I use less, and the tube lasts longer, than the drugstore brand I've been using. However, it works just the same as those drugstore brands. I haven't noticed any difference in how it enhanced/preserved my color.

I do a lot of coloring to my hair, thanks to premature grey running in the family and, well, let's just say I like color. Right now I'm going with chocolate brown on the roots/top part and violet on the ends, so yeah, that's a lot of coloring. I've also tried a lot of different shampoos to protect the various colors and help my hair recover from the bleaching, ranging from the higher ends to the low.

WOW is nice in that it is sulfate-free and doesn't have much of a scent (at least for me). You don't need to use a lot (though since my hair is longer, I did need a little more than a 'coin size'). It lathers up well, and my hair was in good condition when I was done (though I do use a heavy, non-WOW conditioner to help with the bleaching et all). However, I have to say that I did notice some color-run off still while using this product, from the violet dye. Since that happens even with other color-'safe' shampoos I use, I can't say too much, but the brown seems to be holding up well.

This does seem to work well and I'll continue using it, but not sure I'll buy another tube since it doesn't work better than a cheaper color-safe shampoo I've been using.

I have naturally blonde hair with highlights.  The highlights are because my blond hair has gotten slightly darker with age.  I only have highlights put in about every 3 months.  Being a natural blonde, I do have a rainbow of blonde colors in my natural hair, some of which are very yellow/gold looking.  This COLOR WOW Brass Banned mousse for blonde hair did tone down my brassiness.  I was actually surprised that I could tell a difference.  It just seemed to brighten things up.

I have thick hair, but it is baby fine. It is also about shoulder length.  I don't normally like using mousse, because my hair tangles easily, and other mousses have made it difficult for me to dry my hair without adding extra tangles because of the stiff feeling.  The COLOR WOW mousse did not make it feel like that.  I did feel a little difference in my texture, but nothing extreme enough to bother me or to tangle my hair.

I wash my hair at night and fix it in the morning.  I figured the mousse would not affect anything about the styling, because it felt like it normally does in the morning.  I straighten my hair with a straightening brush (looks kind of like a paddle brush but is heated).  The COLOR WOW made it so that I could wear my hair flatter if I wanted or with more volume if I wanted to go that way.  I don't like a lot of volume, but it was easy to control.

The only negative I have about this mousse is that when I brushed my hair and was straightening it, I had white debris falling onto my shoulders.  It didn't seem to do it once I was done fixing my hair, though.  It could be my reaction to the ingredients, or it could be that I waited overnight to style my hair.

I only used it one time, read the instructions AFTER I put it on. Instructions said to expect skin irritation and peeling and to only use a couple of times a week to start until your skin got used to it. Since I'm not super unhappy with my skin, I'd rather hold off using this product until I am instead of dealing with skin irritation and peeling now.
summary: Since I'm not super unhappy with my skin

reviewText: Thank you, Perfecter. You managed to DESTROY my hair in one day after years of taking the time and patience in growing my hair long.  I was getting ready for my niece's wedding, using my Perfecter Fusion Styler as I usually do for a special event.  I completed one side just fine. When I started working on the front of my right side, my hair got stuck in the teeth and the intense heat made it worse.  I quickly turned it off and unplugged the styler.  After my 26 year old heard me crying he ran down to help me.  It took my husband and adult sons to cut the brush/wand out of my hair. They had to cut each tooth to remove it from my hair.  The combination of strong heat and entangled hair in the teeth of the brush caused me to lose large clumps of hair around the right side of my face.  It looks horrible.  I had to go to the wedding with part of my very long blonde hair missing.  Please be careful, this brush styler gets extremely hot.  I lost a lot of money on this product...and a whole lot of hair.
On longer hair, this product gives soft body, gentle waves, and lifts shorter bangs. I have very fine, shoulder length, hard to curl hair, So, I'm pleased that it does what it does.
summary: I have very fine, shoulder length

reviewText: I LOVE THIS! I have fine hair, but a lot of it, so styling my hair has always been difficult. It will take curl pretty well, but hot rollers were the only way I could get a really good long lasting curl. That was too much trouble for every day therefore most of the time I went the opposite way and just blew my hair out smooth and mostly straight with a big round brush and straightened whatever needed it with a flat iron. The result was straight, smooth hair I could get done in about 20 minutes or so. I always wanted to do something else with my hair, but as a teacher, always on the go, and not a lot of time in the mornings, anything else didn't really work out. Until I got my Perfecter. Now that I've got this, I can just blow dry my hair, use my styler to give it the wonderful beachy waves I've always wanted (especially since I do live by the beach) and I'm ready to head out the door. It does take me a few minutes more than the 3 minutes it promises, but it is still much faster then my old hair styling routine.
summary: Finally I can get the hair I want!

reviewText: Works good

i bought this from the calissta website for $99,  after watching the impressive infomercial. My baby fine hair does not respond to curling irons and of corse the demonstrator assured us it would.
But...nothing-worse than any $20 iron. You can only roll the hair two turns, at the bottom,or it will most definitely become tangled. If your hair is the perfect thickness with great natural body like those in the infomercial, this might be good. But it did NOTHING for my baby fine straight hair.
A total waste of money. My own fault for being taken in by a tv presentation.
I'm super happy with my order, I got this for my aunt she love it apparently this is a really good item to fix your hair like a salon quality hair style.

It tangled the hair, it did not get hot enough to straighten the hair.  The informercial had African American Models and the hair straighten, I am a mix African American, my hair is straight and long, and it did not curl, it did not get hot and my hair tangled so bad in the brush I had to cut some of my hair to get it out of the brush.  I would not recommend  your product to anyone.  I  am extremely disappointed I regret I purchased the Perfector

I purchased this and absolutely LOVE IT.  Was skeptical after reading reviews, but it exceeded my expectations.  I am hoping to find one to put in my gym bag for less $$.  While this is pricey, it is a fantastic too.  I have long hair and it does a great job straightening and curling.  SUPER easy to use and heats up quickly.

I've just used the hair styler twice, and I am very impressed with the ease of use and especially the results.  My hair is becoming more coarse all the time as the gray hairs are infiltrating LOL...I have a hard time with flat irons because I have LOTS of hair at the back of my scalp and it's difficult and tiring to get it all flat-ironed, plus my hair is dry at the ends.  My waves are stubborn as well...my hair stylist would agree!  What ended up working quite well for my hair was to take a small section and simply brush the styler once on the underside and once on the top side.  I twisted the brush to add some curl on the shorter front pieces and it worked like magic.  My hair is long and I'm not the best at styling it...adequate at best.  My hair almost looks like I just came from the salon!

Update:  I have used the perfecter a couple more times and still LOVE it!  I think one of the best features is that I no longer have to worry about burning myself, especially when working with the hair at the back of my head.  The flat iron was always difficult to use back there, but now I can just "brush" without even looking. After my last use I realized that I used to get a bit stressed while flat-ironing, and now I'm relaxed at the end of my styling session. This appliance is also light-weight, another big bonus while working at the back of my head.
The perfect color year round!

I got this hairdrier a few months back, and like it a lot. I've been using professional blow dryers for about 15 years because my hair is thick and needs the heat to dry without frizzing up. When my last one bit the bullet, I had to make a quick decision and after reading lots of reviews, I chose Sam Villa Light.  This is the lightest and most compact dryer I've ever had, and the short nozzle makes it very easy to control.  I didn't want to believe the hype about  Ionic, but it DOES take less time to dry - probably cut my drying time in half.  I recommend it.

This is a flame thrower!  The first heat setting is just too cool, but then, the second setting is almost fire!  I never got to the third setting.  This blow dryer is made for stylists who want you in and out fast.  If you have, or plan to have long hair, this dryer will ruin any hopes of long hair.  It's probably fine if you have very, very short hair, but only if you aren't concerned about how healthy it looks.  Back it goes!!!  This dryer BLOWS, but not the way it should.  If I could have given it a minus, I would have.

reviewText: I used this my whole pregnancy and did not get stretch marks. Not super oily either.

I started using this product at 8 weeks of pregnancy and combined the oil rub and the butter rub towards the middle of the second trimester. I used mama mio oil/butter rub twice a day and I can proudly say that their product did help prevent me from having stretch marks. Other factors to reduce stretch marks were staying hydrated and control weight gain by continue light impact exercise during pregnancy. I gained 25 lbs with my pregnancy and of Asian background. I have a really hard time finding a red that doesn't look orange-y with my uber pale skin due to its pink undertones. When I do find a red with a blue tint, it's usually on the darker side. Finding a red that comes across as a true red - no orange, no blue, just red regardless of the skin tone its worn on - is rather difficult to do. This lip creme from Oribe is one of those rare true reds. When applied, this color is the classic red lipstick that needs nothing more than a simple cat eye makeup to look perfect. It applies very smoothly and easily, doesn't have a prominent scent, and doesn't have a funky taste. The color in the photographs for this listing are not representative at all of the color when it was applied to my lips. It looks like the color was photoshopped on to the lips of the models for the different skin tones for each of the three colors Oribe offers

While the color is gorgeous, this isn't a lipstick I would really recommend, especially for this price. if you don't use a lip primer and lip liner, this lipstick will migrate and feather and come off on everything - anyone you kiss, your cup, your eating utensils, your teeth. If not applied to something to adhere it to lips and then set properly, it was shocking how fast it came off. If you have any trace of dryness on your lips, this color will exacerbate it. If you apply it with too much pressure, the bullet is so soft and creamy it is like smooshing frosting between your fingers. If you can, use a lip brush to apply this over prepped lips. The creaminess helps to keep your lips from getting dried out, and you can remove this lipstick with just a swipe of a tissue.

Even though this lipstick is a such lovely color and perfect shade of red, I can't really recommend this for more than a special evening out or for photos. For anywhere from $5.00 to $30.00 less you can get lipsticks from Dior, Marc Jacobs, Urban Decay, BITE, Tarte, Besame, or others are as creamy and pigmented as this from Oribe but last all day. Even $6.00 lipsticks from Nyx (the Butter Lipstick or Gloss) gives pigment as good and stays longer than this one from Oribe. Finding this perfect red in lip friendly formula is great, but with the prep work needed to make it last for longer than a cup of coffee is a lot for a lippie that costs this much doesn't justify the cost with the options out there.

There is a huge benefit to adding C-Serum to suntan lotion - it protects the top layers from additional sun damage, while replenishing the deeper layers.

But there is also a huge challenge - the C-Serum has a short shelf life (it breaks down, becomes inert). My bottle expires in just 8 months, which means I basically have to use it up this Spring/Summer.

After the best use date, it is my belief the sun block will still work, but the L-Ascorbic acid will have oxidized.

I will add that the C-Serum definitely works, it does wonderful things for the skin. But this is not the cheap sunscreen you lather on. It comes in a small bottle, it's more like a cream, just apply a thin layer every few hours as needed.

I'm also aware that the current trend is higher SPF (like 80 & 100), but I personally believe that SPF 30 is fine for most situations (unless you're in high altitude, on the water all day, or something like that). FYI, SPF-30 blocks 97% of UVB rays, and SPF-50 blocks 98%. So I don't think that's enough of a difference to worry about.

For anyone interested, you can mix up your own batch at home. There are two distinct advantages. First, the cost is only pennies per batch (as opposed to $50-$70 per bottle). The second is, you avoid the problem of short shelf life of C-Serum products. If you mix as you go, you don't have to worry about the bottle expiring. Here's how:

You can buy powdered L-Ascorbic Acid online (about $20 per kilogram), and simply mix with your favorite sunscreen. It goes bad after a couple days (when L-Ascorbic Acid turns yellow, it's oxidized and no longer works), so only make small batches at a time. Keep that in mind with your Obagi as well - if it comes out yellow or clumpy, the C-Serum has oxidized. You can also mix with your favorite night cream, or with vegetable glycerin for a normal daily serum.

I love this product, my only complaint is the price. The short shelf life really can't be avoided, just be aware of this.
summary: Love the idea of adding C-Serum to suntan lotion. But it's pricey w/ a short shelf life. There is a mix-at-home option

I am pleased to say that the product is not causing any skin irritation or discomfort but at the same time it is not really producing any noticeable results. One tiny vial container contains enough activator fluid for mere one application with the included pure marine algae Eye Masks. These eye masks are very fragile and tends to tear and break apart when you pour in the activator fluid. In the end the areas around the eyes does feel hydrated but nothing spectacular improvement that was noticeable with the suggested 10 mins.

Having said, The main reason for using the included pure marine algae Eye Masks is to apply the applicator fluid without using cotton based puffs which may contain pesticides that causes skin irritation but this also causes a lot of wastage of the applicator fluid since it drips and causing a messy waste since you are doing it at home alone and not in a professional SPA where someone else applies this for you while you lie down and sleep.

What I have discovered is that the applicator fluid is good for the skin around your eyes. It does make skin softer and feels well moisturized. Does this remove the black circle marks around the eyes - Maybe but that means you need to keep spending a lot of money and wasting a lot of these applicator fluid & pure marine algae Eye Masks each time you use them.

Instead I suggest that to make most use of this package and the six tiny vial containers by applying the applicator fluid directly around the skin of your eyes by your index finger just enough to moisten before you go to sleep every night and you will find positive improvement around your eyes. Not only because you are not wasting the applicator fluid but also long time application for 2-3 weeks every night does make the skin clear, tight and rejuvenated.

For the price & wastage of applicator fluid and messy difficult to use algae Eye Masks I am forced to rate this with two stars. Otherwise the product does not cause any harm to you other than raising eyebrows looking at the price-tag :)

reviewText:
I've just started realizing that I've reached the age where a little makeup can do wonders for perking up my pale complexion and covering some freckles that have morphed into *gasp* age spots.

I've always gone the natural face way so I had no idea what finishing powder was.  The first thing I did was to just apply it to my freshly washed and moisturized face.  And looked like a corpse.  I couldn't imagine that was a "look" that most people are going for.  So I did a little research and found that typically finishing powder is applied on top of foundation.  So I washed and moisturized again, then applied some Bare Minerals foundation, which I haven't been loving as much lately because it seemed to give me a wrinkled paper look that wasn't flattering (or desired).  Since I'm an artist by trade, I decided to use the Japonesque as I would highlight a painting or drawing. Very nice.  But not WOW.  So, again with the washing and moisturizer.  This time I used some creamy foundation from Maybelline.  Then touched up the shiny spots with the Japonesque and WOW!!  My skin looked like a porcelain doll's, beautiful, even and lovely. Love it, love it, love it.

It comes in a cute but expensive looking case that stays shut in my bag or drawer. and includes an application sponge.  But I think it goes on better with a big, fluffy brush.  The texture of the powder is very silky and light and it makes my skin feel smooth like velvet, even with liquid foundation which tends to make even my dry skin look and feel a little greasy.  It also covers up spots very well and evens out the skin beautifully with a matte effect.  It looks really light in the package but it didn't change the shade of my makeup, it just made it all come together and look, well, finished.  It's translucent so it just blends in with whatever I am wearing and makes my skin look luminous.
Love, Love, Love it!  Great coverage, without goopy build up!  I will be using this forever!

Had never tried this product before, but went to a new hairdresser and well I needed something like this. It worked wonderfully without leaving a greasy, heavy look and feel to my hair. Highly recommend it!

I run a organic farm & despite wearing a hat & tinted moisturizer with SPF 15, I still show signs of sun damage & of course aging (can't really escape that one).  I have been using this product for a little over a month & so far have experienced positive results.  I find one pump is more than enough product to lightly cover my entire face.  I apply eye cream first, then this serum, then my tinted moisturizer with SPF 15.  Normally I apply a bronzing powder & blush over the moisturizer because if I don't my face looks shiny.  Using this serum, even with over a week of highs in the upper 80's / lower 90's & working outdoors, my skin remains dry & smooth.  I have never experienced anything like it.  If this was the winter, I doubt I'd be able to use a serum such as this.
In the evening after washing my face I again apply my eye cream, then this serum & then pure organic argan oil.  In the morning my skin is not greasy, it is smooth & dry.  Once I went to bed & forgot to apply the argan oil.  My skin burned a little & felt very tight.  When I woke up the next morning I applied a little argan oil.  Aside from that I have nothing negative to report.
I was very concerned that it would cause my skin to burn & turn red (called blushing in the instructions).  This has not happened, nor has my skin flaked.  I think my skin looks a little brighter & even toned, but considering the short amount of time I've been using this, I could just be seeing what I want to see (sorry but I tend to be pretty skeptical of products like this).
I anticipate this bottle will last a long time.  I'm very curious to see what the end results are after long time use.  I will return to post any relevant updates should they arise.  Overall, I think this is worth trying if you can afford it, but I'm not too sure this is something you would want to use in the winter unless you have excessively oily skin.
UPDATE 7-15-15 (was 5 stars at time of original review):
This lasted a little over 2 months.  I do not feel that the results are worth the price.  I think it improved very very minor marks but not the more noticeable marks.  I do think it improved my skin (hence not rating it any lower than 4 stars) but I don't feel it delivered the kind of results it promised.

The real original formula had a sublime blend of menthol and eucalyptus and came in a glass flask that perfectly fit your hand. It was a classic. Then, I'm guessing, some bonehead in the marketing department decided it was time for a product facelift. Uh, no. That's what Coca-Cola did when they introduced New Coke some years ago. We all know how that turned out. The new formulation is very heavy on the menthol. It reeks of it. If you fancy going out on the town smelling like a cough drop, by all means, grab a bottle of this poor imitation of the original while you can. And the rest of us former users, let's hope the original original comes back - in its original packaging. Now if you'll excuse me, I have to go wash this stuff off my face.

reviewText: I tried this out for the first time before my wedding, risky I know! But the color was so easy to apply, turned out great and now I'm hooked! Well worth the money for a quick fix!

I have tried quite a few self tanners and I have to say this is by far up there in the rankings. This self tanner took the number one spot for a couple reasons. It lasts- this is one of the bigger issues I've experienced while using these types of products. This tanner specifically lasts for at least a week on me before I notice it really fading. This product looks better (deeper and more settled) on the 2nd and 3rd day following application. I would highly suggest using the St. Tropez tanning mitt with this product to avoid streaking. The mitt is super soft and is hand washable. One obvious negative is the price. However, you are paying for a high quality product that doesn't have a strong DHA smell. This smells delicious for the first few hours after applying. Even after the pleasant smell goes away, you aren't left with too strong of a DHA. I always recommend applying tanning products at night after you shower and exfoiliate. The color of this tanner is golden brown. There aren't any traces of orange or green; it is that perfect inbetween! It will lighten slightly after your first shower because the color guide will wash away. However, I notice a deepening of the tan after the first few days which I love! I will definitely be repurchasing this in the future!
summary: The Best Self Tanner (No Strong DHA Smell, Gold Brown Color)

My other complaint is that I find it to clog my pores and not go on in a smooth fashion; at least not on my face!  I tested on the inside of my wrist and it blended rather nicely.  It was smooth but not dried out.  When I wet my arm It did not run, nor streak.

I believe the issue has to do with the fact that I have large problematic pores.  The powder feels dry when applying to my face and it seems caked, especially in the nose region.  Personally I cannot use this shade or apply for the advertised flawless finish.  My face appeared cakey, feathery and dry.

Do not recommend this shade if you are light skinned ir if you have large pores.  You will find that it clogs your face and leaves it feeling dry.  I really did want to like it.

reviewText: I absolutely LOVE Dermablend makeup line. They have truly come up with a foundation and concealer that blends amazingly. There is never that caked on layered look. I like that I can build on top of it and have that flawless blend that I have always sought after with my makeup but have not been able to obtain until now. This particular stick matched amazingly with my own skin tones and blended in just as well. It is so easy to apply. You just open by twisting the top and you squeeze some out on a finger or a sponge and apply like you would any other makeup.
