Let me preface this by saying that I have sensitive skin and am required to shave every day for work. For this reason, I have a routine I follow when shaving which includes a pre-shave ointment, using an older-style double edged safety razor, and post shave balm. I've tried LOTS of products, both pre/post shave as well as shave creams. As a pre-shave ointment, this product worked well but was not the best that I've used for a few reasons. One of the main reasons is the requirement to apply it to a warm cloth and place on your face. I prefer to take a warm shower and then apply a pre-shave ointment I can leave on my face for a few minutes while I do other things. With that said, it performed fairly well in softening my facial hair. I will likely continue to use Proraso Pre-Shave Proraso Pre-Shave Cream, Sensitive Skin, 3.6 oz (100 ml). As an after-shave, I did find it very refreshing. I typically place a cool cloth on my face to combat irritation and adding this to the cloth was refreshing. My face did feel better after using this versus only the cool towel. With that said, again, it does take some time to go through this process. If I'm in a hurry, I will continue to use my go-to post-shave balm. Bottom Line: This is a nice product and works well; however, it requires some extra time and steps in your shaving cream. I will continue to use it from time to time when able but it likely won't be a part of my daily shave routine.
summary: Good Product but Adds Time to Shaving Routine

First let me say, holy moly this is one of the best beauty products I have ever purchased. It does exactly what it promises and is super fast and easy to use. They were both ecstatic with the results. I then tried it on my long naturally wavy (color-treated) hair. I was simply amazed. I have never gotten as good results from a salon visit. I have this in "champagne silk."  I got it on a whim; I haven't tried many Jane Iredale makeup products before (just the lip and cheek tints).  I have a full size container but it is pretty small (smaller than your average lip gloss).

I'm mostly happy with it.  I chose this color because I thought it would be nice for a highlight color for the inner corners of my eyes, to brighten things up a bit.  It works for that quite well.  By the time I apply this, I already have on primer (I am using Urban Decay Primer Potion) and powder shadow.  I have not attempted to put this over my whole eyelid.  I have oily eyelids and powder products really work better for me over the whole lid.  But I don't like using standard shadow brushes for the inner corner of my eye, hence my selection of this.

This has a standard doefoot applicator of the type you see for liquid products of this consistency.  It does allow for fairly precise application to the desired spot.  After I dot a bit on, I blot/smudge it a little.  The texture at this stage is pretty good but not perfect.  I can't decide if I'd rather it have a bit more of a liquid consistency or something else.  There's just something slightly off in my mind.  It's certainly not bad enough to be a deal breaker (especially if I can't even articulate the issue well).  I can see it being a bigger problem over the whole eyelid, though.  (I can't say whether the texture issue would be the same across all colors since I've only tried the one.)  It is definitely possible to use only a small amount of this, if that's what you want (it was for me).

The color is nice.  I am the palest foundation shade and this shows up well both over darker shadow and on my bare skin.  I think it is opaque enough that it would look lovely on darker skin tones, as well.  It is not too sparkly and it is suitable for daytime wear (at least *I* think so), but there is a subtle shimmer.

This dries quickly and does not flake.  It is also not irritating; I have sensitive eyes and wear contact lenses, so this is an important feature for me.  Overall, I am basically happy with this -- it really does make a good inner corner highlighter for me, in terms of color and ease of application.
summary: "champagne silk" is good as an inner corner highlighter for the eye

reviewText: my fave

The English-language portion of the polyglot silver label of the box of Vichy Liftactiv Supreme says that a user's face will look relaxed and freshened after seven days' use, twice a day.  I have been following my normal pattern of moisturizing my face after showering in the morning and after I clean my face before going to bed.  My face does feel smooth and fresh, but I cannot really judge whether its condition has improved because I'm using this product.  My "normal" skin that has been covering my face for many, many years, just feels very good.

The cream itself has a mild fragrance that I didn't notice once I'd applied it.  It did not burn my eyes.  A very small amount goes a long way, and there is no feeling of gumminess that I've experienced with other products that claim to minimize fine lines.

I tend to be very skeptical of some claims that I read on labels and websites, and that applies to the superiority of water from a volcanic spring in France when used in a facial moisturizer.  The product itself, though, passes the test, whatever its claims.  Very pleasant product, soft, moisturized face - that's good enough for me.
summary: Lovely moisturizer; ignore the hype on the website and label

I have used XEN-TAN dark tan creams and they have worked well for me, going on smoothly and subtly on my very light, white skin. But this one went on dark with a hint of orange. As I said, I'm very, very white, so someone with darker natural skin color may have an entirely different experience. I do think XEN-TAN makes the best self tanners available. I have been impressed with how different they are from even the St. Tropez and Clinique faux tanners that I used to like. My favorite XEN-TAN is the XEN-TAN Mousse Intense Weekly Tan, which has a wonderful vanilla scent, goes on ultra-smoothly, and gives a more subtle, buildable tan that lasts.
summary: A cut above other brands of self tanners, but not as good as some other XEN-TAN products

I like the soft scent and full volume of suds that I get with just a bit of this shampoo.  I find it works best if I don't use a moisturizer afterwards, especially in the summertime.  In the cooler months, I just use a bit on the ends.

Cannot say a lot about powder itself, but dispenser is horrible. Only a little bit powder came out of dispenser, and I followed instruction which was in the box. Will not buy again. For this price I expected much easy application.

I have middle of my back super straight very fine/thin hair. I saw some reviews for this and thought it may give me those sexy beachy waves my husband loves so much - so I asked for it for Christmas.

I really want to love this iron, but I don't.

Not sure if it's because I HATE the short clamp part, because it takes twice as long to curl my hair, or it just doesn't work well with fine/thin hair (pulls out a few hairs every time I use it)...I found I was using my old iron more and more. Gave it one more shot today and had to finish up my other regular iron as I was running out of time. I finally gave up today and decided to have this returned and go back to my regular iron.

Guess I'll be asking for a different present :/
summary: Not the best for fine/thin hair - returning it

reviewText:
Obviously I don't use it but my wife asked for it for Christmas.  Since I've known her, she has always either used a flat iron straightener to "wave" her hair or did those rollers that are pinned to her hair for several minutes.  She's said she's always used one or the other even when growing up.

I know that getting "dolled up" is an ordeal for a woman but I've always appreciated her efforts.  But because sometimes it's a PITA, she leaves her hair straightened or pinned up the majority of the time.

What I like is that she can get those hot, sexy waves in a matter of minutes.  This thing is awesome.  I've watched her do her hair and it shaves a ton of time and the end results are as good as any barrel rollers or whatever you ladies call it use.

Highly recommended!
summary: Bought For My Wife, Makes Curling Your Hair a Breeze

reviewText: Love it !!!

I Love this curling iron! It has become my go to curling tool for my thick coarse hair. I bought the S1 and the Pro. After using them both I decided to keep the S1. I did a video comparing the two.
[...]

I am only giving it three stars because it broke after only six months, some kind of electrical problem,  and according to their warranty policy you must pay a $15 evaluation fee plus $20 shipping for them to decide if the damage is covered by the warranty.  Aside from the fact that a $129 curling iron should last much longer than six months, I really did love it while it worked.  It was super simple to use and produced great results.  Sadly I will not be purchasing another one, it's just too expensive not be to be more reliable!

I ordered the Beachwaver S1 and got it around the holidays.  I have been using it on a regular basis and love the style and way my hair holds a curl.  I was greatly disappointed with only 4 months of use it stopped working.  I was sure to take care of not wrapping the cord.  For a product that costs as much as it does, I am sad that the company doesn't produce a product that is durable.
summary: I have been using it on a regular basis and love the style and way my hair holds a curl

reviewText: I want to begin by saying that I do LOVE this Iron. However, It stopped working after 3 months. A lot of money for something that doesn't work after 3 months!! I looked into warranty options and apparently if you don't register it within 14 days of purchase, you forfit the warranty. SO BUMMED OUT! This was the second beachwaver I purchased. The first lasted 2 years of fairly regular use. Which I felt was fair enough for the price. But 3 months - not good at all.

The Burberry Brit Splash provides a very nice scent.  I like the smell of the splash and my wife loves the splash.  She generally only likes certain men's cologne products, like CK One, but she really likes the Burberry.  It actually caught me by surprise as she kept taking about how much she likes how it smells.  The Burberry would make a great gift as it comes in nice box and the bottle is nice as well.  I don't like the spray cap and find it hard to take off at times.  Outside of the spray cap the bottle looks good and presents itself well.  I would buy the Burberry again, and I'm sure my wife will make me buy it over other products.  I would even consider giving it as a gift to my dad.
wasn't worth the money I paid for it
Good

I love this product and have been using it for a couple of years now.  At first the idea of shampoo and conditioner in one product made no sense to me because I have always been careful to rinse very thoroughly after shampooing, but then to leave a little conditioner in my hair because it tangles so easily.  It astounds me that this product really works!!!  My only mistake when I first started using it was actually in not rinsing it out thoroughly enough.  It cleans the hair very well, allows for a very comfortable comb-through of my fine hair, and leaves it feeling silky. In addition, it doesn't harm your hair if you want to use it every day.
summary: More than a time saver...it's a great hair product

reviewText:
READ THIS!!!

I first have to say, I don't typically write reviews UNLESS the product blows me away, which is rare. To give you a little background about my hair. I had extremely HEALTHY, LONG, THICK blonde hair! It fell to the middle of my back, It was absolutely beautiful. I went to get it colored to give it a break from the highlights, I was going to change it to a strawberry blonde, which I have been many times before and other than blonde, its the only other color I like on me. When I went to the salon, they messed up the color. I ended up with hot pinkish, purple roots and a grayish auburn, mid-shaft to ends. I was in the salon that day for 7 and a half hours. They had to bleach my entire head and leave it on to get all of the screwed up colors out of my hair, resulting to EXTREME chemical damage and breakage. I went in with my hair being all one length to having bangs that were never even cut into my hair. My hair was destroyed and they had to take over 5inches off just to get the ends to LOOK healthy. My hair now sits on my shoulders and has broken pieces all over the top and mid section and all around my hair line. I have literally cried about this since it happened 5 weeks ago. It took me forever to get my hair exactly the way I wanted it and now I am starting over. My hair is no longer manageable, it is kinky and dry and looks it! The salon I had gone to was a new salon closer to where I moved. Prior to this salon I had been going to my original hairstylist for 15 years (I'm 30) so half of my life one person has touched my hair. I live two hours from her now so I decided to give a different salon a try and it was a mistake. I will now be driving 2 hours to go to her every 8 weeks. I texted her about 2 weeks after this all happened and she told me right away to order this product. I didn't hesitate. I ordered it and received it the beginning of this week. I have used it twice so far and I will tell you what, after the first time I noticed a difference! I am excited to see after a couple months and using this 3 times a week (Extremely damaged hair should use it more than once a week). I also have been sleeping with it on over night which I notice gives me better results. This is not a conditioning treatment, so it does need to be shampooed out. I have a feeling this product will be what saves my hair. I will post before and after pictures once I actually do my hair so you can see the difference!
Item arrived wrapped in plastic but the bottle had broken and half of the product spilled.

reviewText: This product saved my hair after being bleached and ombred. No color fade, just healthy hair after use.

This product may not be authentic, I've not had any improvement in my hair health when I use this product.
Also, if you use this product for protection when highlighting, the processing time is lengthened considerably, lift
is diminished and you are advised to go up a volume level. This is causing even more damage in my opinion.
I bought all three products and followed instructions. If you have very thick dark hair, perhaps it'll seem to help
for you, but really don't advise use if you have fine or fragile hair. Just use your typical products and a shorter
processing time, lower volume developer. This is my opinion after months of use.
summary: but really don't advise use if you have fine or fragile hair

reviewText: I buy olaplex all the time bought through Amazon and it definitely was not olaplex.

NOT FAKE!
I compared both the professional and take home versions and this product, and they are exactly the same.
My hair was so broken off and damaged from repeated bleaching and blow drying, that I was afraid to color it myself and went to a salon to coloring.  The salon coloring made me hair even worse and I thought I was going to have to cut it short and start growing it out all over again.  I literally had to put conditioner on it just to keep it from frizzing out all over the place (it is naturally curly).
But then I tried this Olaplex and my hair is soft, shiny and beautiful again and the curls are bouncy and healthy looking.  I noticed a difference in after just one treatment, and now that I am on my second treatment, I'm buying another bottle for travel.  I can't believe this stuff is so inexpensive yet, so powerful!
summary: NOT A FAKE!!  This product is a miracle worker!

reviewText:
First this does work. Yes, it looks odd. But yes, your teeth will feel clean. This is an amazing brush because you only have to charge it twice a year. Which if you like to travel you can bring this tooth brush with you and not have to worry about it dying on you. It does last for 365 uses on each charge but I use my ISSA tooth brush twice a year. The brush has eight different adjustable speeds, which have this pulse that pulsates at around 11,000 per minute. The brush has the ability to  create micro-sweeps that break up stains and remove the plaque that is living on your teeth. Oh, before I forget I was able to try this at a discount in order to give my honest opinion and share my review. PLUS! This is very soft, and gentle on your gums, as well as your enamel. Your enamel is very important because you aren't able to build it back.
AND! this will save you money if you have a different electronic sonic tooth brush because you only have to change the brush head once a year!!! YES, you can replace the brush head once a year. The brush has silicone bristles that are very gentle on your gums, to promote great gum help and helps to prevent gum recession.

I'm a fairly hairy woman with brown skin who has been desperately looking for a low-cost, painless solution for hair removal. I've tried laser hair removal twice already. The hair has definitely been reduced from what it was originally, but it isn't completely gone yet. So I wanted to find something that I could do at home where I can retouch the area myself as needed instead of spending thousands for additional rounds of treatment at a Skin Care facility.

I found this product after a TON of research on the internet. It's very difficult to find at-home laser technology that works on brown skin. This product claimed to be the only one that can safely do it. I read many reviews and pondered the purchase for days before finally taking the leap and purchasing it. As the reviewers promised, it is definitely a painless process (there's a slight sting when you put it to the highest level) and it's very quick. However, I waited the full recommended time (7 weeks) and haven't seen any reduction in hair. Especially on my face, the hair is just as stubborn as it was before I started using this product. On my legs it seemed like it was working for a little bit, but after stopping I can see that the hair is coming right back.

If you want something that works, DON'T PURCHASE THIS PRODUCT. If they plan to advertise that it'll work on brown skin, they should make sure it does. I returned this product and am waiting for my refund.
summary: I waited the full recommended time (7 weeks) and haven't seen any reduction in ...

reviewText:
I'm 41 and I've got reasonably decent skin as far as wrinkles go. I started wearing sunblock (good ones like Obagi or Skinceuticals) daily for the last 8 or 9 years. But I am incredibly fair and have a LOT of freckles. I've had IPL 3 times, which has significantly lightened the freckles and a large birthmark. So we're working from a different place here than if you've never had IPL and have lots of freckles. Skip to the end for info about dark spot correction.

I've had the Tria laser for about a week and a half. As far as pain, it's like a baby IPL sting. IPL feels to me like a lighter close up to your skin with an accompanying rubber band snap. The Tria is not as uncomfortable. It hurts more on tenderer skin under the eyes than on the forehead. But it does burn. And the burning gets worse after you're done treating. It feels like a bad sunburn for a half hour or so and then maybe is mildly, and decreasingly tender over the next 24 hours. If you are sensitive to pain, this may be too much. If you're the kind of person that doesn't blink at 40% glycolic acid on your face, no worries. I've had some minor blotchy redness that lasts 12 hours or more but isn't particularly noticeable. It's the kind of thing I notice about myself and no one else sees.

I haven't treated every day, letting my skin have a little time to heal up and flake off in between. I can't say yet that this will be a miracle cure for the 11 wrinkles between my eyes but I feel like it is doing something. I've had dysport once just between the eyes and it wore off about a month ago so I am hoping the Tria works for that. I'll follow up if I have more to say about a scar on my forehead, 11 wrinkles and the wrinkles it's actually supposed to treat. I think it will possibly help with that, but I feel it's too soon to say. But what I really bought this thing for is dark spots. Yeah, I know that's off label, but it works for that for sure.

As I said, I've had IPL. The first time, I had sooo many freckles and lots of them turned dark and flaked off. The next two times, really nothing happened as I think the setting was too low. Also, they did not get particularly close to my eyes where the goggles were and it left me with what I referred to as cheetah spots at the outside corners of my eyes. After a week and a half of 3 days on and 2 days off, those cheetah spots are fading away. Like IPL, the pigmented areas turn darker and then flake off in little flecks over the next few days. My experience has been that IPL mostly made my freckles much lighter, with a few disappearing and many still lightly visible. This seems to be doing the same thing.

I'll try to update on results, assuming I continue to use it. The thing was the same sale price at Sephora as it is currently on here ($150) and so far, it pretty much achieved the results of one IPL treatment for the cost of essentially one IPL treatment so if it does anything else, bonus.

What an impressive curling iron!!  At first I was shocked at the price for this iron.  Then after I studied how it was made and what options were available for it, I saw why it is priced like it is.  First of all this is certainly made to last and last and last.  This iron will hold up to commerial use but for the everyday user what you are going to get is a lot of versatility.  It allows interchangeable barrels which are for sale elsewhere on Amazon or on the internet.  Those barrels are as follows:

1) 1 inch clip barrel---for defined curls
2) 1 inch straight barrel--for undone waves (whatever that means??  LOL)
3) .75 inch tapered barrel---for tousled waves
4) 1.5 inch straight barrel---for loose waves

Already comes with a 1.25 inch clip barrel for polished curls.

Intelligent digital technology.  An internal microchip controls temperature fluctuation ensuring even, optimal heat.  This is a nice feature.  Prevents burning of hair, I would hope.
Also note the following:
Ceramic barrels, 5 heat settings (WOW!), Auto world voltage and 1 hour auto shut-off

When I pulled this item up on Amazon I saw that this review would be the first so I tried to give you a lot of information.
Mostly because this is a pricey curling iron when first viewed but I think that when you consider all of the issues that
I have tried to share with you I think you can see what it is more expensive that a "usual" curling iron.

Highly recommended

reviewText: All good...thank you!

Beautifully packaged. The smooth, rectangular tube weighs twice as much as Wet 'n Wild cheap packaging on its sometimes very good quality but miserably packaged lipsticks. I often buy inexpensive lip products, so this finer packaging really feels luxurious to me. The color, Lucky, is similar to many of the neutral's on Colourpop's site. I just bought a bunch of those, so they're easy to compare. I'd say Lucky is just a bit pinker than CP's Magic Wand, quite a bit pinker than CP's Chi (my favorite). It is matte, but a touch shinier than I expected, which I actually like. It moisturizes nicely, which I expected from the ingredients. What surprised me was the amount of fragrance and plumping ingredients. The primary plumping ingredient is the Menthoxypropanediol. Its penetration is enhanced by the Tribehenin. It's the Menthoxypropanediol that gives the slightest menthol scent. I did experience some tingling from these and saw the slightest bit of lip plumping, but only when I applied the lipstick somewhat more thickly than usual. I also tested the lipstick by applying a ColourPop Ultra Matte to one side of my lips and this to the other side and definitely saw plumping. Supposedly, lip plumping ingredients often cause irritation, but I haven't had that problem from this product or any other. I do like it.
summary: Beautifully packaged, lip plumping lipstick with several frangrance ingredients

reviewText:
The Obagi products I have tried thus far have been very good. I expected to feel the same about this product, but instead I have mixed feelings. I have gone through probably 10 tubes of La Roche-Posay Effaclar Duo, which is a 5.5% benzoyl peroxide cream. I LOVE it, but figured this Clenziderm Lotion would perform similarly because it has 5% benzoyl peroxide. I have also used PanOxyl 10% Foaming Wash, as well as several other OTC benzoyl peroxide products (usually around 2.5%).

Although it is effective at obliterating acne and keeping it at bay, this Clenziderm lotion feels very harsh to me. It has a sting after application that stays around for a good 15-20 minutes before going away. It also makes my skin red wherever I apply it (and it stays red for a while too). Now, as mentioned above, I am no stranger to benzoyl peroxides of this strength. I have also used many AHA/glycolics on my skin and have tolerated them very well. I am not someone with particularly sensitive or reactive skin. I have even used Panoxyl 10 as a face mask in the past, which was slightly irritating but it went away as soon as I washed it off (I don't know if it is "recommended" in the usage directions, so take that idea with a grain of salt ;)).

Although I like Obagi Clenziderm Lotion enough to finish it, I don't believe I would purchase another tube because of the irritation--and more so because it doesn't dethrone La Roche-Posay Effaclar Duo. I have been using Clenziderm solely as a spot treatment, and I like it for that purpose.

I grabbed this because I do enjoy a good toner/mist/whatever spray (lately I've been using rosewater). And bliss is known for their great spa and beauty products. This Triple Oxygen Radiance Restoring Mist sounds great, and when you get it home to try it, it's a sleek pump bottle that's easy to use, you just shake and pump to spray a fine mist that has a lovely but not overbearing citrus fragrance on your face. I've been using this for a week or two now, with and without make-up (it doesn't affect my make-up, which is nice when you're wearing it and want to feel a little more refreshed or to make your skin feel a little more 'dewy'), and while I can't say it's done wonders for it, it does help my skin feel better after I put it on.
Reason it's not five stars? The second ingredient is alcohol denat. (denatured alcohol), and while I know that the kind used in these products isn't supposed to be the 'drying' kind, there's a lot of other rather long-worded ingredients as well. When you can find something with essential oils in it (which is important, especially in the heat) and little else for a bit cheaper....

A long time ago I had a little aerosol spray of purified water next to my desk. It was intended as a refresher, and also helped with dry eyes (I wore contacts back then). It was nice. Every so often, I would use it and it was kind of like taking a little break. I haven't seen those around in a long time, but this looked kind of like it, so I decided to try it out.

It is pump, not aerosol, which is fine. In fact, maybe more than fine, as the aerosol cans never seem to hold as much as the pump versions, so perhaps it will last longer that way.

I was a bit skeptical. Okay, more than a bit. The claims like oxygenation of your skin, the fact that it contains vitamin C, but you don't ingest it, all seems a bit hokey to me. However, I gave it a fair shot and sprayed it on my face (with my eyes closed, as they recommend), and it was nice. Refreshing, like my old plain water spray, but also has a nice light natural scent that reminds me of licorice and bananas. Nothing strong - this isn't perfume by any means. Just enough scent to be pleasant. I also found that my skin felt softer afterward. I'm really not sure why, but it was true.

Overall, I like this. It is kind of like a little portable pick-me-up that would be great after coming inside from the heat, or just to break up a long day. I took off a star because it is crazy overpriced. The profit margins on this thing must be stunning. However, it does the job, and I enjoyed it.

Sean Logue, 2016

The number of samples was very nice. This was my first trip into the world of sports nutrition. I am glad the Prime Sample program motivated me to try them.

Here is why I won't be a customer:

I eat relatively healthy and sometimes I treat myself to a bit of candy or something. Other than when I treat myself, I don't eat a lot of sugar. I don't drink a lot of sugar.

All of the samples were, in my opinion, overly sweet. Not the nice sweet you get from real sugar but grossly sweet. Still fighting with the artificial aftertaste of one of the bars.

After checking the labels I don't think (most of) this food is health food and I don't think it tastes like a treat.

Perhaps the pre-workout stuff is good for hardcore bodybuilders or so.

For regular, active people - I believe - natural food is the better choice (and cheaper). Organic eggs, organic peanut butter, unsweetened whey/plant-based powder, nuts .. there are so many ways to get a lot of protein.

And I am not a strong believer in artificial vitamins. They put a lot of those into some of the products. If vitamins it has to be from wholefood.

Nah .. it's not for me. Healthy food is natural, a treat is a treat.

PS: OMG the chips were like so gross

What I received:
4 regular size bars
1 regular size protein shake

Sample sized:
bag of almonds
bag of chips (OMG they are SO gross)
3 whey powders
1 tab for a drink
1 energy sour candy thingy (haven't tried yet, feels like gel)
1 pre-workout gel
3 diet pill caps

If I was one to actually paint my nails a color, I would definitely try some something from LondonTown, but unfortunately with my nails as short as they are clear or a light nude color is all I'm comfortable wearing. The R+Co Twister Curl Primer is quite runny, so you can expect to use this up pretty quickly. WOW, I cannot say enough good things about this company! To start their products are top of the line, they have a unique and very pleasant aroma. The sweetness of the Tabaco along with the other scents blend together to create a scent that is reminiscent of the prohibition. However, the most valuable asset this company posses is their customer service. 18.21 Man Made went out of their way to correct a mistake that I made, there was absolutely no obligation for them to assist me. Its this type of service that is lost on many companies and I for one chose to  be a life long customer to a company that provides impeccable products and service as 18.21 Man Made does.

I like it a lot.

This comes cutely packaged in a little brown box. The labels on the box are all stylized to match the product. It says it is made in the US. The bottle itself is a spray bottle. The perfume sprays pretty evenly and finely. The smell is a little more masculine, especially when first sprayed, but I could see a man or woman wearing it. The scent is sweet with the tobacco scent prominent. Not like a smoke scent, rather the scent of pip tobacco before you smoke it. It also has a frankincense smell to it. That makes it almost addictive to sniff. It settles in nicely and isn't too overpowering in any way. It isn't strongly musk or floral or anything like that. Maybe a little myrrh that I can pick up. Mainly just vanilla, tobacco, and frankincense scent.

This is an awesome fragrance. It seems the price has gone up online for it (back[?] to MSRP?). This might partly be my fault for talking about it on Basenotes/Fragrantica/Facebook group(s)... haha. Still worth it at $80.

If you're a fan of Tobacco Vanille or by Kilian Back to Black, then check this one out! It is a sweet fragrance, so if you're not a fan of sweet fragrances, then maybe try to sample first.

reviewText: This is not a moisturizer and I wouldn't call it a serum.  It doesn't offer any protection from the sun.  What it does is help smooth out those little lines.  It's actually a rather effective primer, and that's how I use it.  After I wash my face, the first thing I reach for is a facial serum.  I use three different kinds, depending on the day and which bathroom I'm in at the time.  I'm a believer is serums and they are always the first thing I feed my skin after washing.  After that, I use a good quality moisturizer with a decent SPF.  After my skin has absorbed that, I use a tiny bit of this cream.  A little goes a long way.  To me it feels like it's creating a thin layer all across my face, absorbing just enough to equalize everything - fill in the gaps, so to speak.  Afterwards, makeup goes on with similar results as when I use a primer.
summary: Doesn't replace the serum or moisturizer I use.  Acts similarly to a primer.

reviewText: Looks awesome on my eyes. Doesn't smudge or run after even a full day of wear and still wipes off easily with makeup face wipe cleanser. Definitely worth the upscale price.

I like to use mud masques as they do detox and purify your skin. I especially like them in the summer when I'm spending lots of time outside and in the garden. They are good, but can be messy.

This masque made less of a mess then my jar. It's a bit tricky to put on and clean up is about the same. I did like it although you only get four masques in the box, where a jar can last longer.

My skin looked clean and felt great.

After using this, my face felt really smooth and my pores did look smaller and smoother. This really is less messy than a regular mud mask. I just put my hair back and peeled the backing off of the bottom part of the mask and pressed it on my face. Once it was stuck, I peeled off the front cover of the mask, so it would be able to dry and so that I could better smooth the mask onto my face. Then I did the same thing with the top part of the mask.

The directions say to let it dry for about 10 minutes, and I assume the longer it dries the better the results would be. I waited a bit over 10 minutes. It was dry in some spots, but not in the places where the mask overlapped a bit and the mud was thicker. Still, I was impatient and peeled it off. It is easy to peel off if you pull up a corner and get it started. After which, I rinsed my face. It really was easy and way less mess than a regular mud mask. The results were pretty good too.

This is the least messy mud masque I have ever used.  It is a little tricky to apply but once you get it in place it is fine.  It says to let it dry for 10 minutes, I left it on a little longer.  It peels off easily, and I just rinsed my face with water afterwards.  My face felt soft and moisturized.  This makes using a mud masque so much easier, I will probably do it more often since I have these instead of the mud in a jar.
summary: Easiest mud masque I have ever used

My daughter bought the Ahava Foam-Free Silk Shave Cream as a gift for me when she took a trip to Israel. I tried using it as an electric pre-shave for use with my rotary razor. I had recently bought myself a new, high-end shaver and was having some of the early-use, break-in period irritation you might expect when you start electric shaving or switch to another unit. (She also bought me the after-shave cream, which is really, really nice but very expensive if you're used to supermarket-priced guy stuff like me and don't go for salon/designer products.)

I use the Ahava shave cream very sparingly, much more like a skin lotion in a very thin application than a full-blown, full-bodied shave cream or gel. Just that small amount on my damp beard allows the electric razor to glide over my face smoothly, without irritation. The cream (or lotion) is just rich enough to remain after the shave and give you a smooth feeling and leave you with a nice scent, even after shaving over it with the rotary (I don't wash with soap and water after the shave--that, I believe, would just undo the good of the lotion and perhaps even irritate my sensitive skin after the shave). I just give my skin a quick rinse with a little water, enjoy the smoothness, then gently dry.

It leaves me with a great shave, a good feeling, no irritation or burn, and even still a hint of the pleasant scent.

So, don't even think of using this as you would a normal shave cream. You'll use it up quickly (it's expensive!) and you'll feel like it wasn't worth it. Use it as an electric pre-shave lotion, sparingly, and it does a GREAT job! And it lasts quite a long time when applied in an amount about the size of a US nickel. Highly recommended if you can justify/afford the initial outlay.

If you're like I was most of my life and enjoy a blade shave, I can't attest to how well this would suit you.

reviewText:
I am a huge fan of L'occitane, and this candle is part of their wonderful Verbena line. The scent is fresh, crisp, and clean. There is no floral notes at all, which I love. It has a lemonly-herbal aroma that cuts right through odors and doesn't need to be burned very long in order to fill your home with its fragrance. I love to burn it after cooking, or after I've cleaned my home to create a feeling of true freshness.

It can be very strong, so I use one upstairs and one downstairs in my home. The candle burns cleanly, though it does smoke rather badly when I first put it out. It comes in a beautiful glass container with a metal lid, which I keep on my candle in between burnings. The only real downside to this candle is that there is some citronella in it, which can smell a little like a cheap citronella candle when its been burned for a while. It does help to repel insects, but I would rather that the citronella was toned down some. I still love it, though. This is the only citrus candle that I've found that actually smells like citrus.

It just doesn't work that well. Usually I can get one big curl out of it that lasts about ten seconds before it falls flat again.

reviewText: I am IMPRESSED with this product!  I didn't buy this on Amazon....but I will in the future.  I posted a question about how to use the product and got multiple responses which I think was key to my success. I used 2 pumps on my fine, super straight hair that is below my chin in length but not quite to my shoulders. I seriously had to resist the urge to use more....it didn't seem like enough... but it was great. First I used the blow dryer to partially dry my hair then worked the two pumps of mousse throughout my damp hair. Then finished blow drying with a round brush. I roll sections in the brush, blow with hot air then set with cool air. I was REALLY impressed with the big curls I was able to achieve. Also my hair stayed smooth and didn't frizz which it tends to do. The frizzing is weird to me because my hair is so straight but some products seem to cause that -- this one smoothed it out. So even with "big curls" from the round brush my hair ends up straight but it felt full and bouncy all day AND it held the style. I also back-comb a bit and finish with Kenra hairspray.  Also my hair felt really soft. I suspect that the people who have had a bad experience with their hair feeling crunchy or sticky afterward may have used too much. I've had that happen in the past but I think it's partly because it's so tempting to feel like you need a lot of product. I have used TONS of volumizing products and this one is the first to truly impress me with the very first use!
summary: So glad I asked how to use this!

reviewText: Don't waste your money!  $59.50 is RIDICULOUS!!!..  I misread the amount that was being charged. I thought I was paying $39.50.  Totally not worth it.

At first I thought this would be a great switch from Oil Cleansing because it's not a soap, unfortunately I had the same reaction as another reviewer on my second use. I used this one morning and followed with my normal routine, then I went to work. When I took off my makeup that evening I realized I was horribly broken out and chalked it up to adding something new to my routine. So, prepared to ride it out, I did the same routine again and went to bed. A few minutes after going to bed my face started to sting, itch, and burn intolerably. I washed my face using my standard oil cleansing and the awful feeling, redness and blotches cleared right up. I followed up with my other Kahina products (eye serum, cream, brightening serum, and lotion) and the itching/burning did not return. In the morning my skin was much clearer so I skipped this cleanser again and used my other Kahina products without a problem. If you have sensitive skin, at all, skip this product. It should also be noted that this does NOT adequately remove makeup. When I was finished thoroughly cleansing my skin with this product I had eye makeup leftover in raccoon fashion as well as a lot of foundation left over in my pores. If you're looking for a natural cleanser to get your makeup off at the end of the day this is NOT the one.

I purchased Globlush in the Bare color with the hope of achieving a healthy, natural "flush" without looking like I'm wearing any makeup.  To be honest, I'm not as impressed with Glominerals Globlush as I am with their lip colors.  While there is nothing wrong with the Globlush, I just don't find it to be anything super special.  The blush color stays on just as long as other brand name mineral blushes and the color wasn't all that different from the blushes I already own despite the nomenclature.  Bare is a basic, neutral, flesh color with hints of pink but the pink isn't really noticeable on light-medium or darker skin tones.  I think the healthy "flush" I was looking for might only be visible on someone with an extremely fair complexion.
I will confess that I purchased Bare without having the opportunity to see the color in person and relied solely on descriptions from Glominerals website and blogs, as well as customer comments.  In the end, this purchase wasn't a complete waste because I will eventually use up the blushes I already own and this will save me a trip to the department store makeup counter.  What I had hoped for, however, is something more fabulous than my existing stock, and something that would make me want to abandon all other makeup blush brands in favor of Glominerals.  I gave Globlush 4 stars because it is a solid makeup blush, something I will eventually use, and probably somewhat better quality than most drugstore brands.  Would I purchase Globlush again?  Unlikely.  Would I recommend Globlush to a friend? Not really.
summary: Nothing wrong with Globlush, but nothing special about Globlush either

reviewText: Totally, 100% my HG concealer product! I've used it for about 5 years on my hereditary under eye circles (thank you, Genetics!), on my eyelids & on a few spider veins around my nose. Cargo One Base is what I would call medium coverage so if you want it to cover like a tattoo, I don't think this will do it but it can be layered. For daily wear I like a more natural, "me only better look". I definitely do not want that thick, pasty, Geisha, made-up look & the One Base does that for me while providing a reasonable level of coverage. Dermablend concealer was too thick & pasty for me. The One Base 2.0 color is perfect for my medium fair, neutral toned skin. It is neither too pink, nor is it too yellow so it is what I think of as neutral toned. In the past, when I shopped concealers, they were either way too yellow or too pink for my skin. When I put One Base on, the color almost melts & easily blends right into my skin color which is important as I do not wear foundation. It isn't too oily or drying for my combination skin and doesn't crease on me. It does leave a bit of sheen so after it sets/drys, I brush on a very little skin toned face powder, just enough to knock down the sheen. Definitely a HG product for me!

reviewText: I generally think face masks are woo-woo and mostly useless. Bought this outside of Amazon on a whim, paid about the same price for it. I used it as directed except for the last part - wore it for about 15 minutes and then instead of leaving the goop on my face I washed it off with warm water and then lotioned my skin, which felt mildly burned in the moments immediately after pulling it off . A few thoughts - first, if it touches your lips it's going to burn. Avoid your mouth from the get-go and wipe it clean if it does touch it. Second, this is strong enough that if you have sensitive skin it will burn a bit, hence me rinsing it. I could still feel the chemical exfoliation difference after I used it. Third, it was like using an acne spot treatment all over my face so after sleeping on freshly masked skin overnight, I woke up with mostly clear skin. I'd use it again, but not frequently.
summary: Cleared my skin up, did burn a bit, be sure to avoid any contact with sensitive areas

reviewText:
Ok, so I'm not quite as skeptical or spirited as some of the reviewers.  I knew I was getting Relaxing Fragrant Water and I am ok with that.  The important thing is what makes the water relaxing and fragrant.  And does the relaxing fragrance delight the senses?  Before I ramble on, I did get this for my wife.  She tried and actually used it daily for a week before reviewing.

The scent is quite pleasing but it is not a light scent, nor is it overpowering.  My wife and stepdaughter both agreed it isn't bad.  None of us have a clue what "plastic toy pony" smells like (see other reviews) nor do we care to find out.  I do see that the product description is not very useful - there is no descriptive language about the scent.  My interpretation is a mix of coconut, subtle almond oil, musk, vanilla and some orange essence.

The company claims that the ingredients are 95% natural origin.  They are:  denatured alcohol, water, fragrance, limonene (i.e. lemon/orange oil), benzyl salicylate (i.e.a chemical used in cosmetics),  linalool (i.e. an alcohol chemical found in many flowers and spice plants), citronellal (i.e. citronella/rose/geranium), citral (found in lemon).  Sorry, no plastic toy pony.  Smelled directly, yeah, it is powerful.  Sprayed on in reasonable quantities, it is subtle and provides a good backdrop. I can't say there is any relaxation induced by this - we all found it somewhat energizing.

No side effects (rash, etc) were noted.

Would any of the members of my family buy it again?  I suspect we would not go out of our way to purchase it again, mainly because no one in our house regularly buys fragrant water.  But the whole bottle will be used.  I'll go ahead and give it 5-stars because we all agree that it has a nice scent.

On to the review.
summary: Gentle mist, aromas work in harmony

reviewText:
I absolutely love and adore this and have both the trinity and the mini at home in london.. I brought both with me to the states on holiday for Xmas and somehow the US current made them both go crazy and they blasted me with electricity .. So scary it was almost funny. The UK company kindly and fast sent me 2 new devices and I have with joy been using them at home in london for 6 months and BOY do they work. I am addicted. So much so that I had this little one waiting for me - thank you to amazon.com - in FT Lauderdale when I arrived 2 weeks ago to spend the summer.
My glorious little mini has been used almost daily and I love it. Total love. (Yes, I am repeating myself, but I have never loved a device as much as this - apart from my ninja blender - and I don't want you to think I am a paid complainer).
And now, suddenly, it appears to be charging but it will not start!?  What am I to do, I have  tried to find help online, to call the company, but cannot even find an email address or phone number to get help.
This happened twice to friends I recommended the NuFACE to in London - and I stupidly thought they must have been using the NuFACE wrongly - but there must be a serious problem with the battery.
This truly is an amazing little machine. It Does lift (Really) your skin. But I am at a loss now; here I am, my mini appears alive but is dead, I do not dare to try to open it, and I do not dare to be without it all summer either. Sos please - it is a bit disconcerting that I haven't seen a single response from anyone at NuFACE.  Who is their CEO, owner, knowledgeable person-in-charge? Does anyone know?
And how do I rate this? It deserves a 5 star review - and a minus 5 - so 2.5????

I am extremely fair skinned. I do not tan, I burn or freckle.  I'm picky. If I'm gonna tan it needs to look natural and flawless. Which is why I turned to St. Tropez... You get what you pay for RIGHT? I used the St. Tropez Express (1,2,3 hour) tan all last spring and summer and was VERY happy with it. Loved the olive undertone, loved how easy it was to apply and had mastered the tricky areas like knees, wrists and feet by using a blend of lotion, the tanning mousse and blending it out with a kabuki brush. I bought this dry oil after seeing some YouTube videos of fellow fair skinned ladies saying it was buildable and natural looking compared to other tanning products. I wanted to try it because since I am so fair skinned, I really don't want to be "tan" I just don't want to look sickly. Just want some healthy pigment. As you can see in my picture which I took in natural light, it is very light which is what I wanted.  Happy with the color and how dark it turned out on me (which is not dark at all) It applies very unevenly though. It's hard to apply, there isn't really a tan guard, it's just the color you're going to turn. For example I put it on before bed, wake up take a shower and none of the sparkle, or color comes off. I exfoliated, I shaved, I used the mit. Doesn't work like St. Tropez Express at all. I will definitely be going back to my favorite mousse soon. What I LOVE about the Mousse is that it is truly buildable (1, 2 or 3 hour) and using my kabuki brush trick it is Flawless.
summary: Express Mousse is way better. This is spoltchy.

reviewText: Works great

I like Brit Rhythm very much, and was running low on Burberry London, which is my go-to in colder months. I had come across Rhythm Intense in a magazine ad a while ago, but had a hard time finding it in stores. To me -- and cologne is so subjective -- Rhythm Intense is like a middle ground between Rhythm and London. There's the light / fresh aspects that make Rhythm interesting, but there's also the leathery pipe tobacco thing going. (If you've never smelled London, it's a lot like a spiced pipe tobacco.) Rhythm Intense is a bit trickier to wear, though. It gets overpowering very easily, and takes a while to lighten up. But unlike regular Rhythm, which tends to last for many hours, I find that Rhythm Intense seems to disappear after about 4 - 5 hours. I'd buy it again, for sure. But as a 9 - 5 kind of cologne in fall / winter, I think I'll probably stick with London and use this as more of a "going out" cologne.
summary: Sits between Brit Rhythm and London to me.

These brushes have plastic handles, around 10cm in length, heads are small, the 2 fluffier ones are around 8mm wide. 1 is round, 1 is flat, the 3d is a flat, perfect get-into-the-eye-corner or spot concealer brush.
The fibers are exquisitely soft and the size makes them excellent detail blending brushes.
I've always used brushes with weighty handles (wood or solid heavy acrylic) and I know why; that counter-balance, like a high-quality pen, really makes a difference in application and feel, as do longer handles.
I can get used to these, though, and they'll make great everyday and travel brushes.
summary: Not what I expected but still live up to the Japonesque name.

reviewText: My son loves this product, so I always buy it for him for special occasions.

I have a fair complexion, and I'm generally fine with it. Occasionally, though, a slight tan would be nice. My problem is that if I go in the sun, no matter what I do, I burn. So I slather on the sunscreen and realize I'm never going to be a golden girl.

Xen-Tan is an interesting product. It goes on easily, and it really does create the illusion of a tan. But from the few times I have gotten any kind of tan (usually from when my burned skin gave up the ghost and resigned itself to tanning), I don't recall there ever being any orange cast to it. Let me be clear: I don't look like a popsicle with Xen-Tan. The orangey thing is light, but it is noticeable.

If you're OK with that, this may be the way to go for a good faux tan. I'm sure most people aren't as picky as I am with this sort of thing. For the average person, the tan is fairly realistic.
summary: Probably good for most people; on me, it pulls orangey

I just purchased this product after trying a MUCH more expensive LED light therapy device by Zero Gravity, in the hopes that the results would be similar even if it took longer. This device is AWFUL! There is no cover for the LED lights and I have very deep indentations all over my face in the shape of the LED lights - considering the number of little light bulbs in this product, you can imagine how awful my face looks after having pressed it (gently) into my skin all over! I can't believe how terrible the design is - the Perfectio Plus by Zero Gravity has a smooth cover so the LED light bulbs aren't directly touching your face and you're able to move that device all around (including along the chin/jawline) to help mold and sculpt your face while getting light therapy, unlike this LightStim that has to be held stationary on one part of the face for 3 minutes before moving it elsewhere. I want .a device that I can move around so I can help induce some elasticity and lifting in my jawline, and also a device that I could use and leave home immediately afterwards. It's been 25 minutes and I still have LED light bulb shaped indentations all over my cheeks and forehead.
summary: Leaves long-lasting indentations all over skin - no cover to protect you from the light bulbs and your skin.
